loans.name: Parveen Akhtar M. Arshad Group

texts.en:
Parveen akhtar baji is a 30-year-old lady who has resided in Multan, Pakistan for the last 15 years. Her husband's name is M. A. and he has a business selling embroidered scarves. He buys scarves from the cloth shops, sells to the community and earns an income. Parveen baji performs her duties as a mother and as a wife very efficiently. Her family is very happy with her good nature. She is applying for a loan to buy scarves to expand her husband’s scarf-selling business. 

She is the group leader of two other women from her locality. Mumtaz ilahi baji and Hashmat baji each want a loan to buy scrap for their scrap business. 

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy scarves to sell

loans.name: Bilikisu

texts.en:
Bilikisu is 36 years old and married with four children. She has a shop where she sells shoes, clothes, gift items and bags.

She is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more shoes and bags to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more shoes and bags to sell

loans.name: Ariuntsetseg

texts.en:
Ariuntsetseg M. is a 43-year-old single mother who has one daughter. In 2000, Ariuntsetseg started running a men's and women's clothing apparel business at the Bayanzurh local market. With growth in her business, she now rents two more clothing stalls at the Bumbugur, a bigger market, and has started selling jeans. Once a month, she goes to Ereen, a Chinese border city, to buy jeans for her business. Her family lives in a condo she owns in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia.

Her only daughter, Chinhuslen, is a university student. With her profits, Ariuntsetseg has been paying for her daughter's university tuition. She also pays 240,000 tugriks (~$170 US) a month in stall rent. Her average monthly income is 1,000,000 tugriks, and her working capital is 2,400,000 tugriks. With this loan, she will buy a personal computer for her daughter.

loans.use: To buy a personal computer for her daughter.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.ru: Ахмад- молодой человек, 24 лет, женат имеет одного ребёнка.Занимается продажей в розницу компакт дисками и видеокассетами.Его точка реализации расположена на рынке города Худжанда.Он имеет большой ассортимент дисков на просмотр населению.На увеличение оборотного капитала, компакт дисков он решил взять кредит. Ему посоветовал его близкий друг , который уже несколько раз берёт у нас кредит.Ахмад ознакомившись с программой фонда решил попробовать в кредит расширить свой бизнес.Ему нравятся все условия Микроинвеста.Ахмад на снимке в день мониторинга на месте своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Ahmad is a young man of 24, who is married and has one child. He sells CDs and DVDs retail. His sales outlet is located in the Khujand city marketplace. Ahmad has a wide assortment of discs for people to peruse. He has decided to take out a loan to increase his working capital and compact discs. A close friend, a repeat loan client of MicroInvest, advised him to do so. After acquainting himself with the financing program, Ahmad decided to try a business expansion loan, as he likes MicroInvest's terms. In the photograph, Ahmad is at his place of business on the day MicroInvest visited.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: CD and DVD sales

loans.name: Kalsoom Mai Allah Baksh Group

texts.en:
Kalsoom mai baji has resided in a city named Multan, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband’s name is A. B. and he runs a business selling embroidered scarves. He has four years of experience in this business and collects orders from the clothes shops so as to earn income.

Kalsoom baji plays a very important part in his business. She prepares embroidered scarves for him so that he is able to complete the orders on time. They are both very hardworking people. She is applying for a loan to buy material (cloth, colored thread and beads) to complete the orders of her husband’s business.

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality:

Zarina baji wants a loan to buy material (flour, potatoes, spices and cooking oil) for her business selling Punjabi food.

Nasreen baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine for sewing clothes.

Naseem baji wants a loan to buy iron for making iron rods to sell.

loans.use: To buy material for preparing embroidered scarves

loans.name: Tujikwamue Group

texts.en:
For the last two years, Asia has made a living running a small firewood store and selling juice in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar. She currently earns a monthly income of about $90. Every day she works at her business for eight hours. Asia is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania to buy more firewood, sugar, fruit and other items. She is hoping that this loan will allow her to increase her profits and expand her business.  

Asia is 40 years old, married, and has 10 children. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Husna, who has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more firewood, sugar, fruit and other items for her business.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda J. makes a living selling beans and charcoal at the local market, and is applying for this loan to open her own shop. She is 30 years old and married to a soldier.They have three children, all of whom are in primary school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy additional equipment for her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to open up a shop

loans.name: Sanjar

texts.en:
A. Sanjar is 26 years old, married and has one child. His goals are to grow in his personal life and in his business activities by offering better service to his customers. His dream is that God will provide him with a long life so he can get ahead and fulfill his goals. He is a taxi driver and travels through the streets of Penjikent, Tajikistan in search of customers. He has owned his business for the last two years. Currently Sanjar’s car needs repairs, and he wants to borrow $1,500 for 12 months. The financing will allow him to repair his vehicle and also buy parts he needs, including new tires. Sanjar thanks Kiva and all lenders who make this help possible.      


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is home to a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have viable business propositions. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to fix his car and buy spare parts.

loans.name: Jean Paul

texts.fr: Monsieur S. est un homme marié qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans le quartier de kegue qui est un quartier périphérique de la ville de Lomé. L’activité génératrice de revenu qu’il exerce et qui lui permet de prendre en charge sa famille est la vente des articles de quincaillerie. Il fait face à une rupture de stock , ayant déjà obtenu un crédit de WAGES qu’il a bien remboursé, il sollicite de WAGES un deuxième crédit pour acheter 15 barres de fer, 15 sacs de ciments, 7 boîtes de faume , 10 sacs de chaux, 13 tôles ,10 tuyaux et divers.
texts.en:
Mr. S. is a married man who lives with his wife and children in Kegue, an outlying district of the city of Lomé. He earns an incoming that enables him to provide for his family, and it involves selling hardware products. He is facing an inventory shortage. Having already obtained a WAGES loan that he has repaid, he’s requesting a second loan to buy 15 iron bars, 15 sacks of cement, 7 containers of faume, 10 sacks of lime, 13 sheets of metal, 10 hoses, and various other items.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy construction material and hardware products

loans.name: Ronke

texts.en: Ronke O. is 40 years old, married and has two children. She owns a shop where she sells medicines and various provisions. Ronke is applying for this loan to buy more items to sell to her customers. She extends her thanks to the lenders who make this loan possible.

loans.use: To buy more medicines and provisions to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more cattle

loans.name: Ibrohim

texts.ru: Иброхим- молодой человек 24 лет, пока не женат. Работает учителем по физической культуре для начинающих классов.Его заработная плата не хватает на проживание. Он живёт вместе с родителями, он единственный сын в семье.Кроме своей работы он выходит на продажу напитков, мороженого и молочного коктейля в разлив. Для закупа напитков оптом он решил получить кредит в Микроинвесте. Из-за того, что сейчас сезон данного товара Микроинвест решил поддержать бизнес Иброхима.
texts.en:
Ibrohim is a young man of 24, not yet married. He works as a physical education teacher in an elementary school, but his salary is not enough to live on. He lives with his parents, and is the only son in the family. In addition to his regular job, Ibrohim sells beverages on tap, ice cream and milkshakes. He decided to take out a loan with MicroInvest in order to purchase beverages wholesale, and because it is now the time of year for such products, MicroInvest decided to support Ibrohim's business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of bottled beverages, ice cream and milkshakes

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki has been a juice seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for four years. She belongs to Tujikomboe group loan (Group code 2063). She currently earns an average monthly profit approximately $80. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more sugar and different fruits to made a lot of juice for sale. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Riziki is 42 years old, married, and has six children: ages 23, 21, 18, 16, 14 and 12.

loans.use: To buy more sugar and different fruits to made a lot of juice for sale

loans.name: But

texts.en:
Mrs. But M., age 50, raises pigs in a stall next to her house. She also grows vegetables, such as cabbages, morning glory, and cucumbers, and sells them to a market-seller three months later when they mature.

She is married to Mr. Heab, who is 52 years old, and who sells marble that he cuts them from the mountain located far from his house. The older couple is responsible for a teenage child who is employed.

But M. will use the loan to buy a wheeled-cart for her husband to use to transport marble to sell. (Mrs. But M. was not available for the photograph so her husband is in the photo instead.)

loans.use: To buy a wheeled-cart for her husband to transport marble

loans.name: Afolabi

texts.en: Afolabi O. is 35 years old and single. He sells medicines. He is requesting a loan of N80,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Hamro

texts.en: Cattle are raised in order to be butchered, to obtain derived products, as well as to be used for agricultural tasks. Hamro has been dedicated to cattle farming for three years. He is married and the father of five children. He makes a great effort in order to meet the needs of the children in his charge and to bring sustenance to his humble home. His greatest need now is to buy young cattle for expanding his business. For this reason, Hamro turned to IMON International, in order to obtain loans that will allow him to purchase these animals and make his business advance. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand his business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Shodmonkul

texts.en:
Shodmonkul U. is in the livestock business. He breeds livestock, which provides sustenance for his humble home. Shodmonkul is married with three children. It's important to note that since he started his business, he has acquired an abundance of experience and knowledge because of his great dedication to breeding his animals. Shodmonkul is looking for support from IMON International to purchase livestock to sell in order to continue with his arduous work with cattle in his sector.

loans.use: To purchase cattle to expand the business.

loans.name: Waheed

texts.en:
Waheed is 48 years old and married with four children. He sells engine oil and grease retail to his customers.

He is requesting a loan for N40,000 to purchase more engine oil and grease to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more engine oil and grease to sell.

loans.name: Patima

texts.en:
Patma is 26 years old and single. She has been a clothing and juice seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for one year. She belongs to Wache waseme loan group. She currently earns an average monthly profit approximately $35. Every day, she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothing for resale as well as different fruits and sugar to make juice. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothing, as well as fruit and sugar to make juice.

loans.name: Uktam

texts.en:
Uktam Y. is 41 years old. He lives in Penjikent town. He is married and has four children. Uktam processes and sells raisins in the central local market. He purchases raisins from local farmers wholesale and, after processing, sells them to his customers. Because he buys his goods wholesale, his prices are lower than regular market prices. He offers a wide assortment of goods for clients of different means. All this allows Uktam to make his business quite successful and provides a stable income for the family. Currently, he needs a loan of $800 to buy supplies so that he can continue to offer a good product to his customers. Uktam expresses his gratitude for everyone who is supporting him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To increase his range of goods.

loans.name: Koem

texts.en:
Koem Y. is 30 years old and lives in Pursat Province where she owns and runs a pigpen next to her home. The pigs can be sold to the slaughterhouse within three months after she begins to raise them. She can make several sales each year. Besides raising pigs, she also cultivates rice crop.

Her husband, Pheak, is also 30 and works as a domestic building worker. Currently, the family is facing a difficulty with transportation. They have always paid a lot of money to take taxis. Because of this problem, Koem Y. has decided to seek a loan to purchase a motorbike for family's riding needs.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for the family's transportation needs.

loans.name: Farajika Group

texts.en:
Johari has sold firewood and coconuts in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for a year. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $50 US. She works 8 hours a day.

Johari is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania, her second, so that she can buy more coconuts and firewood to increase her current stock. She hopes that, with this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to expand her business and save money.

Johari is 32 years old, married, and has given birth into six children ages 12, 10, 8, 6, 4  and 2.  She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group members, Hidaya, Sijiamin and Sijaja. Each woman also has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more coconuts and firewood

loans.name: Dora

texts.en:
Dora  has been a baker in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 3 years. She belongs to Hatutaki Maneno Group Loan.  She currently earns an average monthly profit approximately $70 US.  She works for 8 hours a day.


She is requesting a loan from BRAC Tanzania, her first, so that she can buy more wheat flour and sugar for her business. She is hoping that, with this loan, her profits will increase and she will be able to expand her business and save money for future use, improve her home, and pay for her children's education.  


Dora is 50 years old, married, and has five children.

loans.use: To buy more wheat flour and sugar for her business.

loans.name: Uljonoi

texts.ru: Алиева Улжоной живет в районе Рудаки. Возраст 47 лет. Незамужем, имеет двоих детей.  Улжоной имеет торговую точку на рынке "Сафина", она торгует материалами. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 22 года.Сын работает таксистом. Дочка помогает маме по бизнесу. Клиентка хочет взять у нас кредит, чтобы пополнить свой ассортимент.
texts.en:
Uljonoi A. lives in the Rudaki region. She is 47 years old. She is not married and has two children. Uljonoi has a vendor space on the Safina market where she sells fabrics. She has been in this type of business for more than 22 years. Her son works as a taxi driver. Her daughter helps her mother with the business. Uljonoi wants to take out a loan to increase her inventory assortment.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory assortment

loans.name: Shavkatchon

texts.ru: Шавкатчон Азизов молодой мужчина 1982 года рождения. Женат и имеет 1-го ребенка. У него среднее образование. Шавкатчон занимается откормом и продажей скота, а его жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока. Шавкатчон пришел брать кредит в первый раз. У него пока малое количество скота. Шавкатчон надеется увеличить количество мелко рогатого скота с помощью кредита. У его жены только одна дойная корова. Шавкатчон планирует купить для своей жены еще одну дойную корову с теленком, и он благодарен нашим кредиторам за помощь в осуществлении его планов.
texts.en:
Shavkatchon A. is a young man who was born in 1982. He is married and has one child. He has secondary education. Shavkatchon feeds and sells cattle and his wife processes and sells milk. Shavkatchon came to take out a loan for the first time. At this time he has a small number of cattle. He hopes to increase the number of cattle with the use of the loan. His wife only has one milk cow. Shavkatchon plans to buy one more milk cow with a calf for his wife and he is thankful to all our lenders in the realization of his plans.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a milk cow and calf

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen S. is 37 years old.  She has owned a plot of land in Pursat Province since 1979.  There, she grows all types of crops, which she plants twice a year. She is a good mother of five children, three of whom are single and two of whom are married and live away from home. She is married to Mr. You, 43, who is also a crop farmer and sells carving wood from their home. To help alleviate the hard physical labor of farm work, Sen S. is looking for a loan from Kiva to purchase a water buffalo in order to plow farmland during the rice growing season.

loans.use: To purchase a water buffalo to plow farmland

loans.name: Oluwaseun

texts.en:
Oluwaseun is 33 years old and married with two children. He has a business center where he offers computer services and where he also teaches young people how to use the computer.

He is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more computers. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more computers

loans.name: Malohat

texts.ru: Магмуродова Малохат проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст 30 лет, замужем и имеет двоих детей. Муж работает в военной части. Сама уже 10 лет занимается торговлей. Торгует тканями. Работает на рынке "Сафина". Товар привозит из города Душанбе.Получает около 600 сомони прибыли. Для того, чтобы увеличить ассортимент товара и завезти сезонный товар Она решила обратиться к нам за кредитом. Таким образом она сможет развивать свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Malohat M. lives in the Rudaki region. She is 30 years old, married and has two children. Her husband works in the military service. She has been in the retail business for ten years now selling fabrics. She works on the Safina market. She brings in the merchandise from Dushanbe. She makes about 600 somoni (US$138) of profit. To increase the variety of her inventory and bring in seasonal merchandise she decided to apply for a loan with us. This way she can develop her business.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory assortment

loans.name: Sunday

texts.en: Sunday is 38 years old and married with three children. He has a shop where he repairs and sells second-hand refrigerators and air conditioners. He is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more second-hand refrigerators to sell. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second-hand refrigerators to sell

loans.name: Wapendanao Group

texts.en:
Nahida has owned a small shop and beauty salon in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for 15 years. She currently earns an average monthly profit approximately $175. Every day, she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her second loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more salon items and other items for her shop. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for a future use.

Nahida is 41 years old, married, and has three children: ages 15, 13 and 10. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Yusta, who has her own small business in Zanzibar.

loans.use: To buy more salon items and other items for her shop

loans.name: Bose

texts.en: Bose A. is 49 years old and married with three children. She sells planks. She is requesting the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more planks to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more planks to sell

loans.name: Saba

texts.en:
Saba is 23 years old and she is married.

She has been a clothes-seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She belongs to Umoja group loan (Group code 2013). She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $90. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

Saba is requesting her third loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes to sell. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Boeun

texts.en:
Boeun M., 25, lives in Pursat province, Cambodia. She has owned a plot of land for years where grows both rice and vegetable crops. She can plant her crops twice a year, in the dry season and the rainy season -- a skill she learned from her grandparents.

She is married to Sophang, 24, who is a domestic marble carver. He normally collects marble from the mountains and sells it out of his house. His business is profitable. The couple has one minor child under their care. Mrs. Boeun M. will use the loan to buy a buffalo to connect with an existing cart in order to transport marble to sell more quickly.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo to connect with an existing cart

loans.name: Nazrvi

texts.ru: Хомидова Назрви проживает в районе Пяндж. Возраст 55 лет , замужем и имеет одного ребенка. Занимается торговлей. Торгует обувью на рынке района. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже около 12 лет. Доход в месяц составляет около 800 сомони.Этих денег хватает только для того , чтобы обеспечить свою семью. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет увеличить ассортимент товара и таким образом привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en:
H. Nazrvi lives in the Pyandj region. She is 55 years old, is married and has one child. She works in sales. She sells shoes at the regional market. She has been in this business for around 12 years. Her monthly income is around 800 somoni. This money is only enough to provide for her family. She plans to take out a loan in order to increase her turnover. This will help her to increase her product assortment and to attract new customers this way.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Badarch

texts.en: Badarch G. is 38 years old, married and the mother of three. Her family lives in a ger (traditional nomadic tent) district in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. Badarch used to live in the countryside. In 2000, she decided her family needed a change and moved to Ulaanbaatar. She and her husband, Gendensambyy, started running a retail business selling fruits and vegetables at the Narantuul, the biggest outdoor market. To expand her business and increase her profit, she is planning to plant a variety of vegetables on a plot of land she owns. Her current business profit is the family's only source of income. Badarch is a humble and hardworking person who is requesting a loan to purchase more vegetables and vegetable seeds to plant.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and vegetable seeds

loans.name: Mahir

texts.en:
Selling food products in his rented store is the only source of income for Mahir S., a 40-year-old trader who's been doing this for 12 years. Mahir is married and the father of two sons. His children are the reason that he works hard in order to provide them with the best, brightest future.

This man has many projects for his future. The main project is that Mahir wants to build his own store where he would be able to sell a wide range of products.

His wish is to add more items and  therefore have more to offer to his clients. Mahir will pay back this loan and, with the profit, he will be able to pay for his children’s education. This man waits for your help. Let's make his dream come true.

loans.use: To purchase more food products to sell

loans.name: Sayed Aslam Group

texts.en: S. Aslam is the group leader of S. Aslam group. There are three members in this group. They all would like to expand their businesses and need to purchase some necessary materials.  S. Aslam wants to take out a loan for his business of selling oil, Meermen Rona wants to use the funds for her tailoring business, and Ahamd Shah wants the loan for his tire repair business.

loans.use: To buy materials to expand their businesses.

loans.name: Parikhanım

texts.en: Parikhanım

loans.use: To purchase one calf and six sheep

loans.name: Mukalazi Safina‘S Group

texts.en:
Safina is the leader of 5 members of a group. She is 47 years old and married with eight children aged between 18 and 32. Two of her children go to school while the others are working. She resides in and owns a four-roomed house where she lives with twelve people. Safina also takes care of additional family members. There is electricity and piped water at her home and the family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala.

Safina is a poultry famer and works from her home in Kulambiro. She sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works seven days a week. Safina buys her chicks from Biyinzika famers and uses public transport to and from Kampala and Owino market where she gets chicken feed. Her major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises and water. She has been in this business for the last six years. Her main challenges are thieves and seasonality.

Safina has been with MCDT for over six years and is servicing her fifteenth loan, working all this time with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more feed and chickens. Safina is aspiring to own 2,000 chickens on her farm.

loans.use: To buy chicken feed and chickens

loans.name: Qutbiddin

texts.ru: Султонов Кутбиддин житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 35 лет, женат и имеет троих детей. Уже четыре года занимается торговлей. Торгует продуктами питания. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы  увеличить товарооборот. Это поможет увеличить ассортимент , открыть прилавки с промышленными товарами. Таким образом он привлечет новых клиентов и обеспечит рынок товарами широкого спектора потребления.
texts.en:
S. Qutbiddin lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 35 years old, is married and has three children. He has been working in sales for four years now. He sells food products. He plans to get a loan in order to increase his inventory. This will help him to increase his assortment and to open sales locations with manufactured goods. This way he will be able to attract new customers and to provide the market with a wide range of products.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Valeriy

texts.en:
Valeriy is married with two children. He sells women's clothing at three small markets in the neighboring cities. He takes all his inventory with him by car and provides local clients with the clothing they need. He has been in this business for four years.

Valeriy has 11,000 UAH invested in his inventory. He sells women's clothing because women buy new clothing more often.

Valeriy is a hardworking person. His goal is to fix his house and take good care of his children. He wants to borrow 6,500 UAH to purchase seasonal inventory. The loan would help Valeriy to increase his sales and reach his goals faster.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Muhsin

texts.ru: Мухсин Бобоев молодой мужчина 1987 года рождения. Женат и имеет 1-го ребенка. У него неполное высшее образование. Мухсин учится на заочном отделении Таджикского государственного Университета. Мухсин занимается откормом и продажей скота, а его жена занимается переработкой и продажей молока. Мухсин пришел брать кредит в первый раз. Мухсин надеется увеличить количество своего скота с помощью кредита. Мухсин благодарен нашим кредиторам за помощь в осуществлении его планов.
texts.en:
Muhsin B. is a young man who was born in 1987. He is married and has one child. He has an incomplete high education. Muhsin studies in the Tadjik state university in the extramural department. Muhsin feeds and sells cattle and his wife processes and sells milk. Muhsin came to take out a loan for the first time. Muhsin hopes to increase the number of his cattle with the use of the loan. Muhsin is thankful to all our lenders for their help in realizing his plans.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For feeding of cattle and milk processing

loans.name: Abdujalil

texts.ru: Джумаев Абдуджалил проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 39 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Обеспечивает семью путем торговли продуктов питания. Имеет Торговую точку , где продает конфеты и другие виды товаров. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить ассортимент . Это поможет ему привлечь новых клиентов и таким образом развивать свой бизнес. В месяц Абдуджаллил получает около 900 сомони прибыли.
texts.en:
J. Abdujalil lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 39 years old, is married and has four children. He provides for his family by selling food products. He has a sales location where he sells candy and other products. He plans to get credit in order to increase his product assortment. This will help him to attract new customers and to grow his business that way. Abdujalil earns around 900 somoni a month.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase assortment

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian sells provisions and medicines in Lagos State, Nigeria. She has been in this business for a long time. She is 29 years old and married with one child.

Vivian hopes for a loan of N120,000 to purchase more provisions and medicines to sell.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and medicines to sell

loans.name: Niagna

texts.fr: niagna N. ndoye est membre de la caisse depuis fevrier 2009.elle capitalise une annee d experience dans le metier de la coiffure.Compte tenu de l'accroissement de sa clientele le credit qui lui est octroye lui permettra de renforcer les equipements du salon pour mieux repondre aux besions de la clientele et en meme temps rendre le cadre plus acceuillant.
texts.en:
Niagna N. has been a member of UIMCEC since February 2009. She has one year of experience in the hairstyling business. Given the ever increasing number of her customers, the loan, when granted, will allow her to bolster the salon's equipment. She will be able to better meet her customers' needs while at the same time making the salon's setting more welcoming.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: commerce

loans.name: Jane Nabaale‘S Group

texts.en:
Jane is the leader of four members of a group. She is a 25-year-old, married with two children aged between 3 and 7 years. All her children go to school. She resides in and rents a one-room house where she lives with four people. Jane doesn’t take care of any additional family members. There is electricity but no piped water at her home and the family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is in the outskirts of Kampala.

Jane operates a restaurant in Nakulabye, one of the Kampala surburbs. She sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. Jane buys all her food requirements from Nakulabye market and so doesn’t pay for extra transportation to and from shopping. Her major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises and for her residence. She has been in this business for the last two years. Her main challenge is the rainy season, which stops her customers from coming to her.

Jane has been with MCDT for over two years and is servicing her fourth loan, working all this time with the same group members. She wants to use this loan to buy more saucepans, plates and cups. She is aspiring to open another eating establishment.

loans.use: To buy more saucepans, plates and cups for her restaurant

loans.name: Abdusattor

texts.ru: Рахимов Абдусаттор житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 56 лет, женат и имеет семенрых детей. Семья очень большая , и поэтому ему приходиться очень много работать для того, чтобы обеспечить свою семью. Имеет магазин , где торгует продуктами питания. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже семь лет. Прибыль уходит на бытовые расходы его семьи. Для развития бизнеса он обратился за кредитом. Дополнительная сумма поможет ему разнообразить ассортимент и таким образом привлечет новых клиентов.
texts.en:
R. Abdusattor is a resident of the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 56 years old, is married and has seven children. His family is very large and because of this he has to work a lot in order to provide for his family. He has a store where he sells food products. He has been in this business for seven years now. The income goes to household expenses of his family. He has turned to us for credit in order to grow his business. The additional sum will help him to add variety to his assortment and to attract new customers this way.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Alaskar

texts.en:
Alaskar R. is 56 years old and on pension. He is married with four children. His wife is a housekeeper. For more than three years, he has been running a small café. The business generates a stable income to support his family and improve their living conditions.

Today, Alaskar is requesting a $1,200 loan. He is planning to purchase inventory like dishes, tables, and chairs in order to expand his business and improve the conditions of his small café for his clients. Alaskar would like to thank everyone for their support.

loans.use: To purchase dishes, tables and chairs for his café

loans.name: Henrietta

texts.en:
Henrietta is 32 years old, married, and the mother of five children.

Henrietta sells baby clothes, cream and cosmetics and has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of N120,000 to purchase more baby clothes, cream and cosmetics to sell. Henrietta says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby clothes, cream and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Khasan

texts.en:
Khasan U. is a very courageous man who is characterized as someone who can manage tough jobs like raising livestock. He's the father of four children and has the responsibility of supporting his family and providing them with everything that they need.

In spite of his difficult economic situation, and after much time, Khasan has been able to get ahead in his business through the purchase of animals to breed on his property. His greatest goal nowadays is to improve his economic situation and provide a better way of life for his family.

It's for this reason that Khasan comes to AqroInvest Credit Union a second time for a loan for the purchase of animals so that he may breed them. He has a successful loan history and the reputation of good client.

loans.use: purchase two calves

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru:
Саодат Эгамбердиева женщина 42 лет,замужем, мать 3 детей.Проживает саодат в Зафарабадском районе, недалеко от рынка Бадахшан, на котором она торгует детской одеждой.
 Супруг Саодат Шукуров Исматулло работает водителем. 
 Уже более 2 лет, Саодат занимается предпринимательской деятельностью, которая приносит прибыль в ее семью. 
 Саодат запрашивает сумму в размере 4000 сомони сроком на 10 месяцев, для товарооборота.
 На полученную часть прибыли от продажи хочет построить дома курятник и завести кур. Уходом за курами будут заниматься ее дети.
texts.en:
Saodat E. is a 42 year old woman; she is married and is the mother of 3 children. Saodat lives in the Zafarabad region not far from the Badahshaman market where she sells children’s clothing. Saodat’s husband, Shukurov Ismatullo works as a driver. Saodat has been an entrepreneur for more than 2 years and this brings profits to her family. Saodat would like to borrow 4000 somoni for turnover. She would like to use her sales profits to build a henhouse at home and to raise chickens. Her children will take care of the chickens.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For turnover

loans.name: Kelechi

texts.en: Kelechi is 34 years old and married with 4 children. She sells rechargeable phone cards and she also makes commercial calls. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell

loans.name: Kigongo Teopista ‘S Group

texts.en:
Teopista is the leader of a 5-member group. She is a 45-year-old widow with four children, aged between 21 and 30 years. None of her children goes to school. She owns a six-roomed house where she is living with five people.

Teopista takes care of additional family members. There is no electricity but she has piped water at her home. The family gets three meals a day. She resides and works in a semi-urban area which is on the outskirts of Kampala.

Teopista sells bananas (sweet bananas, not plantains) in Nakawa Market. She sells to an average of 20 people a day and sells to all categories of people. She works six days a week. Teopista buys bananas from the very market where she works in Kampala city and pays for transport costs to and from her work. Her major monthly expenses include rent for the business premises and water. She has been in this business for the last six years. Her main challenges are thieves and seasonality.

Teopista has been with MCDT for over six years and is servicing her twelfth loan, working all this time with the same group mates. She wants to use this loan to buy more bananas and also to pay rent. Teopista aspires to own a permanent shop for her business. .

loans.use: to buy more bunches of bananas for resale

loans.name: Genadiy

texts.en:
Genadiy is married with two children. He sells various small items at the market. He has been in this business for 10 years. His profit is about 4,000 UAH per month. His kiosk is like a small store with one small entrance. Unfortunately, you can't see all the inventory when you pass by the kiosk.

Genadiy would like to get a loan to purchase more inventory and locate it on the street outside his kiosk. This should attract people to the kiosk where all the inventory is available. Genadiy hopes that in this way he can expand his clientele.

loans.use: to purchase more inventory

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en: Toyin is a caterer. She bakes and cooks African foods. She is 35 years old and married with 4 children. Toyin lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She hopes for the loan amount of N 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Hanifan Haji Muhammad Jamil Group

texts.en:
Hanifan baji is the wife of H. M. J. who has lived in a city named Multan, Pakistan for the past 17 years. Multan city is famous for its shrines and handmade items. Her husband works in a factory on monthly wage.

Hanifan baji runs an embroidered-clothes business. She prepares embroidered dresses on orders which she collects from her relatives and neighbors. It’s a time-intensive profession; therefore, she decided to buy an embroidery machine which will help her to complete the orders on time and earn more profit.

She is the group leader of two other women from her locality:

Naseem baji wants a loan to buy an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor-vehicle).

Tasleem baji wants a loan to buy embroidery material (beads and colored thread) to resell.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine

loans.name: Fiza Mai M. Zafar Ali Group

texts.en:
Fiza mai baji is the wife of M. Z. A. who lives in a city named Multan, Pakistan. Multan city is famous for its shrines and handmade items. She owes a two-room brick house and has been living in it with her family for the past 14 years. Her husband runs a clothes-selling business.

Fiza mai baji sells clothes in the community and earns income. She is applying for a loan to buy clothes to expand her husband’s clothes-selling business. 

She is the group leader of two other women from her locality:

Tasleem akhtar baji wants a loan to buy school bags to sell.

Ruqaiya baji wants a loan to buy bakery items (eggs and bread) to sell.

loans.use: To buy clothes to expand her husband's business

loans.name: Avaz

texts.en: Avaz R. is fifty-four years old and lives with his wife and three children. He owns a cattle-breeding business and has more than twenty years of experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Avaz has become a very successful businessman. His wife and son help with the business because their family is always trying to help one another. Avaz works very hard and spends his weekend time with the cattle, cleaning, feeding and pasturing them. Now he wants to expand his business and buy more cattle, so he has applied for a loan. With your help Avaz can get ahead.

loans.use: Purchase two calves

loans.name: Abdurauf

texts.ru: Абдурауф – мужчина 1977 года рождения. Женат, имеет 2-х детей. Занимается продажей сладостей и кондитерских изделий. Кондитерские изделия ему пекут для продажи жена, а также дочка помогает печь кондитерские изделия. Абдурауф старается расширить свой бизнес и закупать импортные конфеты и сладости, для расширения своего ассортимента. Этим он хочет увеличить свой семейный доход. Абдурауф пришел в нашу организацию в первый раз брать кредит. Он надеется, что кредит очень поможет ему.
texts.en:
Abdurauf is a man born in 1977. He is married and has two children. He sells sweets and confections. His wife and daughter help him in making of the confections. Abdurauf tries to expand his business and buys imported candy and sweets to increase the assortment. He wants to increase the income for the family this way. Abdurauf has come to our organization for a loan for the first time. He hopes that the loan will help him a lot.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales of confections

loans.name: Irshad M.ameen Group

texts.en:
Irshad baji is a very hardworking lady who has lived in Multan, Pakistan, for the last ten years. She sews clothes to help her husband meet the family's financial needs.  She is applying for a loan to buy seasonal fruits. Her husband has been a fruit-seller for the last three years, selling from a cart by calling out his wares in different neighborhoods.  Irshad baji helps him by arranging the fruit on his cart to make it easy for him to call out their names and to make sales. 

She is the group leader of four other women from her locality. Shahnaz kosar baji wants a loan to buy material (colored thread, clothes and beads) for her decorative embroidery business.  Maqsoodan baji wants a loan to buy groceries to sell in her store.  Abida baji wants a loan to buy more scrap for her scrap business. Saeeda baji wants a loan to buy another motorbike for her motorbike rental business.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To buy seasonal fruits to sell

loans.name: Gladys Kwagala ‘S Group

texts.en:
Gladys is the leader of her four-member group. She is thirty-three years old and married with three children whose ages are between thirteen and seventeen. All of her children go to school. She rents three rooms in a house where a total of six people live. There is electricity but no piped water in her home; nevertheless, the family gets three meals a day.

Gladys lives and works in a semi-urban area on the outskirts of Kampala. At her tailoring shop in Lugala, she works seven days a week, sewing garments and selling to an average of three people a day. Her customers are from all categories. Gladys buys sewing materials from shops in Kampala city twice a month, using public transportation both ways. Her major monthly expenses are rent, electricity and school fees.

She has been in this business for the last five years, working all this time with the same group mates, her main challenges being defaulters and keeping up with rental fees. Gladys has been with MCDT for over two years and this is her fourth loan. She wants to use this loan to buy more bolts of material. She hopes that in the future she can be a direct importer of material.

loans.use: To buy material for sewing into finished clothing.

loans.name: Toleh

texts.ru:
Толех  Элмирзоев животновод со стажем работы 15 лет. Ответственный человек и по отношению к работе, и по отношению к семье.
Дома имеет крупнорогатый скот, от перепродажи  которой он получает прибыль. А так же,  всегда дома у него есть молоко, мясо, творог и кефир.
 Жена Толеха Истат из молока готовит очень вкусный кефир, вкус которого нравиться ее детям и соседям. Соседи с большим удовольствием, покупают именно  кефир ее приготовления, а иногда и молоко. На прибыль, полученную от продажи кефира и молока, она покупает своим детям школьные принадлежности. 
А так же, Толех занимается продажей продуктов питания на рынке своего района. Что приносит дополнительную прибыль в их семью. 
Хочет получить займ в размере 1600 сомони на 6 месячный срок, для откорма своего домашнего скота.
texts.en:
Toleh E. is in animal husbandry with experience of fifteen years. He is a responsible man towards his work and towards his family. He has large cattle at home and gets income from its resale. Also he always has milk, meat, cottage cheese and buttermilk at home. Toleh's wife Istat makes very delicious buttermilk from the milk and their children and neighbors like the taste. The neighbors buy her buttermilk with great pleasure and sometimes buy milk too. She uses the income which she makes from the sales of buttermilk and milk to buy school supplies for the children. Toleh also sells food on the regional market which makes additional profit for their family.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For feeding of cattle

loans.name: Zarina M.sher Group

texts.en:
Zarina baji supported her husband when he lost hope and became discouraged, and he is proud of her because, through her supportive behavior, he was able to start driving an auto-rickshaw (a local three-wheeled motor vehicle). She is applying for a loan to service the auto-rickshaw, because its engine is in urgent need of repair.

She is the group leader of three other women from her locality. Zubaida baji wants a loan to buy bakery items (eggs and bread) to sell. Khursheed begum baji wants a loan to buy another motorbike for her motorbike-rental business. Razia sultana baji wants a loan to buy shoes to sell.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To repair an auto-rickshaw.

loans.name: Mujidat

texts.en: Mujidat is thirty-five years old and married with four children. Her business is selling clothes. She resides in Lagos State, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan to purchase more clothes to sell. Mujidat has been in this business for a long time. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is 40 years old, married, and the mother of three. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria.

Linda sells drinks and cooked foods. She hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Becaye

texts.fr: BECAYE S. EST UN VIEUX PECHEUR SOCIETAIRE DE LA CAISSE DE YOFF DEPUIS 2001 CAPITALISANT UNE EXPERIENCE DE PLUS DE 25 ANS DANS CE DOMAINE.L'OBJET DE SON PRET CONSISTE AREFECTIONNER SA PIROGUE CE QUI LUI PERMETTRA D'AMELIORER SES CONDITIONS DE TRAVAIL ET D'accroitre ses revenus
texts.en:
Becaye S. is an elderly fisherman and has been a member of the Yoff village bank since 2001. He has experience of more than 25 years in his field. The intention for his loan is to refit his fishing boat, which will allow him to improve his working conditions and expand his revenue.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: improving his fishing boat

loans.name: Ojiugo

texts.en: Ojiugo is a mother of 6 children; she is 38 years old and married. She sells provisions and medicines. Ojiugo hopes for the loan amount of 100,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more provisions and medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To increase store inventory

loans.name: Fatoumata Binetou

texts.fr: FATOUMATA EST UNE JEUNE FEMME NEE LE 25 MARS 1972 A THIES .ELLE EST MARIEE A UN GENDARME ET EST MERE DE DEUX ENFANTS.ELLE FAIT DU COMMERCE DEPUIS PRESQUE QUINZE ANS .SON ACTIVITE CONSISTE A VENDRE DES TISSUS,des chaussures ,des sacs ,du thé et des articles divers;elle dispose d'une clientèle importante. Avec ce pret ,elle envisage de renforcer son activité pour satisfaire ses clients.
texts.en:
Fatoumata is a young woman who was born on March 25, 1972 in Thies. She is married to a gendarme and is the mother of 2 children. She has been a petty trader for almost 15 years. Her business consists in selling cloth, shoes, handbags, tea, and various other items. She has quite a sizeable clientele. With this loan, she intends to bolster her business to satisfy the needs of her customers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: bolstering her little business

loans.name: Tina

texts.en: Tina is 38 years old and married with 4 children. She sells provisions and drinks. She hopes for the loan amount of 50,000 Nigerian Naira to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She is an active LAPO client.Tina says thanks to all Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Maimona's Group

texts.fr: Le groupe  takku liggey tefess 4 est une association qui regroupe des femmes  mariées qui s ‘activent de petit commerce de divers produits. Chacune d’elle fait son propre  commerce de tissus et autres accessoires de femmes. Le groupe de trois(3) membres se réuni chaque semaine pour collecter  les cotisations des membres qui sont versées à une d’elle à tour de rôle .Avec le prêt elles comptent renforcer leur activité en achetant plus de marchandises.les revenus tirés de leurs activité leur permettent d’entretenir leurs enfants. Ces femmes habitent à Mbour  ville côtière située à 70 km de Dakar.
texts.en:
The group Takku Liggey Tefess 4 brings together married women who sell various products. Each of them has her own business selling cloth and other accessories for women. The group of 3 members meets each week to collect dues from each member which are paid out to each of them in turn. With the loan they intend to bolster their businesses by buying additional inventory. The income from their businesses allows them to support their children. These women live in Mbour, a coastal town situated 70 km from Dakar.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of additional merchandise

loans.name: Luai

texts.en:
Luai is a 31-year-old man who lives in Palestine with his wife and three children. Luai operates a mini-market where he sells cooking products and simple foods such as seeds, nuts, and candies.

Luai has asked for a loan of US $3000 from Ryada to increase business stock and fulfill customer demands. Let us help this father, who with effort and dedication will continue his hard work for prosperity.

loans.use: Increase store inventory

loans.name: Foster

texts.en:
Foster K. is a single parent with 1 child and has received an education through senior high school. Since 2005 Foster has been a barber and also a trader, selling stationery, in Cape Coast behind Oguaa Hall. Foster uses his income to pay for utility bills and his family’s various expenses.

He will use the loan to purchase more stationery and also use part to buy creams, lubricants and other items which he needs to improve the services he renders to his customers. With the new profits from his expanded business, Foster plans to reinvest with the ultimate goal of expanding his shop.

loans.use: Barber shop supplies; stationery for resale

loans.name: Temurdjon

texts.en:
Since he was a young boy Temurdjon has known how to work. His parents taught him how to get by as an agriculturist, and he learned very well. Now that he is the father of a family he still works as an agriculturalist. Thanks to his parents Temurdjon now has the opportunity to move forward as a farmer, and he hopes to increase his agricultural products so that he can provide his loved ones a more promising life.

Despite being a good agriculturalist and worker he needs help to move forward and improve his production. This is why he is asking for a loan, so that he can buy more of the seeds and fertilizers he needs, which are very expensive, but without them his production will not improve. With the part of the loan he will also buy young cattle. You can help Temurdjon keep moving forward with his development plans.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: For seeds, fertilizer, and young cattle

loans.name: Usomchon

texts.ru: Усмончону 23 лет. Женат и имеет 1-го ребенка. Занимается продажей разных напитков в кафе "Ганчина" в районе "Чумчук-Арала" города Худжанда. Он закупает товар из рынка "Панчшанбе" у оптовиков. Так как район "Чумчук Арала" очень многолюдное место, там имеется парк и ботанический сад, множество магазинов и жилых домов, у Усмончона торговля идет очень хорошо. Поэтому Усмончон хочет расширить ассортимент своего товара.
texts.en:
Usimchon is 23 years old. He is married and has one child. He sells soft drinks in the cafe Ganchina in the Chumchuk-Arala region in the town of Khujand. He buys the merchandise in the Panshabe market from wholesellers. Because Chumchuk-Arala is a very busy place and there's a park and a botanical garden as well as a many stores and apartment buildings nearby so Usmonchon's sales are good. This is why he wants to increase the variety of his merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For resale of soft drinks

loans.name: Bineta

texts.fr: BINETA K. EST UNE JEUNE FEMME QUI HABITE CHEZ SES PARENTS AU QUARTIER GOUYE SOMBEL DE THIES .ELLE EST ENSEIGNANTE DE PROFESSION ET EST CELIBATAIRE SANS ENFANT.ELLE SOLLICITE CE PRET DANS LE BUT DE  TERMINER LES TRAVAUX DE CONSTRUCTION DE LA MAISON FAMILIALE AVANT L'ARRIVEE DE L'HIVERNAGE.
texts.en:
Bineta K. is a young woman who lives with her parents in the Gouye Sombel neighborhood in Thies. She is a professional teacher and is still single and has no children. She is asking for this loan with the intention of finishing building the family house before the rainy season.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: finishing building her parents' house

loans.name: Takku Liggeye Tefess 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe  takku liggey tefess 3 est une association qui regroupe des femmes  mariées qui s ‘activent de petit commerce de divers produits. Certaines d’entre elles vendent des tissus d’autre de la bouillie de mil  et toute autre produits. Le groupe de quatre(4) membres se réuni chaque semaine pour collecter  les cotisations des membres qui sont versées à une d’elle à tour de rôle .Avec le prêt elles comptent renforcer leur activité en achetant plus de marchandises.les revenus tirés de leurs activité leur permettent d’entretenir leurs enfants. Ces femmes habitent à Mbour  ville côtière située à 70 km de Dakar
texts.en:
The group Takku Liggey Tefess 3 brings together married women who are all petty traders selling various items. One sells cloth, another millet porridge, and so on. The group of four members meets once a week to collect dues from each member which are paid out to one of them in turn. With the loan, they intend to bolster their businesses by buying more merchandise. The income from their businesses permits them to support their children. These women live in Mbour, a coastal town situated 70 km from Dakar.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital for their businesses

loans.name: Dinah

texts.en:
Dinah M. is married with four dependents and has received an education through primary school. Since 2005 Dinah has sold a variety of goods including sandals, bags, clothing and minerals at Cape Coast behind the Oguaa Hall. Her husband is employed as a Coca Cola distributor.

Dinah uses her income to pay for housekeeping expenses and sometimes pays the children's school fees. She will use the loan to purchase more footwear, bags and clothing for resale and with her newly gained profits, she plans to reinvest in her enterprise with the ultimate goal of opening another branch of her business.

loans.use: To purchase more footwear, bags and clothing to sell

loans.name: Ablavi

texts.fr:
Cette femme exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de céréales auxquels elle a associé la vente de boissons locales, ce commerce marche bien pour elle. Elle a commencé ce commerce depuis 1992, ce qui fait qu’elle maîtrise ce secteur. Elle a déjà obtenu de WAGES un premier crédit qu'elle a déjà remboursé, elle sollicite son deuxième crédit pour acheter 07sacs de maïs et 05 bidons de boissons locales afin d'augmenter son stock .
Elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This woman's income generating activity is the sale of cereals along with the sale of local beverages. This business has been doing well. She started this business in 1992, thus she is an expert in this field. She was granted a first loan from WAGES, and she is requesting a second loan to increase her stock to buy 7 bags of corn and 5 jugs of local beverages. She is married and the mother of two children.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bags of corn and local beverages

loans.name: Bozorqul

texts.ru: Холниезов Бозоркул житель района Хуросон . Возраст 35 , женат и имеет троих детей.Занимается разведением крупно рогатого скота. Покупает молодых бычков для откормки . После откормки он продает их на рынке. Планирует получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить поголовье скота. Это поможет ему улучшить финансовое положение семьи.
texts.en:
H. Bozorqul lives in the Khuroson region. He is 35 years old, is married and has three children. He raises large, horned livestock. He purchases young bulls to fatten. After fattening them, he sells them at the market. He plans to get a loan in order to increase his livestock headcount. This will help him to improve his family’s financial situation.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 52 years old and married with five children. She sells kerosene and engine oil. She is requesting a loan amount of N120,000 to purchase more kerosene and engine oil to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene and engine oil to sell

loans.name: Makhsudkhuja

texts.en:
E. Makhsudkhuja is 42 years old. He is married with 3 children. Makhsudkhuja is a farmer. He plants onions, potatoes, and other vegetables. He tells us that he comes from a farming family and that he does very well financially because he takes good care of his land. At the same time he raises cattle at his house.

Thanks to his savings, Makhsudkhuja was able to arrange the marriage of his elder son. His wife is his biggest supporter. She helps him in anything she can and takes good care of him and the house. With this loan, he would like to expand his irrigation system which is fundamental when it comes to farming. The loan will greatly improve Makhsudkhuja’s income and his family's living standards.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with its famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. But, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed, mineral fertilizer, and calves

loans.name: Imma

texts.en: Imma is 40 years old and married with two children. She sells tomatoes. Her customers’ demand for her tomatoes is high and she hopes to be able to meet the demand. She hopes for the loan of N100,000 to purchase more tomatoes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders

loans.use: To purchase more tomatoes to sell

loans.name: Edmund

texts.en:
Edmund Q. is single and is taking care of one of his brother’s children. He has received an education through senior high school.

Since 2003, Edmund has sold lining, thread and other sewing materials in Cape Coast. He also works as a tailor, specializing in sewing men’s clothing. Edmund uses his income to take care of his brother’s child.

Edmund will use the loan to purchase more sewing materials for resale and to also buy equipment to improve his services. With the new profits from his expanded business, Edmund plans to reinvest back into his enterprise in order to increase his profits.

loans.use: To purchase more sewing materials and to buy equipment to improve his services

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: fatou N. est membre de la caisse de yoff depuis janvier 2009.elle tient un atelier de couture depuis plus de 2 ans a la cite mame rane.l'objet du pret est d'investir dans son atelier en achetant de nouvelles machines pour accroitre sa productivite.
texts.en:
Fatou N. has been a member of the village bank of Yoff since January 2009. She has had a sewing shop for over 2 years in the Cité Mamerane. The goal of this loan is to invest in her shop by buying new sewing machines in order to increase her productivity.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: augmentation fond de roulement

loans.name: Abdunosir

texts.en: K. Abdunosir is a farmer dedicated, for more than 17 years, to the production of potatoes and raising cattle. He is married and has four children. His wife is a housekeeper and the business of Abdunosir is the sole source of income for his family. His potato harvest is about to come and that is why he is requesting a loan of 5,000 Somoni to acquire agricultural products and apply them to his harvest. With part of the loan he will also buy young cattle for raising and selling. Abdunosir wishes to improve his living conditions and hopes to do so from the income that his business will bring. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed, mineral fertilizer and young cattle

loans.name: Abdurahmon

texts.en:
Abdurahmon is very demanding in his work, having been a farmer since he was young. Today, as the head of a household, he works tirelessly to generate a stable income. He cares for his animals, getting up very early to gather grass so he can keep his livestock well fed. Abdurahmon sells the milk they produce as well as the grass that he cultivates on his land. He is seeking a loan for the purchase of calves to expand his business. Please support Abdurahmon’s efforts so he can continue to improve his standard of living.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its epic mountain passes and its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac T. is single with no children and has received an education through senior high school.

Since 2003 Isaac has sold phone credit cards and accessories at Cape Coast behind the Oguaa Hall. Isaac uses his income to pay for utility bills and other basic necessities. He will use the loan to purchase the latest mobile phones and accessories for resale. With the new profits from his expanded business Isaac plans to reinvest in his enterprise.

loans.use: To purchase the latest mobile phones and accessories for resale

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.ru: Баянова Сабохат проживает в районе Пяндж. Возраст 39 лет, замужем и имеет четверых детей. Дети учаться в средней школе.Муж работает на стройке. Но та как семья большая и , чтобы обеспечить семью Сабохат сама принялась работать. Занялась бизнесом шесть лет назад. Торгует на рынке района детской одеждой. Планирует получить креди для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. таким образом она сможет завезти новый ассортимент , что поможет привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en:
B. Sabohat lives in the Pyandj region. She is 39 years old, is married and has four children. Her children study in high school. Her husband works at a construction site. Because the family is large and in order to provide for the family Sabohat started working. She started her business six years ago. She sells children’s clothing at the regional market. She plans to get credit in order to increase her turnover, this way she will be able to get a new selection of products which will help her to attract new customers.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Nurmamat

texts.en: N. Nurmamat, 46, is a farmer who lives in Shahristan, Tajikistan. He is very experienced in this business as he has been farming since 1988. He is married with four children. His elder son and wife help him with the business. Unfortunately, Nurmamat's farmland is infertile, so he is in need of a loan in the amount of $3,000 to purchase seed, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants to use on his potato crop. Nurmamat hopes the loan will allow him to increase his yield above and beyond what it was in previous years. As for his future plan, he wants all of his children to go to university and to get good jobs. Be an important part of the well-being of this humble family. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants

loans.name: Hokimboy

texts.en: Z. Hokimboy is 30 years old, married, and has three children. All of his life he has devoted himself to agricultural work, and on market days he brings his products to the market. For Hokimboy the harvest is what he enjoys the most and he devotes a lot of time to sorting potatoes and carrots that he will sell, because the price will depend on the size. Sorted, they are more profitable, although the potatoes he sells are not in great shape. Agriculture is full of satisfaction for him and his family, even more when they sell for a good price at the market; that is the motivation to continue planting. With the money requested, Hokimboy will buy seed, fertilizer, fuel and lubricants for his farm. Part of the loan he will also spend on purchasing young cattle. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase seed, fertilizer and young cattle

loans.name: Muti

texts.en:
Muti is 43 years old and married with three children. She sells provisions and drinks.

She hopes for the loan of N80,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. She says this will enable her to meet the demands of her customers. Muti lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell

loans.name: Momoqul

texts.ru: Гуломова Момокиз жительница Пянджского района. Возраст 61 год, замужем и имеет пятерых детей. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей. Торгует обувью на районном рынке. Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 15 лет. Старшие сыновья взрослые и имеют уже свои семьи. Тем не менее основным источником дохода ее семьи является ее бизнес. Поэтому она решила развивать бизнес, путем вливания дополнительных средств. Она планирует получить кредит и увеличить товарооборот.
texts.en:
G. Momoqul is a resident of the Pyandj region. She is 61 years old, is married and has five children. She has a high school education. She works in sales. She sells shoes at the regional market. She has been in this business for 15 years now. Her older sons are adults and already have their own families. Nevertheless her business is the main source of income for the family. This is why she has decided to grow her business by pouring additional resource into it. She plans to get a loan and increase her turnover.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred A. D. sells unisex clothing, and music and movie CDs and DVDs at Cape Coast behind the Oguaa Hall. He has been doing so for one year. He is single and has received an education through the university level. He is responsible for paying utility bills and providing for his two young siblings. 

Alfred will use his loan to buy more and different fashionable clothing and music and movies. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest back into his enterprise.

loans.use: To buy clothing and CDs and DVDs to sell.

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.ru: Мирзоев Абдулло житель района Пяндж.  Женат и имеет одного ребенка . Работает в сфере бизнеса. Торгует одеждой и парфюмерией.Местность в которой он живет находиться далеко от центра, поэтому товар быстро расходится.В связи с этим Абдулло решил получить кредит и увеличить товарооборот.Это поможет обеспечить рынок необходимыми товарами, что поможет населению приобретать товар , не выезжая за приделы района.
texts.en:
M. Abdullo is a resident of the Pyandj region. He is married and has one child. He works in the business sphere. He sells clothing and perfume. The area where he lives is located far from the center and because of this his products sell quickly. Because of this, Abdullo decided to get a loan and increase his turnover. This will help to provide the market with necessary products, which will help the population to get products without having to leave the borders of the area.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Khardiata

texts.fr: khardiata N. est membre de la caisse de yoff depuis mai 2001.depuis plus de cinq ans elle evolue dans le domaine de la petite restauration et assure la distribution de pain et tout ce qui va avec le petit dejeuner;le soir elle vend du sandwich.l'objet du pret est d'investir pour elargir son activite.
texts.en:
Khardiata N. has been a member of the Yoff bank since May 2001. For over five years, she has been improving in the domain of food catering, ensuring that bread is distributed, and offering everything that goes with a breakfast. In the evenings, she sells sandwiches. The goal of her loan is to invest for expanding her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Janet
