texts.en: Janet O. is 43 years old and married with five children. She sells provisions and foodstuffs in Lagos State, Nigeria. She hopes for a loan of N100,000 to purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell. Janet says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and foodstuffs to sell.

loans.name: Gulshan

texts.ru: Назарова Гулшан проживает в районе Пяндж. ВДОВА , имеет троих детей. Работает на рынке  в центре района. Выпекает и продает пирожки.Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже пять лет. Бизнес приносит дохо в размере 500 сомони в месяц. Кредит планирует использовать для закупки муки и масла. Таким образом она сможет безперебойно работать , не задумываясь о нехватки продуктов.Коме того , она сможет сохранять цены на производимую продукцию.
texts.en:
N. Gulshan lives in the Pyandj region. She is a WIDOW and has three children. She works at the market in the center of the region. She bakes and sells pies. She has been in this business for five years. The business brings her an income of 500 somoni per month. She plans to use the credit to purchase flour and oil. This way she will be able to work without breaks, without having to think about a lack of products. In addition, she will be able to save on the cost of her products.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour and oil

loans.name: Kuburat

texts.en: Kuburat A. resides in Lagos State, Nigeria. She is 35 years old and married with two children. She sells rechargeable phone cards. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell. Kuburat says a big thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more rechargeable phone cards to sell.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose G. is a hardware seller at Siwdo near Cape Coast. She has been in business for four years and sells such items as nails, paints, shovels and other building materials. Rose is married with two children and received no formal education. She is responsible for paying her family's various expenses. 

Rose is currently out of stock and hopes to use her loan to refill her shop with building materials. She will also purchase more building materials and soft drinks to sell. She hopes to use the new profits to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more building materials and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Mahbuba

texts.ru: Назарова Махбуба проживает в района Руми. Возраст 30 лет, замужем, имеет двоих детей. Махбуба занимается бизнесом. Она торгует в основном обувью. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 10 лет. Товар привозит из города Душанбе. В месяц она получает около 900 сомони прибыли. Доход хватает только для того, чтобы обеспечить семью необходимыми продуктами питания. В данный момент она планирует увеличить товарооборот , путем получения кредита.
texts.en:
N. Mahbuba lives in the Pyandj region. He is 30 years old, is married and has two children. He works in business. He sells men’s clothing. He has been in this business for 10 years now. He brings his products from the city of Dushanbe. He earns an income of around 900 somoni per month. The income is only enough to provide his family with necessary food products. At this moment he plans to increase his turnover by getting credit.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is divorced with six dependents and has received no formal education. For three years she has worked as a trader selling flour, millet, sugar and oil at Siwdo near Cape Coast. Mary uses her income to pay for her family's various expenses including household bills. 

Mary will use her loan as extra capital for her business in the trading of cooked food. She plans to reinvest her newly gained profits.

loans.use: As extra capital for her business in the trading of cooked food.

loans.name: Ngozi

texts.en: Ngozi resides in Lagos state, Nigeria. She is married with three children. She is 49 years old. She sells fruits like watermelon. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more fruits to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary D. is a widow with five dependents. She has received no formal education. For 20 years, Mary has worked as a trader selling clothing, lace, fabric lining and saucepans in Siwdo near Cape Coast. She uses her income to pay for her family’s various household expenses and bills. Mary will use the loan to purchase more clothing, lace, fabric lining and saucepans for selling and with the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to reinvest.

loans.use: Mary will use the loan to purchase more clothing, lace, fabric lining and saucepans for selling

loans.name: Ugochi

texts.en: Ugochi resides in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells cooked food and drinks. She is married with one child. She is 40 years old. Ugochi hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and drinks to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a food vendor who sells rice porridge, cassava, yam and palm fruits. She believes selling multiple products enables her to meet her household demands. She is 30 years old, married and has two kids who are pursuing education in primary school. Grace is hardworking and resourceful for her family. She has been in business for 22 years.

Grace wants to use this loan to procure goods in bulk to cut down on transportation costs. She is a member of the trust bank group Eye Adom (translated it means Grace) whose members guarantee for one another to access loans and support one another in handling repayments.

loans.use: To procure rice, cooking oil and vegetables

loans.name: Guliston

texts.ru: Сайфуддинова Гулистон проживает в районе Пяндж. Вдова , осталась одна с двумя детьми на руках. После чего занялась бизнесом. Открыла столовую , которая расположена в центре районного рынка.Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить и обновить инвентарь. Это поможет улучшить качество обслуживания , что поможет привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en:
S. Guliston lives in the Pyandj region. She is a widow and was left alone with two children on her hands. After this she started a business. She opened a cafeteria which is located at the center of the regional market. She plans to get a loan in order to purchase and get new inventory. This will help her to improve her service quality which will help to attract new customers.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity A. is divorced with five dependents and has received no formal education. For four years Charity has sold fabrics like ATL, GTP and Woodin at the Elmina boatyard in Siwdo, near Cape Coast. She uses her income to pay for her family’s bills, food and also the children’s school expenses. Charity will use this loan to purchase more cloth to sell. With the profits from her expanded business, Charity plans to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more cloth

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Хайдарова Саодат проживает  в городе Пяндж. Разведена , имеет двоих детей.Образование среднее . Уже 10 лет занимается бизнесом. Торгует обувью на центральном рынке города. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Так она сможет завезти новый ассортимент товаров. Это поможет привлечь новых клиентов , а так же поможет населению покупать товар , не выезжая за придлы города. Так как товар пивозиться из города Душанбе.
texts.en:
Saodat H. lives in the Pyandj region. She is divorced and has two children. She has a high school education. She has been in business for 10 years. She sells shoes at the city’s central market. She plans to get credit in order to increase her turnover. This way she will be able to get a new product assortment. This will help her to attract new clients and will also help the population to purchase products without leaving the city boundaries, as the products come from the city of Dushanbe.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria is a widow. She is 50 years old with four children. She sells foodstuffs and provisions in Lagos State, Nigeria. Victoria hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more goods to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and provisions

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde resides in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells clothes. She is married with a child. She is 31 years old. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Iyabo

texts.en: Iyabo is a widow, and she is 65 years old with 7 children. She sells fruits and foodstuffs. Iyabo hopes for the loan amount of 80,000 to purchase more fruits and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for making this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more fruits and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.ru: Давлатмуродов Умеджон  проживает в районе Хуросон .Возраст 28 лет, женат и имеет одного ребенка. Работает в пекарне. Выпекает лепешки  и реализует их оптовым покупателям. Занимается этим бизнесом уже 8 лет.Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить муку. Это даст возможность увеличить объем производимой продукции и соответственно товарооборот.
texts.en:
Umedjon D. lives in the Khuroson region. He is 28 years old, married and has one child. He works in a bakery. He makes flat breads and sells them to wholesale buyers. He has been in this business for eight years. Umedjon plans to use the loan to buy flour. This will let him increase the production volume and the turnaround of the product as well.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy flour

loans.name: Risikatu

texts.en: Risikatu sells provisions, plastics, and drinks. She hopes for the loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions, plastics, and drinks to sell. She is a widow with 8 children. She is 62 years old. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, plastics, and drinks to sell

loans.name: Magbesseh United Group

texts.en:
This is Rugie K. and Fatmata B.. They named their group Magbesseh United after the village of the group’s leader.

This will be the fourth loan these entrepreneurs are seeking from Kiva lenders. Previous loans have had a meaningful effect on the lives of these borrowers. With the help of those loans, they were able to feed and clothe their children better, and pay for school and medical bills. Magbesseh United has repaid its last loan successfully. The members are now requesting a new loan to further strengthen their businesses.

Rugie K. (left) is the leader of the group. Rugie is 40 years old. She was born in a village called Massam, which is two miles from Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. Rugie is married to a businessman and they have five children who attend primary and secondary schools. Rugie sells market food – rice, salt, “margi,” pepper, sugar, flour, etc. She has been selling for over 20 years.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: John

texts.en: John M. sells lobsters in Cape Coast. He is married and has three children. His wife is a trader. John has been transporting and selling lobsters since 2004. He is also a taxi driver. He is responsible for paying for school fees, food, and utilities. He will use this loan to buy lobsters from Tema to fry and sell. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to provide quality education to his children.

loans.use: To buy lobsters from Tema to fry and sell.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella, 34 and married with one child, sells provisions and drinks. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. Stella says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Veronica J., married to a driver and the mother of four children, has been selling flour, rice and oil since 1988 in Yamoransa in Cape Coast. Veronica has received education to junior high school, and she is responsible for paying the children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase flour, rice, sugar, groundnuts and beans for resale. Veronica hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house and provide quality education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase flour, rice, sugar, groundnuts and beans for resale.

loans.name: Daba

texts.fr: Daba D. âgée de 43ans s'active dans le commerce de poissons séchés. Elle habite à Mbour ville côtière où les activités de pêche occupent une place importante dans l’activité économique .Elle achète le poisson transformé pour le revendre  dans le quartier .Elle a démarré son activité avec un premier prêt contracté à l’IMCEC. Les revenus tirés du commerce lui permettent de nourrir sa famille de six (6) enfants  mais aussi de payer les frais médicaux de ces derniers .Avec le prêt elle veut profiter de période pou renforcer son stock de marchandises avant la saison morte ou le produit devient rare et chère.
texts.en:
Daba D., age 43, is active in the commerce of dried fish. She lives in Mbour City on the coast, where fishing occupies an important economic place. She buys processed fish to resell in the area. She started her business with an initial loan taken out with IMCEC. The revenues derived from commerce will enable her to feed her family of six children but also to pay for their medical fees. With this loan, she wants to make the best use of this period to bolster her stock of merchandise before the off-season, when goods become short in supply and expensive.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Omowuni

texts.en: Omowuni, 32 and married with 3 children, has a salon where she styles her customers' hair and also sells hair creams and drinks. She hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more hair cream and drinks to sell.  Omowuni says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more hair cream and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Tataisuple Group

texts.en: This is Sulaiman H. F., Mohamed K. and Abdul Karim K.. They named their group Tataisuple. This will be the fourth loan these entrepreneurs have received from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have had much impact on the lives of these borrowers. With previous loans, they were able to feed their families, send their children to school, pay medical bills and so on. Having repaid the last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of Le 3,000,000 to further strengthen their businesses. Sulaiman H. F. (right) is the leader of the group. He is 38 years old and was born in Magburaka, Tonkolili district, northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a businesswoman and they have six children who are all still in primary school. Sulaiman has been a businessman for over 10 years. He sells locally produced goods like rice, palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) and ataya (Chinese green tea).

loans.use: To Invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy A. sells maize, gari, and oil at Yamoransa in Cape Coast and has been doing so since 2000. She is married and has 3 children. Her husband is an operator. Mercy completed senior high school. She is responsible for paying the family's light and water bills. 

Mercy will use her her loan to improve her business by buying more food supplies to sell. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more food supplies to sell and expand her business.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort F. sells frozen foods like chicken, fish, and so on. Comfort is 34 years old and married with 3 children. Comfort hopes for the loan amount of N80,000 to purchase more frozen foods to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Bobojon

texts.ru: Акрамов Бободжон житель города Яван. Возраст 49 лет, женат и имеет шестерых детей. Работает в колхозе. Кроме того занимаетсяфермерской деятельностью. имеет хозяйство , где разводит крупно рогатый скот. Занимается этим видом бизнеса , как и большинство людей в сельской местности , почти всю жизнь. Бизнес приносит  400-450 сомони дохода  в месяц.Планируетполучить кредит джля того, чтобы купить еще одного бычка. Это поможет увеличить поголовье скота.
texts.en:
Bobojon A. lives in the town of Yavan. He is 49 years old, married and has six children. He works in a collective farm. Besides that he has own farming business where he breeds large cattle. He has been in this business as many of the people in the villages for most of his life. This business makes him a profit of 400-450 somoni (US$100-120) a month. He plans to use the loan to buy one more calf. This will help increase the headcount of cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase head count of cattle

loans.name: Trust In God Group

texts.en:
This is Memuna K., Zainab C., Alice L., Isatu T., and Adama T.. They call their group Trust in God. This will be the fourth loan these entrepreneurs have received from Kiva Lenders through SMT. Previous loans have made a huge and very significant impact on the lives and living standards of these borrowers. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now asking for a new loan of Le 800,000 for each to further strengthen their businesses.

Memuna K. (middle) is the leader of this group. She is age 35, married to a businessman, and they have four children. Two of her children are in primary school, one in secondary, and the youngest is still not of school-going age. Memuna sells ready-to-wear-clothes and has been in this business for over 10 years.

loans.use: To invest in their businesses.

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Kate O. is a widow and has five dependent children. She has received schooling through senior high school. Kate sells and trades food and soft drinks in Yamoransa in Cape Coast and has done so since 1992. She uses her income to pay the light bill and school fees. 

Kate will use her loan to purchase more food and soft drinks to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business Kate plans to educate her children.

loans.use: To purchase more food and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Bendu Group

texts.en:
This is Wurie B., Saidu C., Daniel B., Paul B., and Jatu K.. They have named their group B. United, named after the group leader’s surname. Wurie B. (second from left) is 39 years of age. He was born in Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. He is married with two children, all of whom attend primary school. Wurie sells ready-to-wear clothes and has been in this business for over 18 years now.

This will be the third loan these entrepreneurs have requested from Kiva lenders through SMT. Their previous loans have significantly impacted the lives of these borrowers: they have been able to feed their families, send their children to school, and solve many of their daily financial challenges.

Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan to further strengthen their businesses.

loans.use: To invest in his clothing sales business

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86426&_tpos=2&_tpg=1
María es socia del Bancomunal los Viñedos
A María le gusta la cocina y se vio en la necesidad de dar menús, como le gusta lo hace con gusto, ella reparte menús todos los días a las obras constructoras  que hay por su casa.
María  necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para  hacer dos cuartos en su casa y poderlos alquilar
Desde que María esta en Finca aprendió a ser más responsable, con los prestamos que recibe y  aprendió a compartir entre las socias. 
El sueño de María es poner un restaurante.
texts.en:
María is a member of the Los Viñedos (The Vineyards) Communal Bank. María likes to cook and she finds herself in need of preparing meals. She likes to cook up a storm and she delivers her meals every day to the construction workers nearby her house. María needs a loan of 2,000 Sols to build two rooms in her house so that she can rent them out. Since María has been working with FINCA Peru she has learned to be more responsible with the loans that she receives. She has also learned to share with the other members. María dreams of having a restaurant. Click HERE to see her First Loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build two rooms for rentals.

loans.name: Khalifa Ababacar

texts.fr: MR F. EST NE LE 21 JUILLET 1959 A THIES .IL EST MARIE ET EST PERE DE CINQ ENFANTS .IL LOGE AVEC SA FAMILLE AU QUARTIER CITE LAMY DE THIES.IL EST PLANIFICATEUR AU MINISTERE DE L'ECONOIE ET DES FINANCES.IL SOLLICITE CE PRET DANS LE BUT DE FAIRE FACE A UN BESOIN SOCIAL URGENT.
texts.en:
Mr. F. was born on July 21, 1959 in Thiès. He is married and the father of five children. He is housed with his family in the CITE LAMY district of Thiès. He is a planner at the ministry of the economy and finances. He’s requesting this loan with the goal of addressing an urgent societal need.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Societal need

loans.name: Noyma

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86569&_tpos=7&_tpg=1
Noyma es socia del Bancomunal los Viñedos, trabaja con su esposo que es mecánico, él arregla carros,  ellos tienen un taller de mecánica , ella administra el taller. 
Noyma  necesita  un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de repuestos eléctricos para carros, cables, focos, faros. 
Desde que está en Finca aprendió hacer responsable con los préstamos que recibe, y aprendió hacer puntual.
El sueño de Noyma es tener  un consultorio dental.
texts.en:
First loan:http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86569&_tpo s=7&_tpg=1 Noyma is a member is the communal bank “los Viñedos.” She works with her husband who is a mechanic. She manages their auto repair shop and he fixes the cars. Noyma needs a loan of 2000 soles to purchase electric spare parts for cars, cables, lights and headlights. She has learned to be responsible and punctual with the loans she receives since she has been with Finca. Her dream is to have a dental office.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Noyma  necesita  un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de repuestos eléctricos para carros, cables, focos, faros.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en: Gifty A. sells maize, beans, pepper and other food supplies in Yamoransa in Cape Coast. Gifty has received a junior high school education. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a policeman. Gifty has been selling maize, beans and pepper since 1998. She is responsible for paying the light and water bills. Her loan will be used to buy food supplies to increase the business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house for her children.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy food supplies to increase the business

loans.name: Shiltu

texts.en: Shiltu sells charcoal and foodstuffs. She is 38 years old and married with four children. Shiltu hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: I Hope To God Group

texts.en:
This is Yeabu K. and Hawa S.. They named their group I Hope to God. This will be the fourth loan they are receiving from SMT/Kiva. Previous loans have been very helpful to these entrepreneurs. With previous loans, their businesses expanded, their profit margin increased and consequently, their standard of living also improved. They have repaid their last loan successfully and they now are requesting a new loan of Le 2,000,000.00 to further strengthen their businesses.

Yeabu K. (right) is the leader of the group. Yeabu was born 35 years ago. She is married with three children. One child is in secondary school and two are in primary schools. Yeabu has been a businesswoman since she was very young. With this loan, she will be further expanding her business. Yeabu sells market food like onions, pepper, salt, oil etc.

loans.use: Invest in her business

loans.name: Tehmenaneh Group

texts.en:
This is Ya Marie S., Mary C., Ishmael K. and Yeabu T.. They named their group Tehmenaneh.

Ya Yeabu S. (left) is the leader of the group. She is 30 years of age and was born in the town of Magburaka in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a teacher and they have five children, who are in secondary and primary schools. Ya Yeabu sells dishes and rubber bowls. She has been in business for over fifteen years.

This will be the fourth loan these entrepreneurs are receiving from SMT through Kiva. Previous loans have been a great blessing to these borrowers. With these loans, their businesses expanded and they increased their profit margins. Consequently, their living standards have also improved.

Having repaid their last loan successfully, they are now requesting a new loan of Le 4,400,000.00 to further strengthen their businesses.

loans.use: To buy more dishware for sale in order to increase her business

loans.name: Mariaisabel

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86432&_tpos=4&_tpg=1
María Isabel es socia del Bancomunal los Viñedos, es jubilada de las Fuerzas Policiales.
María Isabel estudio en un centro de enseñanza de manualidades por varios años, le gusto mucho que sus amigas le empezaron a pedir que les vendiera su trabajos, se ha puesto a vender  todas las manualidades que  hace, ella también está enseñando en su casa manualidades.
María Isabel necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de materiales para realizar sus manualidades pana, lino, pinturas.
Desde que María Isabel esta en Finca aprendió  administrar su negocio, a separar el capital de las ganancias.  
El sueño de María Isabel es poner un bazar de manualidades.
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86432&_tpos=... María Isabel is a member of the Viñedos community bank. She is retired from the Police Force. María Isabel studied for several years in a center for teaching handicrafts. She really liked that her friends started to ask her to sell her work. She has set out to sell all of the handcrafts that she makes. She is also teaching handicrafts in her home. María Isable needs a loan of 1,000 PEN to buy materials like corduroy, linen, and paints to make her handicrafts. Since María Isabel has been with Finca she has learned to run her business and to separate the capital from the earnings. Her dream is to have a handicraft bazaar.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials like corduroy, linen, and paints to make her handicrafts

loans.name: Mamadou

texts.fr: MAMADOU G. EST UN JEUNE MECANICIEN NE A THIES LE 03 SEPTEMBRE 1981 .IL EST MARIE ET LOGE AVEC SA FEMME A LA CITE LAMY.DEPUIS LE JEUNE AGE IL TRAVAILLE AVEC SON PERE PRES DE LA GARE ROUTIERE.ACTUELLEMENT IL A OUVERT UN MAGASIN DE PIECES DETACHEES .AVEC CE PRET IL VEUT RENFORCER SES STOCKS DE MARCHANDISES.
texts.en:
Mamadou G. is a young mechanic born in Thiès on September 3, 1981. He is married and lives with his wife in the Cité Lamy. From a very young age he has been working with his father near the bus station. He recently opened a spare parts shop. With this loan, he wants to increase his stock of goods.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Spare parts business

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor de María es socia del Bancomunal los Viñedos.
Flor de María es casada, tiene46 años, dos hijos de 20 y 18 años, ellos estudian en instituto superior.
Flor de María ha puesto en su casa una bodega y poco a poco la está surtiendo. 
Flor de María necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, para la compra de gaseosa, abarrotes para su bodega.
 Desde que Flor de María está en Finca, su autoestima ha crecido,   tiene más seguridad, tiene independencia económica.
El sueño de Flor de María es que su negocio crezca y tener su bodega bien surtida.
texts.en:
Flor de María is a member of the communal bank “los Viñedos.” She is married, 46 years old, and has two children, ages 20 and 18, who are both college students. Flor de María has opened a small store in her home and is stocking it bit by bit. She needs a loan of 1,400 soles to buy soft drinks and groceries for her store. Since Flor de María has been with Finca, she has gained more self esteem, become more sure of herself, and increased her economic independence. Flor de María’s dream is to grow her business and have a well stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Flor de María necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, para la compra de gaseosa, abarrotes para su bodega.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es socia del Bancomunal los Viñedos
Luz es conviviente tiene  46 años, cuatro hijos D. 28,26, 24, 20 años ellos estudian y trabajan.
Luz tiene diez años vendiendo  menú,  actualmente tiene 40 comensales les lleva todos los días venD. desayuno, almuerzo y cena. Sus hijas le ayudan y su esposo también.    
Luz necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles, para la compra D. termos, taper,  arroz, aceite y fideos.  
DesD. que está en Finca aprendió a invertir y administrar  su negocio.
El sueño D. Luz es tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the Viñedos community bank. She is 46 and in a common law marriage. She has four children ages 28, 26, 24, and 20. They go to school and work. For ten years Luz has been selling fixed price meals. She currently takes meals to 40 customers every day. She sells breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Her daughter and her husband help her. Luz needs a loan for 1,200 PEN to buy a thermos, candle, rice, oil, and noodles. Since she has been with Finca she has learned to invest and to run her business. Her dream is to have a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a thermos, candle, rice, oil, and noodles

loans.name: Afusat

texts.en: Afusat is 49 years old and married with four children. She sells palm oil and she also has a machine that she uses to grind tomatoes, beans and peppers to make a living. Afusat hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more palm oil to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil

loans.name: Eudosia

texts.es:
Eudosia es socia del Bancomunal los Viñedos
Eudosia es conviviente, tiene 44 años, tres hijos de 14, 11 y 10 años, que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Eudosia tiene su negocio de venta de lencería por catalogo y productos de belleza  por catalogo, ella vende hace  12 años, tiene una grande cartera de clientas, este negocio le da tiempo para pasar más tiempo con sus hijos.  
Eudosia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles,  para la compra de lencería, brasieares, trusas, y productos de belleza por catalogo.
Desde que está en Finca, aprendió a compartir experiencias entre las socias, aprender más del negocio, a integrarse a un grupo de trabajo.  
El sueño de Eudosia  es terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Eudosia is a member of the communal bank “los Viñedos.” She lives with her partner, is 44 years old, and has three children, ages 14, 11, and 10, who all study in the state school. Eudosia has a business selling lingerie and beauty products by catalogue. She has been doing this for 12 years and has a large cadre of clients. This business allows her to spend more time with her children. Eudosia needs a loan of 1000 soles to buy lingerie, bras, underwear, and beauty products from catalogues. Since she has been with Finca, she has learned to share experiences with other members, learned more about having a business, and learned how to become a member of a work group. Eudosia’s dream is to finish building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Eudosia necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles,  para la compra de lencería, brasieares, trusas, y productos de belleza por catalogo.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn A. is a baker. She makes makes bread in the Cape Coast area and has done so since 2004. She is married and has four children: her husband is a driver.

Evelyn uses her income to pay for school fees and food for her family. She will use the loan to purchase flour, eggs, and margarine in bulk in order to prepare her bread goods for sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Evelyn plans to be able to provide quality education for the children.

loans.use: To purchase flour, eggs, and margarine in bulk to prepare bread for sale.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz es socia del Bancomunal los Viñedos
Luz es casada tiene 57 años, cuatro hijos de 36, 32, 22 y 14 años este ultimo esta estudiando en la escuela estatal. 
Luz  tenía una tienda en el mercado central pero por motivos de salud la tuvo que cerrar, y  se dedica a la venta de zapato por catalogo, zapatos de cuero.
Luz necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles, para la compra de calzado de invierno, botas, botines.
Desde que esta en Finca, su visión sobre el negocio se ampliado, tiene nuevas ideas de negocio y quiere verlas realizadas.
El sueño de Luz es que sus hijos sean profesionales, y crecer más en el negocio.
texts.en:
Luz is a member of the Viñedos community bank. Luz, 57, is married. She has four children ages 36, 32, 22, and 14. The youngest goes to the state school. Luz had a store in the central market. But, for health reasons, she had to close it. She now sells leather shoes by catalog. Luz needs a loan for 2,000 PEN to buy footwear for the winter, ankle boots, and knee boots. Since she has been with Finca, her vision of her business has grown, she has new business ideas, and she wants to see them become a reality. Her dream is to see her children become professionals and to grow more in the business.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy footwear for the winter, ankle boots, and knee boots

loans.name: Carmen Rosa

texts.es:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86573&_tpos=5&_tpg=1
Carmen Rosa es socia del Bancomunal los Viñedos
Carmen Rosa  es soltera, tiene 45 años,  estudio para profesora de primaria, pero por motivos  familiares, tuvo que dejar de enseñar en el colegio. Estudio zapatería  y se está dedicando a  hacer zapatos de tela y pantuflas. 
Desde que Carmen Rosa  esta en Finca, las capacitaciones han ayudado para ampliar su visión de negocio, y para trazarse metas nuevas. 
Carmen Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1400 soles, para la compra de material para hacer zapatos  
El sueño de Carmen Rosa es tener una empresa de confección de pijamas y pantuflas.
texts.en:
Carmen Rosa is a member of the Los Viñedos (The Vineyards) Communal Bank. Carmen Rosa is 45 years of age and single. She studied to become a primary school teacher, but for family reasons, she had to leave her studies. She studied shoemaking and now she makes cloth shoes and slippers. Since Carmen Rosa has been working with FINCA Peru, the trainers have been helping her to expand her vision of business so that she can set herself some new goals. Carmen Rosa needs a loan of 1,400 Sols to purchase materials for making shoes. Her dream is to have a business manufacturing pajamas and slippers. Click HERE to see her Previous Loan.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy material for making shoes.

loans.name: Yematon

texts.en: Yematon is 45 years old and married with three children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells tomatoes and peppers. Yematon hopes for a loan of 100,000 nairas to purchase more tomatoes and pepper to sell.  She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support!

loans.use: To purchase more tomatoes and peppers

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86576&_tpos=9&_tpg=1
Olga  es socia del Bancomunal los Viñedos, trabaja como entrevistadora para una farmacia a medio tiempo, estudio un curso de bisutería, se puso a   vender  las joyitas de fantasía  a sus amigas y familiares, hace más de un año, le esta yendo bien. 
Olga necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles, para  compra bisutería y para la compra de productos de belleza. 
Desde que está en Finca aprendió a no endeudarse, cuenta con más capital y tiene más ventas.
El sueño de Olga es tener un negocio propio.
texts.en:
Olga is a member of the “Los Viñedos” community bank and works part time as an interviewer for a pharmacy. She studied jewelry making and began selling costume jewelry to her friends and family. For more than a year this business has been going well.

Olga needs a loan of 1600 soles (Peruvian Currency) to buy jewelry supplies and beauty products.

Since she has been with Finca, she has learned not to accumulate debt, has access to more capital, and has sold more products.

Olga’s dream is to own her own business.

Olga's previous loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86576&_tpos=9&_tpg=1

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of jewelry supplies and beauty products.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.es:
Milagros  es socia del Bancomunal los Viñedos.
Milagros es casada tiene 39 años, dos hijos de 16 y 5 años que están estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Uno de sus vecinos  del barrio de estaba dejando su negocio de bodega y le ofreció a  Milagros, traspasarle el negocio, ella vio una oportunidad  y decidió tomarlo en alquiler, ahora milagros tiene su bodega hace dos años.  
Milagros necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de cerveza, gaseosa, para su bodega, 
Desde que está en Finca, aprende de las otras socias de sus experiencias sobre sus negocios, esto le ayuda mucho a ella, para administrar mejor su negocio.
El sueño de Milagros es tener su casa propia y poner un minimarket.
texts.en:
Milagros is a member of “Los Viñedos” community bank. She is 39 years old, married, and has two children, aged 16 and 5, who study at the state school.

One of Milagros’ neighbors was leaving the grocery store business and offered to lease their business to Milagros. Milagros saw this opportunity and decided to take the offer. Now she has had her own grocery store for two years.

Milagros needs a loan of 1200 soles (Peruvian Currency) to purchase beer and soda for her store.

Since she has been with Finca she has learned from other members about their business experiences and this helps her manage her own business better.

Milagro’s dream is to have her own house and to open a minimarket.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of beer and soda for grocery store

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86582&_tpos=3&_tpg=1
Juana  es socia del Bancomunal los Viñedos,  estudio un curso de manualidades, y confecciona toallas bordadas con cinta, hace carteras de tela en su casa, se compro una maquina recta y  una  rremalladora.
Desde que está en Finca aprendió a invertir, y ahorrar el dinero  de las ganancias.
Juana necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para la compra de materiales para sus trabajos, telas, cintas entre otros.
El sueño de Juana es tener una tienda  para vender  todas las manualidades que hace.
texts.en:
Juana is a member of “Los Viñedos” community bank. She studied a handicrafts course and now embroiders towels with ribbons and makes cloth purses at her house. She purchased a straight stitch sewing machine and an overlock sewing machine (serger).

Since she has been with Finca she has learned to invest and save the money she earns. Juana needs a loan of 1200 soles (Peruvian Currency) to purchase materials for her work such as cloth and ribbons among other things.

Juana’s dream is to have a store to sell all of the handicrafts that she makes.

Juana's first loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86582&_tpos=3&_tpg=1

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cloth, ribbons and other materials.

loans.name: Midieal

texts.en: Midieal sells bean cakes, popularly known as akara, and fried fish. She forty-nine years old and married with nine children. She is hoping to get a loan to purchase more beans and fish. She sends her thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more beans and fish

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86599&_tpos=16&_tpg=2
Rosa  es socia del Bancomunal Las Orquídeas. se quedo sin trabajo, y  por necesidad tuvo que dedicarse a cocinar, empezó  llevando  menús a diferentes empresas, hasta que le empezaron a pedir que hiciera buffet para eventos especiales, actualmente solo se dedica a hacer buffet.
Rosa necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para la compra de víveres para su buffet, según le pida. 
Desde que Rosa esta en Finca aprendió a esforzarse en el trabajo, a ser puntual con sus pagos y ser responsable  en el negocio.
El sueño de Rosa es poner un restaurante y tener una flota de taxi.
texts.en:
Rosa is a member of “Las Orquideas” community bank. She was unemployed and, out of necessity, begin to work as a cook. She started by taking menus to different businesses until they began to ask her to provide buffets for special events. Now she works solely with buffets.

Rosa needs a loan of 1000 soles (Peruvian currency) to purchase the buffet supplies that her clients request.

Since Rosa has been with Finca she has learned to work hard, be on time with her payments and be responsible in her business practices.

Rosa’s dream is to open a restaurant and own a fleet of taxis.

Rosa's first loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86599&_tpos=16&_tpg=2

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of buffet supplies that clients request.

loans.name: Graciela

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86605&_tpos=7&_tpg=2
Graciela  es socia del Bancomunal Las Orquídeas, es casada y tiene 55 años
Graciela  se dedica a dar desayuno  con la ayuda de su esposo, cada día se levanta bien temprano para la preparación de  los desayunos, ella empezó con una carreta y ahora tiene tres carretas y ha contratado a una señora para que atienda su tercera carreta.
Graciela necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para el arreglo de su carreta y compra al por mayor de quinua,  soya, cajas de leche, azúcar. 
Desde que  Graciela  esta  en  Finca aprendió a esforzarse cada día para llegar a cumplir sus sueños 
El sueño de Graciela es tener un restaurante
texts.en:
Graciela is a member of of “Las Orquideas” community bank. She 55 years old and married. Graciela sells breakfast with the help of her husband. Every day she gets up very early to prepare the breakfasts. She began with one cart and now has three, and has hired a woman to take charge of the third cart.

Graciela needs a loan of 1200 soles (Peruvian currency) to fix her cart and to buy quinoa, soy, milk, and sugar at wholesale prices.

Since Graciela has been with Finca she has learned to work hard every day to achieve her dreams. Graciela’s dream is to own her own restaurant.

Graciela's first loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86605&_tpos=7&_tpg=2

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To fix her cart and purchase quinoa, soy, milk and sugar at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Giovanna

texts.es:
Primer préstamo:
http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86611&_tpos=18&_tpg=1
Giovanna  es socia del Bancomunal Las Orquídeas, tiene un negocio de venta de ropa de vestir y sport elegante, ella vende en su casa y lleva también a las  empresas, a lo largo de estos años ya tiene una buena cartera de clientas. 
Giovanna necesita un préstamo de  1800 soles, para la compra de ropa, conjuntos, jeans.
Desde que Giovanna están en Finca, agradece por los prestamos que recibe le han ayudado para su negocio, tiene mucha tranquilidad, puede vender más.
El sueño de Giovanna es comprarse un departamento
texts.en:
First loan: http://www.kiva.org/app.php?page=businesses&action=about&id=86611&_tpos=18&_tpg=1 Giovanna is a member of Bancomunal Las Orquideas, and she has some space where she sells formal clothing as well as elegant sport clothing. She sells from her home and also delivers to companies. Throughout these last years she has acquired a good customer base. Giovanna needs an 1800 soles loan for the purchase of clothing, ensembles, and jeans. Since Giovanna is in FINCA, she is thankful for the loans she has received that have helped her business. She is very confident about being able to sell more. Giovanna's dream is to purchase an apartment.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of clothing

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina  es socia del Bancomunal Las Orquídeas
Es soltera tiene 30 años, termino la escuela estatal  y estudio márquetin, no pudo trabajar en su carrera, porque no conseguía trabajo, trabajo en cosas eventuales, hasta que decidió poner en su casa una bodega, hace cinco años que funciona su bodega y cada vez quiere que este bien surtida.
 Marina necesita un préstamo  de 1400 soles, para incrementar mas su bodega con abarrotes, azúcar, arroz, leche, fideos. 
Desde que está en Finca aprendió a trabajar en grupo, aprendió a organizar bien su trabajo y a ser puntual.
El sueño de Marina es tener una cadena de perfumería
texts.en:
Marina is a member of Bancomunal Las Orquideas. She is single and 20 years old. She finished state school where she studied marketing, but she couldn't find work in her field; since she didn't find employment, she worked part time until she decided to establish a small store from her home. She has been working in this store for five years, and she wants it to be well stocked all of the time. Marina needs a 1400 soles loan to increase her supply of groceries, sugar, rice, milk and noodles. Since she is in FINCA she learned about teamwork and how to organize her work and be punctual. Marina's dream is to have a perfume store chain.

Translated from Spanish by Esteban Riojas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase groceries

loans.name: Dalis

texts.es: Dalis tiene 20 años, es soltera, vive con su padre y sus abuelitos en la casa de ellos. Desde hace un año cuenta con una tienda de repuestos para motos y motocarros en un espacio de su casa, inició este negocio a raíz de que padre es mecánico y cuenta con gran cantidad de  clientes, y Dalis aprovecha esto para ofrecerles los repuestos para sus vehículos. Esta labor le gusta mucho porque está aprendiendo mucho sobre el comercio, además que con todas las personas a las que atiende, ha hecho buenas amistades. El deseo de Dalis, es que su negocio siga creciendo hasta llegar a tener una industria especializada en metales. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que solicita comprará más repuestos para implementar su tienda adecuadamente.
texts.en:
Dalis is 20 years old, single, and lives with her father and grandparents in their house. For one year she has run a spare parts store in a part of her home for motorcycles and motorcycle buggies. She started this business from the ground up as her father is a mechanic and has a lot of customers, and Dalis took advantage of this to offer them spare parts for their vehicles. She enjoys this work a lot because she is learning a lot about business, and furthermore, with all of the people that she assists, she has made good friendships. Dalis’ desire is that her business continues to grow until she is able to have a business specializing in metals. This is her first loan with MFP, and with the money that she is asking for she will buy more spare parts in order to adequately set up her store.

Translated from Spanish by William Gray, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase of merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Giancarlo

texts.es:
Giancarlo tiene 23 años, es padre de un precioso bebé, vive con su pareja en la casa de su abuela. 
Cuenta con un pequeño restaurante, donde trabaja con la ayuda de su hermana, quien tiene una muy buen sazón, atienden a sus comensales desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 4 de la tarde. En esta actividad llevan un periodo de 3 años y les va muy bien, además que le gusta mucho su trabajo, por ello que atiende a sus clientes con una gran sonrisa. Durante este tiempo, tanto por la atención, como por la calidad de la comida que ofrecen, han podido conseguir clientes regulares, lo que les da la esperanza de que con mayor esfuerzo, podrá lograr que su establecimiento se convierta en un restaurante muy reconocido, grande y más elegante. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, y con el dinero que viene solicitando comprará mesas, sillas, materiales de cocina y mejorará el ambiente de su pequeño restaurante.
texts.en:
Giancarlo is 23 years old, a father of a beautiful baby. He lives with his spouse at his grandmother's house. He has a small restaurant where he works with the help of his sister who is very good at seasoning. They start serving at 6:00 am until 4:00 pm. They have been doing this for a period of 3 years and are doing well, and they also enjoy their work very much and serve their clients with a huge smile. Because of the attention as well as the quality of the food they have regular clients which make them feel that with more effort they will be able to turn their establishement into a well-known, big, and very elegant restaurant. This is their first loan with MFP and with the money requested they will buy tables, chairs, kitchenware, and improve the atmosphere of their small restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase furniture and utensils for a restaurant.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es: Ramón tiene 35 años, es soltero y vive solo en su casa propia. Se dedica a la venta ambulante de medicinas veterinarias y ropa, este negocio lo viene realizando desde hace 10 años, y le gusta porque conoce muchos lugares y a medida que va entablando amistades, también gana muchos clientes. Ramón cree que la rentabilidad de su negocio de debe a que sus principales consumidores son los ganaderos y porque él trabaja generalmente por las carreteras donde se ubican los fundos y caseríos que están a en la rivera y por las chacras, que al ser lugares lejanos de la ciudad, las personas no tienen mucho acceso a las tiendas, por ello Ramón les lleva la mercadería hasta su zona, y la vende rápidamente. Por ello, que para más adelante quiere comprarse un carro para movilizarse con mayor rapidez y comodidad. Con MFP ya tiene 4 créditos, y le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque entre todos los integrantes se comprenden y son muy responsables con sus pagos. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá comprando más medicinas veterinarias y ropa para incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Ramón is 35 years old, single, and lives alone in his own house. He is a traveling salesman of veterinarian medicines and clothes. He has been doing this for the past 10 years and enjoys it, he knows many places and as he makes friends he also gets many clients. Ramón believes that the success of his business is because his main consumers are farmers and because he generally works on the highways where the large farms and villages are located and with the small farms, located far from the city and therefore the people do not have easy access to stores and that is the reason why Ramón takes his merchandise to the area and sells it fast. Therefore he wants to buy a vehicle to be able to move around faster and more comfortably. He has 4 loans with MFP and he likes to work with his group as all the members get along well and are responsible with their payments. The requested money will be invested in buying more veterinarian medicines and garments to increase sales.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad tiene 29 años, vive junto a su pareja, quien trabaja como operador de máquinas pesadas y tienen 2 hijos que están estudiando, la casa que habitan es propia. Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, tales como; colonias, lápices labiales, perfumes, talcos, etc. Sus productos los ofrece mediante catálogos que le brinda la empresa cosmética, y los vende al crédito o al contado, visitando a sus clientes de casa en casa. A Soledad le gusta mucho su trabajo porque cada día conoce más lugares de su ciudad, donde establece nuevos clientes y buenas amistades. Para que su negocio sea rentable, Soledad sólo trabaja a pedido y procura no dar crédito a sus clientes nuevos, ya que primero prueba su responsabilidad, si le pagan a tiempo, para las siguientes campañas ya pacta un tiempo de pago. Para el futuro le gustaría tener una tienda de perfumes y joyas. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque desde un inicio ha notado que son personas puntuales y responsables. Con el dinero que está solicitando comprará más cosméticos, además de una pequeña vitrina para exhibir y proteger sus productos.
texts.en:
Soledad is 29 years old, lives with her partner who works as a heavy-machine operator. They have 2 shool-going children and own the house where they live. She sells beauty products such as colognes, lipsticks, perfumes, talcs, etc. She offers the products from a catalogue she receives from the cosmetic company. She sells cash or on credit visiting her clients from house to house. Soledad enjoys her work very much as she knows many places of her town where she gets new clients and good friends. For her business to be successful, Soledad only works upon request and does not give credit to new clients as she first checks their responsibility to see if they pay on time and for the following sales she negotiates agreements of payment. For the future, she would like to have a store selling perfumes and jewellery. This is her first loan with MFP and she likes to work with her group as she has noticed, right from the beginning, that the members are punctual and responsible. With the money requested whe will buy cosmetics as well as a small showcase to show and protect her products.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Afia

texts.en:
Afia A. is thirty–five years old and married with two sons. One is in senior high school and the other is in junior high school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a farmer and mason by profession.

Afia is a trader. She runs a grocery store in her community. She purchases her goods in Dormaa, the district capital. Afia has been in business for one year and wants a loan to buy provisions in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy provisions in bulk.

loans.name: Anta

texts.fr: ANTA SAMB EST PARENT BENEFICIAIREDEPUIS PLUS DE CINQ ANS.ELLE A LONGTEMPS OPERE DANS LE DOMAINE DE LA FRIPPERIE OU ELLE CAPITALISE PLUSIEURS ANNEES D'EXPERIENCE.DESIRANT S'ORIENTER VERS LA VENTE DE TISSUS CE CREDIT LUI PERMETTRA DEDIVERSIFIER SON ACTIVITE.
texts.en:
Anta S. has been a member for more than 5 years. She has been working selling used clothes for a long time. She has the advantage of several years of experience and wants to move in the direction of selling cloth. This loan will permit her to diversify her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her working capital

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en:
Leticia Akyeampomaa is thirty–two years old and divorced with three children, two sons and a daughter, all of whom are in primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Leticia is a trader. She trades in textiles, mainly printed and designed fabrics. She hawks to sell and also treks to other towns to sell. Leticia purchases her products in Dormaa, the district capital. She has been in business for eight years and wants a loan to buy textiles in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy textiles in bulk

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en:
Theresa K. is forty–nine years old and divorced with four children, all of whom are daughters. Some are in senior high while others are in junior high school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Theresa is a trader. She trades in textiles – printed and designed fabrics. She also deals in children’s wear, dressing bags and ready-made apparel. She hawks to sell and also treks to other towns to sell. Theresa purchases her textiles and clothing products from Dormaa, the district capital. She has been in business for twelve years and wants a loan to buy textiles in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy textiles in bulk

loans.name: Ajara

texts.en:
Ajara B. is fifty–four years old and married with seven children, four sons and three daughters. Some of the children are in senior high while others are in junior high and primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Ajara trades in dried peppers. She distributes to retailers and food vendors in her community. Ajara buys her dried peppers from nearby markets at a good price. She is also into food vending. She has been in business for over ten years and wants a loan to buy goods in bulk. Ajara is hopeful of expanding her business and wants to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 44 years old, is married and has three sons who attend primary school and junior high school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Elizabeth's husband runs a provision store.

Elizabeth is a yam trader. She distributes to retailers and food vendors in her community. She also sells at the lorry station. Elizabeth procures yam tubers from Kintampo, a nearby market, at an relatively effective price, but she hopes to obtain a loan to procure goods in bulk. She has been in business for over 10 years.

She is hopeful about expanding her business and wishes to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy yam tubers in bulk

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret trades in food items such as yams, vegetables, etc. She sells on a tabletop at the local market square. She procures her goods from Kintampo, a nearby market, at effective prices. 
Margaret is 34 years old, married and has three children: one son and two daughters. She says all are currently in primary school. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a farmer. 
Margaret has been in business for one year now and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. Margaret is hoping to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy yams

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida B. is 31 years old. She is married and has given birth to four children: two sons and two daughters. She says all her children are currently in primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a mason by profession.

Vida is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice and stew. She prepares the food in her place of residence and sells on the street from morning to evenings. She procures bags of maize and other ingredients from nearby towns. Vida has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of rice

loans.name: Virgen Natividad De Lares Group

texts.es:
Los socios del banco “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD D. LARES”, son naturales del distrito D. Lares en la provincia D. Calca, del departamento D. Cusco. Ubicado a 4 horas y 30 segundos.

Nuestros socios alternan sus actividades agrícolas como es la siembra D. papa, maíz, trigo, cebada y las labores domésticas en el caso D. las mujeres con la venta D. comida en la plaza central del pueblo, los días sábados y domingos, los varones llevan sus productos como granos secos a vender a otros distritos dentro D. la ciudad del Cusco y a la misma ciudad del Cusco, los socios requieren el préstamo para reinvertir en sus diferentes cultivos y compra D. productos como, fideos, arroz, aceite, harinas, verduras y otros.

Los socios agradecen el apoyo brindado y el préstamo otorgado parea la realización D. sus sueños, y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus deudas en el plazo programado.
texts.en:
The members of the “VIRGEN NATIVIDAD D. LARES” bank are from the Lares district, in the province of Calca, located within the region of Cusco. Our members alternate between agricultural activities, like planting potatoes, corn, wheat and barley, and home-based businesses in which the women sell food in the main town plaza on Saturdays and Sundays, while the men take products like dry grains and sell them in other districts around and within the city of Cusco. The members need this loan to reinvest in their various crops and to buy products like dry noodles, rice, oil, flour, vegetables and other ingredients. The members are grateful for the support they have received and for the approval of their loan, which they hope will help them realize their dreams. They promise to repay this loan according to schedule.

Translated from Spanish by Zev Lowe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling food in the main town plaza

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa, 65 years old, is married and has given birth to nine children: four sons and five daughters. According to Yaa, all her children have completed school and are currently working. Some are married. She lives with her husband and some of her grandchildren in a rented apartment in a a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a farmer.

Yaa is a trader. She trades in smoked fish. She procures smoked fish from Dormaa, the district capital, and sells them in the local market on a tabletop. She also journeys to other towns to sell. She has been in this business for two years and hopes to obtain a loan to procure fish in bulk. 

She hopes to expand her business and to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish for sale.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa, 53 years old, is divorced and has three daughters of junior high and high school age. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. 

Yaa is a trader. She trades in textile materials - specifically, in printed and designed fabrics. She also deals in ready-made apparel. She hawks her wares in the neighborhood and also journeys to other towns to sell. Yaa procures her materials from Dormaa. She has been in business for over 20 years and hopes to obtain a loan to procure textile materials in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure textiles in bulk

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima trades in smoked fish. She procures smoked fish from Dormaa, the district capital, and sells in the local market on a tabletop. She also treks to other towns to sell. 
Fatima is 55 years old, married and has nine children: four sons and five daughters. Fatima says almost all of her children have completed school and are currently working. Some are married. The last two are in junior high school. She lives with her husband and some of her children in a rented apartment in a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a farmer.
Fatima has been in this business for over 25 years and wants a loan to procure fish in bulk. She is hoping to expand her business and to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish

loans.name: Takku Liggey Tefess 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe  takku liggey tefess 1est une association qui regroupe des femmes  mariées qui s ‘activent de petit commerce de divers produits. Certaines d’entre elles vendent des tissus d’autre des chaussures et le troisième fait de la restauration   . Le groupe de trois(3) membres se réuni chaque semaine pour collecter  les cotisations des membres qui sont versées à une d’elle à tour de rôle .Avec le prêt elles comptent renforcer leur activité en achetant plus de marchandises.les revenus tirés de leurs activité leur permettent d’entretenir leurs enfants. Ces femmes habitent à Mbour  ville côtière située à 70 km de Dakar
texts.en:
The group Takku Liggey Tefess 1 brings together married women who are all petty traders selling various items. One sells cloth, another shoes, and the third sells cooked food. The group of three members meets once a week to collect dues from each member which are paid out to one of them in turn. With the loan, they intend to bolster their businesses by buying more merchandise. The income from their businesses permits them to support their children. These women live in Mbour, a coastal town situated 70 km from Dakar.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en: Safia S. is 28 years old. She is a divorced mother of three kids: one son and two daughters. Her kids are currently pursuing education at the primary school level. She lives with them in a rented apartment in a farming and trading community called Kofiase, suburb of Dorma the district capital. She trades in smoked fish. She procures smoked fish from Dormaa, the district capital, and sells in the local market on a tabletop. She also treks to other towns to sell and uses the strategy of door-to-door selling. Safia has been in business for two years and wants a loan to procure fish in bulk. She is expecting to receive higher profit with the loan and hopes that she would make more savings to support her kids education.

loans.use: To procure smoked fish.

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: FATOU M. EST PARENT BENEFICIAIRE DEPUIS PLUSIEURS ANNEES.ELLE EVOLUE DANS LE COMMERCEDE DETAIL DE SAVON EN POUDRE.VU LA FAIBLESSE DE SES REVENUS ELLE DESIRE ACCROITRE SON FOND DE ROULEMENT.
texts.en:
Fatou has been a member for several years. She retails detergent. In view of how little she earns, she would like to increase her working capital.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing her working capital

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina C. sells tie-dye fabrics in Asafora near Cape Coast. Georgina has graduated senior high school. She is married and has one child. Her husband is a carpenter. Georgina has been selling tie-dye fabrics since 2004. She is responsible for paying school fees, feeding the family, buying clothing and paying utilities. Her loan will be used to buy dyes and wax for making tie-dye. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to build a house.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy dyes and wax for making tie-dye

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Abena O. is 45 years old. She is married and has given birth to eleven children: nine sons and two daughters. She says that some of her children are out of school and working. Others are currently in senior high, junior high, and primary school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is unemployed due to old age. Abena is a food vendor. She prepares and sells rice and stew. She prepares the food in her place of residence and sells on the street in the morning and afternoons. She procures bags of maize and other ingredients from nearby towns. Abena has been in business for over fifteen years and wants a loan to procure bags of rice and other ingredients in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business so she can give her children the best of education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure bags of rice in bulk

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence S. is 29 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children: a son and a daughter. She says both of her children are currently in primary school. She lives with her husband and her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a mason by profession. 
She trades in eggs. She procures crates of eggs from poultry farms in her community and nearby communities at affordable prices. Florence sells in the local market and also treks to other towns to sell. She distributes some eggs to retailers and beverage sellers. Florence has been in this business for four years and wants a loan to procure crates of eggs in bulk. She is hopeful to expand her business and give her children the best education she can.

loans.use: To procure eggs in bulk

loans.name: Takku Liggey Tefess2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe  takku liggey tefess 2est une association qui regroupe des femmes  mariées qui s ‘activent de petit commerce de divers produits. Certaines d’entre elles vendent des tissus des chaussures. Le groupe de quatre(4) membres se réunissent chaque semaine pour collecter  les cotisations des membres qui sont versées à une d’elle à tour de rôle .Avec le prêt elles comptent renforcer leur activité en achetant plus de marchandises.les revenus tirés de leurs activité leur permettent d’entretenir leurs enfants. Ces femmes habitent à Mbour  ville côtière située à 70 km de Dakar
texts.en:
The group Takku Liggey Tefess 2 brings together married women who are all petty traders selling various items. One sells cloth, another shoes, and so on. The group of four members meets once a week to collect dues from each member which are paid out to one of them in turn. With the loan, they intend to bolster their businesses by buying more merchandise. The income from their businesses permits them to support their children. These women live in Mbour, a coastal town situated 70 km from Dakar.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of additional goods for re-sale

loans.name: Mama Penda

texts.fr: mame penda T. est une enseignante qui habite au quartier grand thies;elle est née en 1970 à dakar et est mariée et mère de trois enfants .Parallèlement à métier d'enseignant,elle fait du commerce pour améliorer ses revenus;c'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite un nouveau pret pour renforcer son stock de marchandises.
texts.en:
Mame Penda T. is a teacher who lives in the Grand Thies neighborhood. She was born in 1970 in Dakar and is married and the mother of 3 children. Besides her teaching, she works as a petty trader to increase her income. For that reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can bolster her inventory.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: increasing her business inventory

loans.name: Afisatu

texts.en:
Afisatu K., a 39-year-old divorced mother of three sons and two daughters, all currently in junior high and primary school, lives with them in a rented apartment in Kofiase, a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Afisatu is a food vendor who operates a ‘chop bar,’ a local restaurant near the market square in her community that sells a variety of local dishes. She procures bags of cassava, maize and other ingredients from nearby towns and prepares and sells the food at the bar from morning to evening. Afisatu has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure food items in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy cassava, maize and other ingredients.

loans.name: Ramatoulaye

texts.fr: PARENT BENEFICIAIRE DEPUIS PLUSIEURS ANNEES ,elle capitalise cinq annees d'experience.elle vend des tissus et voudraitaugmenter sa capacite de financement.
texts.en:
As a member for several years, she can count on her five years of experience. She sells cloth and would like to grow her capacity for financing.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: growing her business

loans.name: Yaa's Group

texts.en:
Yaa, 40 years old, is married and has five children: four sons and a daughter. She says all of her children are currently in junior high and primary schools. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Yaa is an egg trader. She procures crates of eggs from poultry farms in her community and nearby communities at affordable prices and sells these in the local market. She also travels to other towns to sell. Some of her wares are distributed to local retailers and beverage sellers. 

She has been in business for four years and would like to obtain a loan to procure crates of eggs in bulk. Yaa is hopeful about expanding her business and hopes to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure eggs in bulk for sale.

loans.name: Magatte

texts.fr: MAGATTE fall est une dame courageuse qui loge au quartier cité lamy avec son mari et ses enfants;elle a une grande expérience dans le commerce de poissons qu'elle fait depuis plusieurs années au marché moussanté.c'est pour cela qu'elle sollicite un nouveau pret pour améliorer ses revenus;
texts.en:
Magatte T. is a hard-working lady who lives in the Cité Lamy area with her husband and her children. She has a lot of experience selling fish, which she has been doing for several years in the Moussanté market. That is why she is requesting a new loan to improve her income.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of fish

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina O. has been selling maize, groundnuts and beans in Yamoransa, Cape Coast, since 1994. She travels to farming areas to buy the food supplies in large quantities, keeps them in a warehouse and then distributes them to her customers upon demand. 
Dina is married and has four children. She has received schooling through senior high school. Her husband is a driver. 
Dina uses her income to pay for school fees and utilities. She will use this loan to purchase more food supplies for selling. With the profits from her expanded business, Dina plans to put up another building.

loans.use: To purchase more food supplies

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony is 35 years old. He is unmarried and has no children. Tony lives on his own in a rented apartment in a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.

Tony says he wants to be prepared financially before he gets married. He is a trader. He runs a cold store at the market square in his community. Here he sells fresh fish and fresh meats such as beef, chicken, and turkey. He would like to obtain a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase his stock. Tony has been in business for two years. He hopes to expand his business and improve upon his standard of living.

loans.use: To procure fresh fish and meat for sale

loans.name: Takku Liggey Tefess 6 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe  takku liggey tefess 6est une association qui regroupe des femmes  mariées qui s ‘activent de petit commerce de divers produits. elles vendent de la patte d’arachide. Le groupe de trois(3) membres se réunissent chaque semaine pour collecter  les cotisations des membres qui sont versées à une d’elle à tour de rôle .Avec le prêt elles comptent renforcer leur activité en achetant plus de marchandises.les revenus tirés de leurs activité leur permettent d’entretenir leurs enfants. Ces femmes habitent à Mbour  ville côtière située à 70 km de Dakar
texts.en:
The group Takku Liggey Tefess 6 brings together married women who sell various products. They sell peanut butter. The group of 3 members meets each week to collect dues from each member which are paid out to each of them in turn. With the loan they intend to bolster their businesses by buying additional inventory. The income from their businesses allows them to support their children. These women live in Mbour, a coastal town situated 70 km from Dakar.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of peanuts

loans.name: Matel

texts.fr: MATEL B. est une jeune femme née à thies le 18 AOUT 1982;elle est mariée et gère une boutique aux parcelles assainies;avec ce pret elle veut renforcer son stock de marchandises pour mieux satisfaire sa clientèle
texts.en:
Matel B. is a young woman who was born in Thies on August 18, 1982. She is married and runs a little shop in the Parcelles Assainies district. With this loan, she wants to bolster her stock of merchandise so as to satisfy the needs of her clientele better.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: adding to her stock of merchandise

loans.name: Christian

texts.en:
Christian is 34 years old. He is married and has a son who is currently in nursery school. He lives with his wife and son in a rented apartment in a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. His wife is a seamstress by profession. 

Christian is a commercial driver. He conveys goods and passengers from his community to nearby towns. He says his bus needs to be given a thorough maintenance in order to be in good working condition. He would like to obtain a loan to pursue this dream. 

Christian has been in business for eight years. He hopes to maintain his car in good condition so as to remain in business. Christian desires to improve upon his family's standard of living and to give his son a sound education.

loans.use: For bus maintenance.

loans.name: Albertha

texts.en:
Albertha is 32 years old. She is divorced and has two daughters attending primary school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region.
