Albertha is a trader. She trades in textiles such as ladies’ underwear and printed fabrics. She also deals in footwear. Albertha hawks her wares in her neighborhood and also journeys to other towns to sell. She procures her materials from Dormaa. She has been in business for eight years and would like a loan in order to procure textile materials in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and to give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure textiles in bulk for sale.

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr: MR moussa D. est un maitre coranique qui habite aux parcelles assainies de thies;il est marié et est père de trois enfants;avec l'approche de l'hivernage ,il veut terminer les travaux de constrution qu'il a entamé chez lui c'est pour satisfaire ce besoin qu'il a sollicité ce pret
texts.en:
Mr. Moussa D. lives in Parcelles Assainies district in Thies and teaches the Koran. He is married and the father of three children. With the approach of the rainy season, he wants to finish doing the construction that he has begun at home. This is why he is asking for this loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: building

loans.name: Philomina

texts.en: Philomina B. is single and has two children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Philomina bakes bread for sale and also sells flour and margarine in Yamoransa, Cape Coast, which she has been doing since 2002. Philomina uses her income to pay for utilities, school fees and clothing. Philomina will use this loan to purchase more flour and margarine to sell and use for baking her bread. With the profits from her expanded business, Philomina plans to buy land.

loans.use: To purchase more flour and margarine

loans.name: Gifty's Group

texts.en: Gifty O. is a professional hair dresser. She is 30 years old, married and has three daughters. Two of her daughters are currently in primary school while the last born has not started school. She lives with her husband and children in a rented apartment in a community called Kofiase. It is a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a mason by trade. Her saloon is located on the principal street of her community where she serves her numerous clients. Gifty says she has four apprentices under training, equipping them with skills to manage their own saloon soon. She wants a loan to buy working tools and materials such as pomades, lotions, creams, weavons, mesh etc. to improve her services to her clients. She started her operation three years ago. She is expecting to improve her income to support her family.

loans.use: To buy hairdressing materials.

loans.name: Mame Ramata

texts.fr: MAME RAMATA D. EST PARENT BENEFICIAIRE DEPUIS PLUSIEURS ANNEES.DISPOSANT D'UN FRIGO ELLE VEND DE LA GLACE ET DU JUS.CE CREDIT LUI PERMETTRA DE RENFORCER SON DE MATIERE PREMIERE.ELLE CAPITALISE SIX ANNEES D'EXPERIENCE.
texts.en:
MAME RAMATA D. has been a recipient parent for several years and has a refrigerator. She sells ice and juices. This loan will enable her to bolster her inventory of basic ingredients. She capitalizes on her six years of experience.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commerce

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati L. is 44 years old. She is married and has seven children, four sons and three daughters. Fati says some are in the senior high while others are in the junior high and the primary schools. She lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a farmer. 
Fati is a trader. She trades in all kinds of vegetables: tomatoes, peppers, garden eggs (similar to eggplant), etc. She sells her produce on a table top in the market square. She procures her vegetables from farmers in nearby communities at a good price. Fati has been in business for more than 20 years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure vegetables

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace G. is 49 years old. She is married and has seven children, four sons and three daughters. She says some are in the senior high while others are in the junior high school. The firstborn, however, is in the tertiary. Grace lives with her children and husband in a family house in a town called Kofiase. Kofiase is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Her husband is a teacher by profession. 

Grace is a baker. She bakes bread. She sells her bread on a table top in the market square. Grace also supplies the greater part of the bread to retailers in her community. She procures bags of flour and other ingredients from Dormaa. She has been in business for more than 25 years and wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To buy bags of flour

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina is 65 years old and is the widowed mother of six children, the youngest of whom is 28 years old. Her children are all now independent and no longer live with her. Saturnina lives in Atalaya, a small jungle village on the Carbon River that serves as the main entry point into Manu National Reserve, one of Peru's biggest tourist attractions.

Saturnina runs a very small neighborhood grocery store in the Atalaya, where she sells basic food supplies, drinks, coca leaves and canisters of natural gas (used to power gas stoves). Atalaya is the starting point for tourist boat expeditions into Manu National Reserve so, though it is a very small town, there are always many people passing through. Saturnina, or “Satuca”, has had her store for the past three years, and has been a member of the Arpia de Atalaya Village Bank for almost as long. She works alone, and keeps her store open all day. 

Saturnina is requesting a loan of 2,000 soles to outfit her store with more basic food items and to refill empty gas canisters. Her dream for the future is to expand her store and to own a home of her own someday. She has pledged to repay this loan in full and on time.

loans.use: To restock her grocery store and to refill empty gas canisters

loans.name: Williams

texts.en:
Williams A. is 41 years old. He is married and has three children, all girls. He says two of the children are currently in the primary school. The youngest is yet to start. He lives with his wife and children in a family house in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. Williams' wife is a trader.  

He is also into trading. He deals in all kinds of baking ingredients such as flour, margarine, etc. He sells in a store in his community. Williams supplies the majority of the bakers in his community. He wants a loan to procure bags of flour and other materials in bulk. Williams has been in business for two years. He hopes to improve his standard of living and give his children a sound education.

loans.use: To procure baking ingredients

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys A. is a trader who sells maize, groundnuts and beans at Yamoransa in Cape Coast. She is married and has four children. Her husband is a security guard.

Gladys has been selling maize, groundnuts and beans since 2000. She is responsible for paying school fees, utilities and clothes. Her loan will be used to purchase more food supplies for selling. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to buy land.

loans.use: Her loan will be used to buy more food supplies for selling.

loans.name: Viviana

texts.en:
Viviana is 44 years old and married with four children, all of whom are now grown adults who live on their own. Viviana lives in the small jungle town of Pilcopata, where she sells anticuchos (kabobs) in the market. The town itself is little more than a dirt road with a few convenience stores, a disco, several Internet cafés, and a couple of neighborhood bars, but the market is new and modern. Since all of the buses traveling to outlying jungle towns pass through Pilcopata, the market is fairly busy on the days that buses leave and enter the town (Monday, Wednesday and Friday). The Pilcopata market, unlike most markets, operates mainly in the evening, since most buses leave the town between 5 and 7pm.

Viviana has been selling anticuchos for the past three years. Prior to that, she worked on her family’s farm. On Mondays, Wednesdays and Fridays, she starts preparations at 3 p.m. and usually sells until 12 p.m. She earns 60 to 80 soles (US $20 to $27) each day she works. She sells different kinds of anticuchos, although most are made of beef or cow heart.

Viviana is requesting a loan of 2500 soles to buy meat. The money should be enough to supply her business with meat for the next two or three months. She has pledged to repay this loan on time and in full. Viviana’s dream for the future is to finish building her house (it is currently half-built).

loans.use: To buy meat to make anticuchos

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia O. is 45 years old. She is married and has five children, three sons and two daughters. Felicia lives with her children and husband in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming/trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. 

Felicia’s husband is a radio repairer while she is a trader. She runs a cold store in her community. Felicia says her cold store is at the market square. She sells fresh fish, beef, chicken, turkey, etc. She wants a loan to procure goods in bulk to increase her stock. She has been in business for two years. She hopes to expand her business and give her children the best education.

loans.use: To procure fresh fish and meat

loans.name: Mame Ndiaydiaw

texts.fr: MAME NDIAYDIAW G. EST PARENT BENEFICIAIRE DEPUIS PLUSIEURS ANNEES.ELLE OPERE DANS LA RESTAURATION ET CAPITALISE PLUS DE CINQ ANS D'ACTIVITE.ELLE SOLLICITE CE PRET POUR AMELIORER SON ACTIVITE.
texts.en:
MAME NDIAYDIAW G. has been recipient parent for several years. She operates a restaurant and capitalizes on her five years of work. She’s requesting this loan to improve her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restaurant business

loans.name: Yadira Lizeth

texts.es:
La Sra. Yadira A. tiene 30 años de edad y esta casada con el sr. Erinson Castro con el cual han procreado 2 hijos, ella se dedica a la compra de mariscos al por mayoy y los vende al detalle, ella tiene 10 años de realizar esta actividad, ella necesita el credito para comprar 4 quintales de camarones y pescado. 
su meta es poder tener una gran tienda de venta de mariscos y tambien desea poner un restaurant de mariscos.
nos comento que en toda su vida le ha sido dificil salir adelante por muchos motivos pero que ahora siente que todo le va a salir muy bien y se nota que tiene todos los deseos de superarse, y tambien quiere que sus hijos sean hombres de bien y unos muy buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yadira A. is 30 years old, married to Mr. Erinson Castro and they have 2 children. She sells seafood, wholesale and retail, and she has been doing this for 10 years. She needs a loan to buy 4 "quintales" (1 quintal=46 kgs.) of shrimp and fish.

It is her goal to have a big store selling seafood and she also wishes to have a seafood restaurant. She tells us that it has been difficult for her to get ahead during her life for many reasons, but now she feels that everything is going to turn out fine and it is obvious that she desires to move ahead and she also wants her children to become good human beings and excellent professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fish and shrimp.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth Y. trades in eggs. She procures crates of eggs from poultry farms in local communities at affordable prices and sells in the local market. She also treks to other towns to sell and distributes some to retailers and beverage sellers. 
Elizabeth is 48 years old, divorced and has two children: a son and a daughter. Her son is in the polytechnic and her daughter is currently in junior high school. She lives with her children in a rented apartment in a town called Kofiase. It is a farming and trading community near Dormaa, the district capital, in the Brong Ahafo region. 
Elizabeth has been in business for three years and wants a loan to procure crate of eggs in bulk. She is hoping to expand her business and give her children the best education she can afford.

loans.use: To procure eggs

loans.name: Noukeïssa

texts.fr:
Née le 17 Janvier 1978 à Kayes, célibataire et mère de 2 enfants,  Noukeïssa Sidibé  réside avec sa sœur  et ses enfants à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle s’initia très tôt aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat-vente des draps de lit, d’habits pour enfants, de pagnes wax, des tissus brodés, etc.  Elle est beaucoup sollicitée  de sa clientèle (composée essentiellement des femmes) pour la qualité de ses produits.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant trois  ans. Après 2 prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier (Association JEKAFO de Sanoubougou II) et deux prêts individuels, tous correctement remboursés, elle est à son troisième prêt individuel.
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 4 douzaines de complets pour enfants, 6 complets de draps de lit, 4 complets de tissus brodés et des pièces de pagne wax.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   
Elle achète ses marchandises à Bamako et effectue ses ventes  au comptant, à crédit en détail et de façon ambulante  essentiellement  auprès des fonctionnaires des services publics et privés  de  Sikasso. 
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born on January 17, 1978 in Kayes, Ms. Noukeïssa Sidibé is unmarried and the mother of two children. She resides with her sister and children in Sanoubougou I, a working-class district of Sikasso City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having lacked the chance to continue with her schooling due to societal reasons, she was soon introduced to income-generating work, notably buying and selling bed sheets, children's clothing, Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), embroidered fabrics, etc. She is in high demand by her customers (composed essentially of women) for the quality of her products. Concerned about doing better in satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso three years ago. After two solidarity loans (group loans) in a women's association in her area (Association JEKAFO de Sanoubougou II) and two individual loans, all correctly repaid, she is now on her third individual loan. This loan will be used to buy four dozen outfits for children, six sets of bed sheets, four outfits of embroidered fabrics, and bolts of Wax pagnes. Supplies are gotten in Bamako, and sales are made at the retail level, cash or credit accepted, while going door-to-door. Her customers are composed essentially of civil servants and private company employees of Sikasso. She envisions using this loan to realize a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used to augment her working capital, to help cover family expenses, to make loan interest payments, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bed sheets, cloth, embroidered fabrics, and children's clothing

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en: Hannah A. started her fish sales four years ago at Dorma in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana. Hannah prepares and serves her customers with very tasty and good quality fish and because of that, many customers buy from her stand. She buys fish from the fishermen and smokes them. She has a large customer base who travels from the other part of the region to buy her fish. She has added some petty products which are frequently demanded by her customers. She is now 48 years old, married and the mother of four children. Currently all her children are in school. She wants to use the loan to buy more fish to increase sales and income to support her children's education and grow her business. She belongs to the village bank called Yesu Tease.

loans.use: To buy more smoked and dried fish.

loans.name: Maria Petrona

texts.es:
la Sra. Maria Petrona F. tiene  58 años de edad y esta casada con el Sr. Ubence Reina, ellos tiene 3 hijos y ninguno depende de ellos ya que son personas grandes y realizaron su vida aparte, ya estan casados y son hombres de bien.
la Sra. F. se dedica a la compra y venta de camararon al detalle, ella tiene 4 años de dedicarse a esta actividad, en estos momentos ella necesita un credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia y asi tener mayores ventas y mejores ganancias, la cantidad que ella quiere comprar son 170 libras de camaron.
esta es la unica fuente de ingresos que ella tiene, su meta es poder poner un local grande para hacer una tienda de venta de mariscos.
junto con su esposo ellos dos sacan adelante su hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Petrona F. is 58 years old, married to Mr. Ubence Reina, and they have 3 children who do not depend on them as they are all grown-ups, live apart, are married, and good human beings.

Mrs. F. buys and sells shrimp, retail, and she has been doing this for 4 years. At the moment she needs a loan to be able to buy more merchandise and thus increase sales and improve earnings. She wishes to buy 170 pounds of shrimp. This is her only income resource, and it is her goal to be able to open a store in a big facility to sell seafood. Together with her husband, they cover the expenses of their home.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase shrimp.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gifty

texts.en:
Gifty A. is 45 years old. She is a married woman with three children. Currently all her children are in school. Gifty belongs to the village bank called "Yesu Tease."

Gifty has been selling frozen foods like chicken, mutton, fish, meat, sausages etc. in the local market of Dorma for seven years. Gifty also prepares and sells food like banku and cooked yams. Banku is prepared from ground maize and it is eaten with different sauces.

She does not have adequate funds to support her business. This has affected her operation, especially in the face of increasing food prices. With this loan, she wants to purchase more frozen foods, such as fish, chicken, pork and meat, so she can raise enough income to expand her sales. She wants to save part of the proceeds to invest in her children's education. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy frozen foods and cereals

loans.name: Santos Hernan

texts.es:
el Sr. Santos Hernan N. tiene 49 años de edad, el se dedica a la compra y venta de camarones, el viaja a cedeño y monjaras para comprar el producto y lo transporta hacia San Lorenzo para la venta del mismo, este negocio es muy bueno ya que en esta zona el marisco es muy comido por todos ademas que los viajantes se paran a comer en los restaurantes mariscos como ser sopas de camaron, pescado frito, curiles etc. por eso es que en esta zona los mariscos son bien vendidos.
el necesita el credito para comprar 500 libras de camarones, esto es porque esta distribuyendo el producto en diferentes supermercados y restaurantes de la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
texts.en:
Mr. Hernan N. is 49 years old. He buys and sells shrimp, travelling to the towns of Cedeño and Monjaras to buy and transporting them to San Lorenzo to sell. This is a very good business because everyone eats seafood in this area. Travelers also stop to eat seafood in restaurants: shrimp soup, fried fish, clams etc., so in this region seafood sells very well.

He needs this loan to buy 500 pounds of shrimp because he is distributing the product in different supermarkets and restaurants in the city of San Lorenzo.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Shrimp

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas D. is twenty-nine years old. She is married and has two children. She owns and operates a beauty and Rasta hairdo salon in her neighborhood.

Dorcas is very skilled. She is a talented hairdresser who adds a lot of beauty to the hair of her many customers. That is her secret. Dorcas uses weavons and meshes to plait her clients' hair to add beauty to them. She has been in hairdressing business for seven years.

Because she believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service, she wants to use the loan to buy larger quantities of hair products like weavons, mesh, threads etc. to avoid shortage and poor service. She has three apprentices training under her. She belongs to the village bank called "Noble ladies."

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products

loans.name: Laura

texts.es:
Z. es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen Maria.
Z. es soltera y tiene 48 años, Sonia tiene bajo su responsabilidad a un sobrino a quien educa, Z. se dedica al engorde de ganado en sus terrenos de Rancha. Además viaja a las ferias de la región en donde compra cereales, papa, queso, animales menores, productos que vende en el  mercado nery garcía y también de casa en casa.
Z. necesita un préstamo de 1600 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de carnero y vaca.
Los sueños de Sonia son educar a su sobrino y ampliar su establo para engorde de ganado.
texts.en:
Z. is a member of Virgen Maria comunal bank. Z. is 48 years old and single. She takes care of a nephew who she sends to school. Z. works with livestock, fattening them up on her ranch land. She also travels to area markets where she buys grain, potatoes, cheese and small animals to sell in a different market, called Nery Garcia, and from door to door. Z. needs a loan of 1600 soles (Peruvian currency) to invest in the purchase of goats and cows. Z.’s dream is to educate her nephew and expand her stable where she raises livestock.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of goats and cows.

loans.name: Hadijatu

texts.en:
Hadijatu I. started her fish business six years ago in Mankessim in the central region of Ghana. She prepares and serves her customers very tasty and good quality fish, so many customers buy from her stand.

Hadijatu buys stocks of fish from the fishermen and smokes them. She also sells food, such as bags of maize. She treks to Atebubu in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana to buy her food. She has a large customer base that travels from the other part of the region to buy her fish.

She is now 38 years old, married, and the mother of four children. Wtih the help of the government's free compulsory education, all of her children are now in school.

She wants to use the loan to buy larger stocks of assorted fish and maize to increase her sales and income so that she can support her children's education and expand her business. She belongs to the village bank called "Noble Ladies."

loans.use: To buy more fresh fish and maize.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es: Teresa tiene 40 años, es madre de 2 hijos, y vive junto a su esposo, quien se dedica al transporte de pasajeros. Tiene una pequeña bodega en su casa, donde vende productos de primera necesidad, golosinas y bebidas, en esta labor lleva un año, y le gusta mucho su negocio porque se relaciona más con sus vecinos y se gana la confianza de sus clientes, quienes acuden a comprar sus productos a diario gracias a su buena atención. Esta actividad le es rentable porque es la única en su zona, por lo que no tienen competencia y las ganancias que recibe diariamente, ayudan a sostener las necesidades de su hogar. El deseo de Teresa para el futuro es tener un restaurante, ya que a parte de ser una buena comerciante, tiene una deliciosa sazón. Este es su 3er crédito con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su banco comunal porque entre todos los integrantes se comprenden y son puntuales en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará más productos para surtir su tienda.
texts.en:
Teresa is 40 years old, has two children, and lives with her husband who works in transportation.

She has a small store in her house where she sells basic necessities, sweets, and drinks. She has worked in this business for a year and she likes it a lot because she interacts more with her neighbors and earns the trust of her clients who come to her store daily to buy products, due to the good customer service they receive. This business is profitable for her because it is the only store in the area, so she does not have competition, and the earnings she receives daily help to support her household needs.

Teresa’s wish for the future is to own her own restaurant because, besides being a good storekeeper, she has a gift for cooking. This is her third loan with MFP and she likes working with the communal bank because all of the members get along and are prompt with their payments. With this money she will buy more products to stock her store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise.

loans.name: Uldarico

texts.es: Uldarico tiene 49 años, vive con su pareja, Flor, quien lo apoya en su negocio, con ella tiene 3 hijos que aun están en edad escolar. Él dedica a la venta de pescado de manera ambulatoria, mientras que su esposa lo hace en un puesto del mercado cercano a su casa. Uldarico es muy conocido en su localidad por la confianza que brinda a sus clientes con respecto a sus productos, ya que siempre vende pescado fresco y de buena calidad, esto ha hecho de su actividad un negocio rentable, ya que cada vez que llega a una localidad, lo reconocen fácilmente y acuden a comprar sus productos. Esta demanda ha hecho nacer en Uldarico la idea de poder incrementar sus ventas y enviar sus peces a otras ciudades. Este es su 4to préstamo con MFP, y lo que le gusta de trabajar en su banco comunal es que todos sus compañeros y compañeras de grupo son cumplidos con sus pagos y muy organizados para realizar las actividades señaladas por su asesor de crédito. El dinero que viene solicitando es para comprar más pescado e incrementar sus ventas y ganancias.
texts.en:
Uldarico is 49 years old and lives with his wife, Flor, who helps him with his business. They have 3 school-age children.

Uldarico sells fish as an ambulatory vendor while his wife sells from a stand near their house. He is very well known in the area for the dependability of his products because he always sells fresh, high quality fish. This is a profitable business for him because people recognize him as soon as he arrives at a location and they come to buy his products. The high demand for his products has caused Uldarico to come up with the idea to increase his sales by sending his fish to other cities.

This is his fourth loan with MFP and what he likes about working with the communal bank is that all of his partners are prompt with their payments and very organized in their usage of loans in consultaion with their financial advisor. This money will be used to purchase more fish and increase his sales and earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es: Virginia tiene 44 años, es madre de 3 hijos que están estudiando en otra ciudad, ahora vive acompañada de su esposo, quien trabaja como operador de tractores. Ella es secretaria y trabaja en la municipalidad de su localidad, la cual se ubica cerca a su casa. Sin embargo, también tiene un negocio propio, en sociedad con otra persona, de compra y venta de repuestos para motos y motocarros. Con esta actividad ya lleva un año, y le va muy bien gracias a su buena administración. Virginia está muy satisfecha por las ganancias que viene obteniendo, y como es una mujer que siempre procura estar en actividad y aprovecha cada oportunidad de negocio que se presenta, también quiere implementar una tienda de ropa, por lo que está ahorrando, para que su deseo que haga pronto realidad. Este es su préstamo número 12 créditos con MFP, y en todo este tiempo lo que más aprecia del trabajo en su banco comunal es el compañerismo entre todos los integrantes, además de su compromiso y responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuotas. El dinero que está solicitando en esta ocasión es para incrementar la cantidad de repuestos que ofrece en su negocio.
texts.en:
Virginia is 44 years old, is mother of three children who are studying in a different city, and now lives with her husband who works as a tractor operator. She is a secretary and works for the municipal government of her area, near her house.

She also has her own business, with a business partner, to buy and sell parts for motorcycles and motorcycle taxis. She has worked in this business for one year and it is successful due to her good business management. Virginia is very satisfied with her earnings and, because she is a woman who is always stays busy and takes advantage of every business opportunity that arises, she always wants to open a clothing store. She is saving up so that this dream can soon become a reality.

This is her 12th loan with MFP and during all this time what she most values about her work with the community bank is the feeling of comradeship between all the members, along with their dedication and responsibility for their repayments.

This loan will be used to increase the quantity of replacement parts that she offers in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Mary McKee, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise.

loans.name: Celeste Victoria

texts.pt:
Celeste Victoria N. é natural de Maputo, tem 38 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 3 filhos com idade entre, 19; 17 e 13 anos respectivamente. Apenas sustenta a sua família.

Celeste estudou até 7ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras na Família, a mais de 10 anos que o marido ensinou-a a fazer negocio que consiste na venda de produtos diversos com destaque ao arroz que compra o sacos de 50kg por 850,00mt e vende por 1150,00mt. Deste negocio tem rendimento mensal liquido de 2500,00mt.

Celeste solicita empréstimo pela primeira vez na Hluvuku e no Kiva, com qual pretende aumentar o seu estoque afim de melhor responder a procura nos seus clientes. Futuramente pretende reabilitar a sua casa e conta com o credito.
texts.en:
Celeste Victoria N. is a native of Maputo. She is 38 years old, married, with 3 children of ages 19, 17 and 13. She only supports her family.

Celeste attended school through 7th grade and stopped due to his family's financial circumstances. Over 10 years ago, her husband taught her to do business, selling various products, particularly rice. She buys 50 kg sacks of rice for 850 meticais and sells them for 1150 meticiais. She has a monthly profit from this business of 2500 meticais.

Celeste is requesting a loan for the first time from Hluvuku and Kiva, with which she plans to increase her stock in order to better meet demand from her customers. In the future, she plans to renovate her house with a loan.

Translated from Portuguese by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell various products

loans.name: Yubes

texts.es: Yubes tiene 34 años, vive con su esposo, quien trabaja como constructor de viviendas, tienen 3 hijos. Desde hace 3 años tiene una pequeña tienda que implementó en un espacio dentro de su casa, se inició con muy pocos productos, pero gracias a sus ventas diarias su negocio está creciendo muy rápido. Esta actividad, le ha dado a Yubes, la oportunidad de relacionarse con casi todos sus vecinos, que antes no conocía, y que por su carisma y buena atención, acuden regularmente a su bodega.  Adicionalmente, y como otra fuente de ingresos, Yube vende comida y bebidas por las noches en un espacio que acondiciona a diario fuera de su casa. Su anhelo es lograr que su tienda crezca y se convierta en un minimarket. Este es su tercer préstamo con MFP, y le gusta trabajar con su grupo porque son organizados y coordinados en las actividades de su banco comunal. Con el dinero que solicita implementará su negocio, comprando los productos necesarios para surtir su bodega.
texts.en:
Yubes is 34 years old, lives with her husband who works in residential construction, and has three children. For the last 3 years she has been running a small store that she set up in a space in her house. She started with very few products, but thanks to her daily sales, her business is rapidly growing. This activity has given Yubes the opportunity to interact with almost all her neighbors, whom she did not know before, and her charm and good service makes them return regularly to her store. Also, as another source of income,Yubes sells food and beverages in the evenings in a space that she sets up daily outside her house. Her hopes are that her store grows and evolves into a mini-market. This is her third loan with MFP, and she likes to work with her group because they are organized and involved in the activities of the community bank. The proceeds if this loan will be used to build up her business, buying the necessary products to stock her store

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi N. is a 55-year-old woman. She is married and the mother of seven children who are independent except the last born who is currently pursuing education at the junior high school level. Esi presently lives with her husband and her last child at Mankessim, the town where she also does her trade. She trades in vegetables and spices like onions, tomatoes, pepper, garden eggs, green pepper etc. She sells on top of table in the community market of Mankessim.  Esi treks to a nearby city, Kumasi to buy vegetables and spices and retail. Complaining of small working capital, she believes the loan would enable her to purchase stock in bulk per trip and increase her profit margin eventually. Still responsible for the education of her last born, she hopes that she would be able to improve her savings to support her child to enter senior high school next year. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables and spices in bulk.

loans.name: Pelessi

texts.fr: Pelessi K. est un jeune homme de 35 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est conducteur de taxi moto à Wome depuis 3 ans. Cette activité est sa principale source de revenus.  Sa bonne gestion lui a permis de rembourser rapidement son crédit. Elle désire contracter un nouveau prêt afin d’acquérir une nouvelle moto. il souhaite passer la première à son petit frère. Cette chance leur permettra de changer les conditions de vie de leur famille.
texts.en:
Pelessi K. is a young man, 35 years old, married, and the father of two. He has been a moto taxi driver in Wome for three years. This work is his main source of revenues. Good managing on his part enables him to repay his loan quickly. He would like to take out a new loan in order to acquire a new moto. He wishes to give the first one to his younger brother. This chance will enable them to alter their family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for use as a taxi

loans.name: Afua

texts.en: Afua F. started her trading business two years ago in Mankessim, the town where she lives in the central region of Ghana. Afua prepares and serves very tasty and good quality smoked fish to her customers and because of that many customers buy from her stand. She also sells fresh vegetables like carrots and green peppers at the community market and sometimes she sells the leftovers through street hawking. She is 28 years-old and married with one child, who is currently in school. Until now she has not been able to get extra funds to help grow her business.  Now she is requesting a loan to buy larger quantities of assorted fishes and vegetables so she can increase her sales and profits to better support the education of her child. She would be grateful for the assistance.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of fish and vegetables for her market stand.

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi A. is a 42-year-old local restaurant operator. She is married and has five children who are currently in school. She prepares and sells local foods like banku and other local dishes. Banku is a kind of dough prepared from milled maize grains and it is eaten with hot pepper sauce or soup. She says the prices of raw materials has gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to help meet her production costs. With the loan, she will purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, plantains, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood to prepare her meals. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy raw materials for her local restaurant.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna A. is 52 years old. She is a married woman with five kids. All her children have completed school and are working. She lives with her family at Edina, a suburb of Mankessim, in the central region of Ghana.

For the past thirteen years, Anna has been baking bread and other food pastries to take care of her household in spite of the challenges she faces. She bakes sugar bread, wheat bread, cake, meat pie, etc and retails them to her customers. Her customers book their order in advance and before they come it is ready. She also retails to individuals for their morning breakfast, and she sometimes sells some items through hawking by herself. She says the price of ingredients is increasing, which is making it difficult to buy more raw materials from the market, and the daily demand for bread is high. She says she bakes at most 200 loaves of bread in a day.

Anna needs the loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, margarine, milk and firewood. She says your assistance would be very welcome. Anna belongs to a group called ‘St. Peters’.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast and firewood

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es: Consuelo es una mujer trabajadora que con mucho esfuerzo consiguió construir la casa donde  ahora vive muy feliz junto a su esposo e hijo. Desde hace 2 años se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante, pues visita a todos sus vecinos y amistades con el fin de ofrecerles sus prendas, dándoles facilidades de pago, ya que realiza sus cobros semanalmente. Este negocio se ha convertido en una de las principales actividades económicas dentro de su hogar por lo que trata de mejorar la atención a sus clientes para la recomienden con otras personas. Y para incrementar sus ingresos, está ahorrando para comprar una máquina de coser, y así también trabajar como costurera para las fábricas que tienen interés en su mano de obra. A pesar de estar sólo un año en el grupo conformado en MFP, ha sabido relacionarse adecuadamente con todas sus compañeras, quienes vienen trabajando con mucha responsabilidad. Con los 800 soles que solicita incrementará su mercadería y comprará prendas para la temporada de invierno que se aproxima.
texts.en:
Consuelo is a hard working women and with a lot of hard work she has built her house. She now lives happily in this house with her husband and son. About 2 years ago she started making a living by selling clothing. She visits all her neighbors and friends with the intention of selling them clothes and lets them make weekly payments on the clothes they buy. This business has become one of her family's main ways of making a living. She tries to give her customers the best service possible so that they will recommend her business to other people and she will be able to increase her income. She is saving to buy a sewing machine and that way she can also work as a seamstress for a factory that is interested in her as a worker. Despite the fact that she has only been in the MFP group for one year she has gotten to know the members very well and they are all hard workers like she is. With the $275 (800 Soles) she wants to increase her merchandise and buy clothes for the winter season that is coming soon.

(Translated by Alexis of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase Her Merchandise

loans.name: Genita Luís Domingos

texts.pt:
Genita Luís Domingos S. é natural de Maputo, tem 47 anos de idade, casada e mãe de 7 filhos com idade entre o mais velho tem 27 anos e o mais novo tem 8 anos e estuda na 8ªclasse. Apenas sustenta a sua família.

Genita estudou até 7ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeira da sua família. Genita a 10 anos que vive na base de negocio que consiste na venda de produtos diversos com destaque aos ovos que compra a caixa por 480,00mt e vende por 650,00mt. Tendo assim um rendimento mensal liquido 3500,00mt e poupa 1000,00mt.

Genita solicita empréstimo pela primeira vez na Hluvuku e no Kiva, com qual pretende aumentar o seu estoque. Tem planos futuros que conta com o credito a construção de mais um estabelecimento comercial.
texts.en:
Genita Luís Domingos S. is a native of Maputo. She is 47 years old, married and the mother of 7 children. The oldest is 27 years old and the youngest is 8 and attending 8th grade. She only supports her family.

Genita attended school through 7th grade and stopped due to her family's financial circumstances. For 10 years, Genita has earned her living from her business, selling various products, particularly eggs. She buys them for 480 meticais per box and sells them for 650 meticias. She has a monthly profit of 3500 meticais and saves 1000 meticais.

Genita is requesting a loan for the first time through Hluvuku and Kiva, with which she plans to increase her stock. She has future plans to use aloan to build another commercial establishment.

Translated from Portuguese by N Aviva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell various products

loans.name: Atawa

texts.fr: Atawa K. est une jeune femme de 25 ans, mariée et mère d’une petite fille. Elle est revendeuse de pagnes çà Wome. Atawa se déplaçait de temps en temps dans les marchés environnants pour vendre ses marchandises. Elle désire avec ce deuxième crédit augmenter la taille de son commerce en achetant des pagnes de qualité afin répondre aux exigences de la clientèle. Avec les revenus, elle pourra mieux subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Atawa K. is a young woman, 25 years old, married, and the mother of a girl. She is a retailer of pagnes (colorful West African cloth) in Wome. She used to travel now and then to the surrounding marketplaces to sell her merchandise. She would like to use this second loan to expand her commerce by buying quality pagnes in order to respond to customer demands. With the revenues, she will be able to provide for her family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth for resale

loans.name: Milicent

texts.en: Milicent E. is trader who sells soft drinks in Elmina and she has been selling soft drinks since 1977.  Milicent has received training in college.  She is now a single parent with five dependents and she is responsible for paying school fees and bills.  Milicent will use the loan to buy more soft drinks for selling.  She hopes to save some of the additional profit that will result from the loan and also to purchase some land.

loans.use: To buy buy more soft drinks for selling.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia E. is a 49-year-old married mother of six children, three of whom are currently in school. She lives with her family in the village of St Peter's at Cape Coast in the central region of Ghana.

Sophia has been in business for 22 years and she works as a food vendor selling banku with fried fish. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and is eaten with hot pepper or soup. Sophia has many customers since banku is enjoyed by many Ghanaians for breakfast, lunch and supper. She wants to use her loan to buy more raw materials such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. Her hope is to increase her income in order to support her children’s education.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials – maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood

loans.name: Yanacocha Group

texts.es:
Nuestros socios del banco comunal  “YANACOCHA”, son vecinos D. la zona D. surquillos, situado en el distrito D. Calca en la provincia del Cusco, ubicado a 1:30 minutos D. la ciudad del Cusco.

Los socios se dedican a diferentes actividades, teniendo como principal actividad la agricultura y  ganadería, en las épocas D. siembra, en resto del año ellos alternan sus actividades agrícolas con los diferentes negocios, que son, la crianza D. aves D. corral,  la compra y venta D. semillas, D. verduras, D. frutas, D. tiendas D. abarrotes, negocio D. mecánica y reparación. Los socios solicitan el préstamo para poder incrementar más sus productos y así tener mayor productividad.

Ellos se encuentran sumamente agradecidos con el apoyo otorgado mediante este medio y ratifican su deseo D. trabajo duro para poder cumplir sus metas y también se comprometen al pago total D. su préstamo en el tiempo programado.
texts.en:
Our members of the “Yanacocha” communal bank are neighbors of the Surquillos zone, situated in the district of Calca, in the province of Cusco, located 1 hour and 30 minutes away from the city of Cusco. The members carry out different activities, with agriculture and cattle being their main activities during the planting seasons; during the rest of the year they alternate their agricultural activities with different businesses, which are: raising poultry, purchasing and selling seed, vegetables, and fruit, grocery stores, and mechanic and repair shops. The members are questing a loan to increase their products, which will increase their productivity. They are extremely thankful for the support that they have obtained and reaffirm their wish to work hard to be able to achieve their goals; they also commit to making their loan payments in full in the time granted.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products and expand their businesses and crops.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying eggs wholesale

loans.name: Esi

texts.en: Esi K. is a 43-year-old divorced mother of two kids who are both still in school.  She lives with her family in Mankessim in the central region of Ghana. For the past six years, Esi has been baking bread and pastries to help take care of her household.  She bakes sugar bread and meat pie and sells them to her customers.  Her customers place their orders in advance and she makes sure it is ready when they come to pick it up.  She also sometimes sells her baked goods by street hawking them herself.  Esi says that the price of ingredients is increasing which is making it difficult to buy more raw materials from the market.  Esi needs the loan to buy more bags of flour, sugar, margarine, milk and firewood.  She said your assistance would be much appreciated.  Esi belongs to a group called St. Peters.

loans.use: To buy baking materials like bags of flour, sugar, margarine, yeast, and firewood.

loans.name: Graciosa Ernesto

texts.pt:
Graciosa Ernesto C. é natural de Maputo, tem 44 anos de idade,  solteira e mãe de duas filhas com idade entre 21e 11 anos respectivamente, apenas sustenta as suas filhas.

Graciosa estudou até 7ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras, aos 20 anos se casou maritalmente qual durou 14 anos e em 2000 separou se dai que começou o negocio como forma para ter o seu sustento e auto emprego, neste momento também trabalha numa casa como empregada domestica.

Graciosa para alem do emprego faz um negocio que consiste na venda de produtos diversos, deste negocio tem um rendimento mensal de 20000,00mt e faz poupança. Graciosa solicita empréstimo pela primeira vez na Hluvuku e no Kiva, com qual pretende aumentar o seu estoque. Graciosa sonha ter uma creche.
texts.en:
Graciosa Ernesto C. was born in Maputo. She is 44 years old and the single mother of a 21-year-old and an 11-year-old daughter. She supports only her daughters. Graciosa stopped going to school in the 7th grade because she lacked the finances to continue. She got married when she was 20 years old, and the relationship lasted 14 years. In 2000 she and her husband separated and Graciosa began her own business so she could support herself. She also works as a maid in a home. Graciosa’s business consists of selling a variety of products, which earns her a monthly income of 2,000 MT. She also has a savings account. This is Graciosa’s first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva, and she intends to use the money to increase her stock. Her dream is to have a day care center.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and selling a variety of goods

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana T., 40 years old, is divorced and blessed with two children who are in school. Diana is very hard working trader who provides food for her children. She enjoys selling cosmetics and said that this has been her major source of livelihood for the past five years. She says selling cosmetics is lucrative and her experience in the market has enabled her to gain many loyal customers. Her shop is located at a strategic place in the market. Diana believes that with the loan, she would be able to purchase more stock of jewelries and cosmetics like pomade, hair cream, lipsticks, etc. to increase her inventory and income. Diana realized a need to add other things that are frequently demanded by her customers, which are vegetables like onions, tubers of yam, and frozen meat, etc. Diana belongs to a group called ‘St. Peters’.

loans.use: Diana wants the loan to buy more stock of cosmetic products, tubers of yam, and meats.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.es: Elizabeth lucha sola por el bienestar de sus tres hijos, quienes son su mayor orgullo, pues son muy responsables y dedicados en sus estudios; por ello, trata de darles las comodidades posibles para que sigan desarrollándose como hombres de éxito. Desde que se separó de su pareja fue asumiendo nuevos retos como madre y como comerciante, pues se esfuerza por el crecimiento de su negocio, el cual inició hace 8 años junto a su pareja, pero hoy trata de atender a sus clientes con la ayuda de sus hijos. Elizabeth vende cerveza para diversos eventos sociales, grandes y pequeños. Pero más adelante, desea abrir una tienda de bebidas en su casa para dejar de trasladarse de un lugar a otro y dejar de pagar los altos costo de alquiler del local donde almacena su producto, pero mientras junta el capital necesario seguirá trabajando igual, hasta que sus hijos cumplan sus metas como estudiantes y puedan ser un apoyo para ella dentro de su hogar. Desde hace 5 años pertenece a su banco comunal, este es su treceavo crédito con MFP, lo que le gusta de su grupo es la interrelación personal que hay entre sus compañeras, además del trabajo que realizan con el fin de tener mayores ingresos y progresar. Los 3500 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de más cerveza para cubrir sus pedidos este mes, pues hay muchos eventos festivos en su localidad.
texts.en:
Elizabeth struggles alone for the well being of her three children, who are her greatest pride since they are very responsible and dedicated to their studies; therefore, she tries to give them all the comforts possible so that they continue to develop into successful men. Since she separated from her spouse she has been assuming new responsibilities as a mother and a business woman, as she tries to grow her business that she started 8 years ago with her husband, and now is is trying to service her customers with the help of her sons Elizabeth sells beer at various social events, large and small. In the future she plans to open a beverage store in her home so that she can stop having to move from one place to another and stop paying the high rent for the storage of her products. In the meantime, until she has the finances necessary, she will continue as she is doing now until her sons reach their educational goals and can be of support for her in her home. She has belonged to her community bank for the last 5 years, this is her thirteenth loan with MFP. She likes the personal interaction with her partners in the group, in addition to the work they accomplish toward the goals of improving their incomes and getting ahead. The 3500 soles that she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of beer to cover her orders for the month, there are a lot of festive events in her area.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Justice

texts.en: Justice C. is a trader who deals in electrical parts at Elmina. Justice has received a senior high school education. He is single and has no children. Justice has been selling electrical parts since 2006. He is responsible for paying light and water bills. His loan will be used to purchase electrical wires and other goods to sell. He hopes to use the new profits to expand the business.

loans.use: His loan will be used to purchase electrical wires and other goods.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi M. est conducteur de taxi moto à Wome. Il exerce ce métier depuis 3 ans et il a pu subvenir aux besoins de sa famille avec les revenus issus de son activité. Agé de 30 ans, Komi est marié et père d’un enfant. Il espère avec ce crédit payer une deuxième moto à une tierce personne qui est tenue de lui verser des redevances mensuelles. Ceci augmentera ses revenus et lui permettra de rembourser l’emprunt et épargner une partie pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Komi M. is a moto taxi driver in Wome. He has been in this business for three years, and he was able to provide for his family with the revenues from it. He is 30 years old, married, and a father with a child. He hopes to use this loan to buy a second moto for a third party, who is obligated to pay monthly fees. This will augment his revenues and enable him to repay the loan and to save some of it, so as to provide for his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motor bike to rent out

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en:
Georgina N. was born 39 years ago. She is married and mother of two kids. Currently her kids are in school. Georgina runs a cold store and has sold frozen foods like chicken, mutton, fish, meat, sausages, etc. in the local market of Mankessim for seven years now. Georgina also sells wooden boards for chopping of vegetables.
 
Working for the past seven years, her small working capital has mostly limited her business progress. With the loan, she wants to purchase an additional deep freezer and cartons of frozen foods like fish, chicken and meat to enable her improve her sales. She is expecting to increase her profit margin and save toward business expansion and also provide support for kids education. She would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase  frozen foods like fish, chicken and mutton.

loans.name: Kodzo

texts.fr: Kodzo M. est conducteur de taxi résidant à Wome. Agé de 48 ans, il est marié et père de 4 enfants. Il opère dans ce domaine depuis 7 ans. Les pannes régulières de son engin lui causent des dépenses périodiques. Pour palier à ce phénomène, Kodzo souhaite avec ce crédit changer son moteur. Ceci lui permettra d’épargner plus et de mieux répondre aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Kodzo M. is a moto taxi driver residing in Wome. He is 48 years old, married, and the father of four. He has been operating in this field for seven years. Regular engine breakdowns are a periodic cost for him. To mitigate this phenomenon, he would like to use this loan to change out his motor. This will enable him to save more money and to respond better to the needs of his family.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To renew the motor of his car

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama N. is a fifty-three year old woman. She is married and has eight children. Three of her children are currently in school. She lives with her family at Cape Coast in the central region of Ghana. She is a food vendor and sells banku with fried fish. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. She has many customers as this dish is enjoyed by many Ghanaian as breakfast, lunch as well as supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. She hopes to increase her income to support her children’s education. She has been in business for 20 years now. She belongs to the village called ‘St. Peter’s’.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials such as bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella S. is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through Senior High School. Stella sells provisions at Elmina, which she has done since 2000. Her husband is a video operator. Stella uses her income to pay for the light bill and school fees. Stella will use the loan to purchase more provisions for sale to expand the business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Stella plans to improve the business.

loans.use: Stella will use the loan to purchase more provisions for sale to expand the business.

loans.name: Akouwa

texts.fr: Akouwa M. est une femme de 55 ans mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est tient le commerce de divers articles exposés sur une étagère. Ce commerce est la source de ses revenus. Akouwa souhaite avec ce fonds acheter des marchandises qui lui permettront de d’augmenter ses recettes et par conséquent améliorer se conditions de vie.
texts.en:
Akouwa M. is a 55-year-old woman, married, and the mother of five. She is the owner of a business selling various goods displayed on a rack. This business is her source of revenues. She would like to use this loan to buy merchandise that will enable her to increase her receipts and consequently to improve her living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for resale

loans.name: Georgina

texts.en: Georgina A. started her local restaurant nine years ago at Mankessim, where she lives. Since then, she has become one of the popular food vendors in her neighborhood. She is now 38 years old and married with six children. Four of her children are currently attending schooling. She serves many kinds of local dishes like fufu, rice balls, banku, and ampesi among others. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, taken with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup. Ampesi is a boiled plantain or yam and it is taken with any stew. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood. Georgina hopes to use part of her proceeds to finance her children’s education. She belongs to the village called ‘St. Peter’s’.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Married with two kids who are currently in school, Elizabeth O. is 42 years old. She lives at Mankessim in the central region of Ghana. She sells food supplies like bags of maize, soft drinks in the local market of Mankessim where she lives. Elizabeth O. is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to provide her kids with quality education for their future career. But she claims without adequate funds it can’t be possible to realize that dream. She is also into the sale of clothing materials and has been in business for two years now.

Elizabeth is humbly requesting for your help (loan) to make her dream come true so that she would be more able to take care of the children. With the loan, she wants to purchase increased stock of maize directly from the farmers to satisfy her customers’ needs. Elizabeth belongs to a village bank called ‘Power and might’.

loans.use: To purchase bulk stock of maize, clothing materials and soft drinks.

loans.name: Hermenegilda Noa

texts.pt:
Hermenegilda Noa U. natural de Maputo, tem 47 anos de idade, casada maritalmente e mãe de 4 filhos com idade entre 25, 24, 19 e 15 anos respectivamente, alem dos filhos sustenta dois enteados que mora com eles.

Hermenegilda estudou até 8ªclasse e parou quando perdeu o seu pai e sendo  a mais velha viu se obrigada a procurar emprego afim de sustentar os seus irmãos. 1984 inicia actividade comercial que consistiu em venda de vários produtos, actualmente o negocio consiste na venda de roupas, mariscos e verduras.

Hermenegilda solicita empréstimo na Hluvuku pela primeira vez com qual pretende aumentar o seu estoque, deste negocio tem um rendimento mensal de 16000,00mt e faz poupança.  Futuramente pretende solicitar outro empréstimo para melhoramento das condições habitacionais.

Hermenegilda aparece na foto com o seu marido
texts.en:
Hermenegilda Noa U. was born in Maputo. She is 47 years old, married, and has 4 children aged 25, 24, 19, and 15. Besides supporting her children, Hermenegilda supports two step-children who live with them. Hermenegilda had to stop going to school in the 8th grade when she lost her father. As the oldest child she had to look for work to support her siblings. In 1984 she began selling a variety of products, and today she sells clothing, seafood, and vegetables. This is Hermenegilda’s first loan with Hluvuku, and she intends to use the money to increase her stock. She currently has a monthly income of 16,000 MT and has a savings account. She hopes to get another loan in the future to improve her housing situation. This photo is of Hermenegilda and her husband.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell clothing

loans.name: Dotse

texts.fr: Dotse T. est âgé de 29 ans, marié et père d’un petit garçon. Il gère une boutique d’alimentation générale à Wome depuis 3 ans. Son commerce est très prospère et il espère avec ce crédit, réapprovisionner on magasin afin de répondre aux attentes de la clientèle. Il espère améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Dotse T., age 29, is married and the father of a young boy. He has been managing a grocery store in Wome for three years. His commerce is very prosperous, and he hopes to use this loan to resupply his store in order to respond to customer expectations. He hopes to improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply his shop

loans.name: Kafui

texts.fr: Kafui T. est une femme de 48 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. elle est productrice de l’huile rouge à Wome, un village situé à environ 130 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. son activité consiste à acheter des noix de palme au près des agriculteurs et de venir les transformer en l’huile de palme (huile rouge). Kafui exerce cette activité depuis sa jeunesse. Elle compte avec ce crédit accroître la taille de son entreprise. Les sacs qui sont dans la vue contiennent des noix de palme.
texts.en:
Kafui T. is a 48-year-old woman, married, and the mother of five. She is a producer of red oil in Wome, a village located about 130 km from Lomé, the capital of Togo. Her work involves buying palm nuts from farmers and processing them into palm oil (red oil). She has been in this business since her youth. She intends to use this loan to expand her enterprise. The sacks appearing in the photo contain palm nuts.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy palm nuts for producing palm oil

loans.name: Akpenamawu

texts.fr: Akpenamawu T. est responsable d’une boutique de prêt-à-porter à Wome. Agé de 37 ans, il est mariée et père d’un enfant. Akpenamawu est un bon gestionnaire d’entreprise car il a considérablement augmenté ses recettes en ces derniers temps. Il est bien organisé et très rigoureux. Il espère avec ce crédit accroître la taille de son entreprise afin  répondre aux exigences de la clientèle. Il augmentera par la même occasion ses revenus qui lui permettront de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Akpenamawu T. is the owner of a clothing store in Wome. He is 37 years old, married and the father of a child. Akpenamawu is a good business manager, he has considerably increased his business revenue recently. He is well organized and very thorough. He hopes to use this credit to increase the size of his business to meet customer demand. He plans to use the increased revenue from his growing business to support his family.

Translated from French by Ryan Jones, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To Grow his clothing business

loans.name: Lucas Manuel

texts.pt:
Lucas Manuel C. é natural de Maputo província, tem 44 anos de idade, casado maritalmente e pai de 4 filhos com idades entre 22, 20, 18, 16 anos respectivamente. Alem dos filhos, sustenta a sua sogra que mora com ela.

Lucas estudou até 5ªclasse e parou por causa da sua idade,  em 1983 foi formada em corte e custura e em 1986 começa a trabalhar numa empresa de confecções de roupas onde apenas trablhou dois anos, depois procurou emprego noutras empresas e trabalhou em varias, em 1990 decide abrir uma alfaiataria iniciando seu próprio negocio qual desempenha até data hoje, com qual tem um rendimento mensal de 10000,00mt.

Lucas solicita empréstimo na Hluvuku pela primeira vez com qual pretende comprar tecido de forma a responder melhor a sua clientela. Futuramente sonha com a construção do muro de vedação da sua casa e compra de uma viatura para o ajudar nas deslocações durante a prestação do serviço.
texts.en:
Lucas Manuel C. was born in Maputo. He is 44 years, married, and has 4 children aged 22, 20, 18, and 16. Besides supporting his children, he also supports his mother in-law, who lives with them. Lucas had to stop going to school in the 5th grade because of his age. In 1983 he finished his training in clothes making and in 1986 he got his first job in a clothes-making business, where he worked for 2 years. After that he worked in several businesses until 1990, when he opened his own business as a tailor. He has this business until today, and earns a monthly income of 10,000 MT. This is the first time Lucas is requesting a loan with Hluvuku. With the money he intends to buy material to better service his clientele. His dream for the future is to build a protective wall around his house and to buy a car that would help him serve his clients.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying and selling clothing material

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gladys tiene 46 años, es una mujer muy jovial y entusiasta, pues siempre busca animar a sus seres queridos a seguir adelante para lograr sus metas; junto a su esposo dan ejemplo de constancia, pues lograron adquirir una casa con la que pueden brindar a sus hijos un lugar donde habitar seguros. Casarse no la limitó a seguir trabajado en la actividad que le da tantas satisfacciones desde muy joven, estudió cosmetología y se desarrolló profesionalmente con este oficio desde hace 10 años,  tiene instalado un local en el mercado de su localidad, donde atiende todos los días desde las 10 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, y gracias a la cercanía  que tiene de su domicilio puede cumplir con sus roles como madre y esposa, tratando siempre de distribuir adecuadamente su tiempo para no descuidar ningunas de sus actividades. Pero hay épocas donde su labor es muy demandada y requiere de apoyo tiempo para terminar de atender a su clientela, por esa razón empezó a ambientar un espacio en su casa para su salón, lo que está pronto a concluir y donde se trasladará con la finalidad de contar con el apoyo necesario de su familia, además de dejar de realizar el pago del alquiler del local. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, y espera seguir trabajando con la misma responsabilidad como hasta hora junto a su grupo. Con los 1000 soles que solicita invertirá en la compra maquinarias necesarias para su salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Gladys is a jovial and enthusiastic 46-year-old woman. She always tries to lift the spirits of those who are dear to her and help them get ahead and reach their goals. Gladys and her husband are examples of perseverance. They have been able to get a house so they can give their children a secure place to live. Getting married has not stopped Gladys from working in the field that has given her much satisfaction since she was a young woman. She studied cosmetology and has developed professionally in this field for ten years. She has a place in the local market where she works every day from ten in the morning until ten at night. Luckily it’s close to her home so she can fulfill her roles as mother and wife. She always tries to distribute her time adequately so as not to neglect any of her activities. But there are times when her job is very busy and she needs time to finish serving her clients. This is why she began to fix a space, which is near completion, in her house for a salon. She will move into her new home salon with the goal of having her family’s support, as well as not having to pay rent for the space in the market. This is her tenth loan with MFP and she hopes to continue working with the same responsibility that she has so far with her group. She will invest the 1000 soles in the purchase of machinery necessary for her beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de maquinarias para su salón

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María es una excelente esposa y madre, pues trata de siempre apoyar a sus seres queridos con quienes vive en su hogar, vivienda que con mucho esfuerzo logró obtener junto a su pareja. Sus ganas de progresar la llevaron a dedicarse a múltiples actividades, con las que pagaba los gastos de educación de sus hijos, quienes ya son profesionales, lo cual la llena de satisfacción. Pero sus deseos de crecer permanecen en ella, y con algo de dinero ahorrado logró comprar un carrito para de comida con el cual sale todas las noches a la puerta de su casa para ofrecer diversos aperitivos a los transeúntes, ya que tiene el beneficio de estar situada en un lugar de gran afluencia de personas. A pesar de atender sólo por las noches, no deja de ser fatigada su labor, pues durante el día tiene que realizar los diversos platillos y ensaladas que sus clientes están acostumbrados a consumir. Pero todo este esfuerzo tiene un fin, que es instalar un restaurante en su domicilio, donde pueda brindar todas las atenciones necesarias a sus clientes, quienes cada día la motivan a agilizar sus planes para que puedan visitarla con más frecuencia. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y en los años de permanencias ha podido aprender a relacionarse con sus compañeras de grupo y dar soluciones en algunas circunstancias complicadas que se han presentado. Con los 1000 soles que solicita invertirá en la compra de utensilios de cocina y víveres para incrementar la preparación de los alimentos que ofrece.
texts.en:
María is an excellent wife and mother who always tries to support her loved ones. She lives with them in the house that she and her husband worked very hard together to obtain. Her desire to progress led her to multiple activities. These activities paid for her children’s education. The children are now professionals, and this fills her with satisfaction. But, her desire to grow remains. With some saved money she was able to buy a food cart, which she takes to the front of her house every night. She sells different snacks to the passers-by. She has the benefit of being located in a place where there are a lot of people. In spite of tending her cart just in the evenings, she is still tired from her work. During the day she makes different dishes and salads that her customers are used to eating. All of this work has an end, which is to have a restaurant in her home. There she could offer all of the necessary attention to her customers. Every day they motivate her to speed up her plans so that they can visit her more frequently. This is her third loan with MFP. In her years with them she has been able to learn how to relate with her colleagues in the group and how to find solutions to complex situations that have arisen. With the 1,000 PEN she will buy kitchen utensils and provisions to increase the amount of food that she offers.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy kitchen utensils and provisions

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El Señor Mario T. de 28 años de edad,  casado de oficios Tejedor, “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 1 Telar,  habita conjuntamente con su esposa y 2 hijos,  desde su niñez se dedicaba en la Artesanía gracias a los préstamos  a podido llevar a su familia adelante donde es persona muy conocida, y su residencia en el Barrio Chuicho, Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan Sololá, Guatemala. Donde ha llegado a Solicitar a la Asociación Asdir un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima para dicha artesanía para facilitar y poder cubrir la demanda a su clientela y así poder darles mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Mario T., 28, is married. He is a weaver, and he makes traditional clothing for women. He has a shop with one loom. He lives with his wife and two children. He has worked in handicrafts since his childhood. Thanks to loans he has been able to help his family succeed. He is well known in his Chuicho neighborhood, Santa Catarina Ixtahuacan Sololá, Guatemala. He is asking the Asdir Association for a loan to buy raw materials for his handicrafts. This will help him be able to cover his customers’ demands. He will then be able to provide his family with better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrafts (Buy raw material)

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María es casada y madre de cuatro hijos, quienes aun son muy pequeños y requieren de muchas atenciones y cuidados. Desde hace 7 años se hace cargo de la zapatería de su esposo, quien por motivos de trabajo tuvo que dejar. Pero María está realizando un excelente trabajo junto a sus hijas, quienes la apoyan a realizar todos los pedidos que recepcionan en su casa,  ya que su taller funciona en su hogar, facilitando el trabajo. Lo difícil de esta actividad es que demanda mucho tiempo, pero aun así no deja de atender su hogar. Para más adelante, María desea contar con más maquinarias y confeccionar zapatos en mayores cantidades para llevarlos a los mercados del centro de su ciudad o a las provincias donde hay mayor demanda. Ella es una de las fundadoras de su grupo, se encuentra en el treceavo crédito con MFP, y luego de casi 7 años ha mantenido un buen ánimo para trabajar junto a sus compañeras de grupo que han llegado ser como parte de su familia, por las múltiples actividades que realizan dentro del banco comunal. Los 2500 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de materiales para confeccionar zapatos, ya  que tiene pedidos por entregar a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María is married and is the mother of four children, who are still very small and need much attention and care. For the past 7 years she has been in charge of her husband’s shoe shop; her husband had to leave the shop in her care for work-related reasons. María is doing an excellent job together with her daughters, who help her fill all of the orders they receive; she operates a workshop in her home, which makes her work easier. What is most difficult about her work is that it demands much time, but fortunately she doesn’t have to leave to attend to her home. In the future María would like to have more machines and make shoes in larger quantities so she can take them to the markets in the central part of the city or to the provinces, where there is much demand. She is one of the founders of her communal bank; this is her thirteenth loan with Kiva partner MFP, and after almost 7 years she remains enthusiastic about working with the other members of her bank. María’s group has become like part of her family due to the numerous activities that they participate in together within their communal bank. The 2500 soles that María is asking for will be invested in the purchase of materials for making shoes, since she has orders that she needs to deliver to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing materials for her shoe shop

loans.name: Mafalda Maria De Fátima Arminda Gloria

texts.pt:
Mafalda Maria de Fátima Arminda Gloria C. é natural de Maputo, tem 49 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 5 filhos onde o mais velho tem 29 e ultimo tem 17 anos de idade respectivamente. Alem dos filhos sustentam uma neta que mora com ela.

Mafalda estudou até 8ªclasse e parou por falta de condições, até aos 17 anos se casou, casamento que apenas durou 5 anos, e mais tarde veio juntar se com outro homem e este também abandonou e lhe deixo com filhos indo para terra do rand e nunca voltou isto em 1997 dai que se viu obrigada a procurar alternativa para sustentar os filhos onde optou pelo negocio, de então até hoje já praticou vários tipos de negocio actualmente com a de venda de roupa, negocio que lhe dá um rendimento mensal de 5000,00mt.

Mafalda solicita empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva pela primeira vez e pretende aumentar o seu volume de negocio. Futuramente pretende comprar um carro e conta com ajuda de crédito.
texts.en:
Mafalda Maria de Fátima Arminda Gloria C. was born in Maputo. She is 49 years old and the single mother of 5 children between the ages of 29 and 17. Besides her children, she also supports a granddaughter who lives with her. Mafalda had to stop going to school when she was in 8th grade because of her financial situation. She got married when she was 17, and the relationship lasted 5 years. Later on she began living with another man, but he also abandoned her by going off to South Africa in 1997 and never returning. She was forced to find a way to support her children, so she chose business. Since then, Mafalda has had many businesses. She is currently selling clothes and earns a monthly income of 5,000 MT. This is Mafalda’s first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva, and she intends to use the money to increase her stock. In the future she would like to buy a car with more credit.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell clothing

borrowers.first_name: Mafalda Maria De Fátima Arminda Gloria

loans.name: Arona  Manlafy
