texts.fr: Arona M D. est un jeune tailleur koldois de profession couturier. Il gére son atelier ouvert chez lui dans la maison parentale. Bien que célibataire de son état, il est cependant le principal soutien de sa famille grace à son activité. Il a quatre apprentis qui le secondent dans son travail. Avec les revenus qu'ils tirent de son travail il assure les charges de nourriture de sa famille composée de ses deux parents et de ses fréres et soeurs. Ainsi il souhaiterait disposer de fonds pour accroitre ses capacités financiéres et mieux participer à la vie de sa famille tout en ayant la possibilité d'épargner.
texts.en:
Arona M D. is a young Koldois tailor who specializes in dressmaking. He runs his workshop out of his parents home. Despite being a single man, he is the main breadwinner in his family thanks to his business. He has four apprentices who assist in his work. With the income that he earns from his work he provides food for his family which includes both his parents and his brothers and sisters. This loan will provide funding to increase his financial capacity and improve his ability to contribute to his family while also being able to save.

Translated from French by Ryan Jones, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Fabrics and Supplies for resale in his business

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha vive junto a su esposo, y ambos, tratan de brindarle a su hijo lo necesario para su crecimiento y desarrollo. Desde hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de ropa, actividad en la que se ocupa todas las tardes, después de atender a su pequeño hijo sale a las calles a ofrecer sus prendas a sus amistades y vecinos, las cuales cobra semanalmente. Esta actividad la ha ayudado a relacionarse mejor con las personas y le ha brindado la oportunidad de ser una gran comerciante y otra fuente de ingresos económicos para hogar. Martha tiene proyectado salir de su localidad y de su ciudad para vender su mercadería en otras provincias, ya que allí puede subir el precio de sus prendas, para cubrir sus gastos de transporte y obtener mayores ganancias, ya que comprará la ropa en el centro de su ciudad, donde los precios al por mayor son bastante cómodos. Martha es una de las fundadoras de su banco comunal, este es su treceavo crédito con MFP, lo que la motiva a seguir trabajando junto a sus compañeras, quienes también se esfuerzan por  hacer de su grupo uno de los más productivos de la institución. Los 3500 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de mercadería acorde a los días festivos que se aproximan, como el día del padre, donde hay mayor demanda.
texts.en:
Martha lives with her spouse, both of whom try to give their child everything necessary for his growth and development. For the past 6 years, Martha has worked selling clothes, which she does every afternoon, after attending to her small son. Afterwards, she visits friends and neighbors to offer her garments, and she charges them weekly. This activity has helped Martha better relate to people, and has given her the opportunity to be a good businessperson and brings in another source of income for her home. Martha has thought about leaving her city and visiting other provinces to sell her garments, as she can charge more in these provinces in order to cover her transport costs. She can also increase her revenue buy selling her clothes in the center of the city, where the prices are higher. Martha is one of the founders of her communal bank, and this is her 13th credit with MFP, which motives her to continue working with her companions, who also work hard to make sure that their group is one of the bank's most productive. The 3500 Soles that she is requesting will be invested in raw materials for the coming festival days, such as Father's Day, when demand is high.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: La Fortaleza, Group 3

texts.en:
These entrepreneurs live in La Javilla. Bethania H. is the coordinator. Bethania sells clothes and non-prescription medicines like acetaminophen and some antibiotics. Right now she is focusing on her pharmaceutical sales and will have the clothing sales as a siD. business. This is the second loan they received through Esperanza International, and the first to be submitted for funding through Kiva. 
The rainy season has just started in the Dominican Republic, and with that, the cases of colds, strep throat and the flu. Bethania will use her loan to purchase medicines that are in high demand, like children’s acetaminophen and penicillin. She usually sells them at a better price than larger pharmacies, and sometimes the government facilities don't have the medications available. So she has become an option for people who can't pay much for medication and can't move far to get them. She wants this business to grow up to be a pharmacy and she would like to become a certified pharmacist. 

Please help us to continue supporting this Kiva loan. 
Thank you!

loans.use: To purchase children's and adult's cold medicine

loans.name: Monica

texts.es: Mónica tiene 40 años, vive junto a su esposo y sus dos hijos, quienes son su mejor apoyo en tiempos difíciles, ya que como familia lograron sobre llevar algunas crisis, pero también compartieron grandes logros como la construcción de su casa. Desde joven estuvo involucrada en el comercio, pues le gusta invertir su tiempo de forma productiva, y ahora viene dedicándose a la venta de ropa de segundo uso y de cosméticos, pero su actividad más importante es la administración de su motocarro, el cual acaba de adquirir con el apoyo de su hijo, quien la motivó a invertir en este vehículo que les serviría, a ambos, para trabajar y juntar el dinero suficiente para adquirir un puesto en el mercado, donde Mónica pueda vender variedad de prendas, ya que es la actividad que más le agrada realizar. Mientras tanto, se dedica a conservar su movilidad en buen estado, realizando los mantenimientos necesarios para que no tenga problemas mecánicos que perjudiquen su economía. Este es su treceavo crédito con MFP, y su permanencia en la institución le da la confianza para seguir trabajando con personas tan responsables y comprometidas por su desarrollo como son sus compañeras de su banco comunal. Los 3000 soles que solicita le darán la oportunidad de adquirir algunos repuestos y aceites para motor que requiere su motocarro.
texts.en:
Mónica is 40 years old, and lives with her husband and their 2 kids, who are her best support during difficult times. The family has already overcome a few crises, but they have also shared big accomplishments, such as the construction of their house. Since she was young, Mónica has been involved in commerce, as she likes to invest her time in productive things. Currently, she sells second-hand clothes and cosmetics, but her most important job is administering her motortaxi, which she just acquired with the support of her son, who motivated her invest in the taxi. The taxi will generate enough money to get a post at the city market, where Mónica can sell her clothes, as this is now her favorite activity. Meanwhile, she keeps her taxi in good shape, and undertakes the necessary maintenance in order to avoid mechanical problems. This is her 13th loan with MFP, and her long-standing relationship with the institution gives her the confidence necessary to continue working with the people responsible for her development, such as her companions at her communal bank. The 1300 Soles that Mónica is asking for will give her the opportunity to acquire parts and oil for her motortaxi.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase parts for her motortaxi.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly es una mujer de 39 años, quien siempre se ha preocupado por el bienestar de sus seres queridos, sobre todo de su esposo y sus tres hijos, con quienes vive en la casa que con tanto esfuerzo les costó adquirir. Desde muy joven tuvo planes de tener un bazar donde pueda instalar también una pequeña botica al servicio de aquellos quienes por falta de dinero no pueden acceder a los hospitales, y ella con su carrera de técnica farmacéutica siente la responsabilidad de contribuir con su localidad. Entonces hace 6 años abrió las puertas de su negocio, el cual está a la disposición de todos sus clientes desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche, y como está instalado dentro de su casa, le da la posibilidad de atenderlo sin descuidar a su familia, pues de otra manera no tendría la dicha de disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos, quienes también le ayudan en la atención del negocio cuando ella tiende que salir. A pesar de que su tienda marcha bien, Nelly no deja de proyectarse al futuro, y este año tiene como meta ampliar su negocio con la instalación de una mini librería. Hace 5 años que conoció de MFP, y ya está en su décimo crédito, además el grupo que conforma es uno de los más organizados y responsables de la institución. Estos 2000 soles que solicita son una gran ayuda para Nelly, quien tiene planeado abastecer su negocio con mercadería novedosa y la que más demandas sus clientes.
texts.en:
Nelly is 39 years old, and has always been concerned for the well-being of her loved ones, especially her husband and their 3 kids. Her kids live with her in the home that was very difficult for her to acquire. Since she was young, Nelly had a plan to have a bazaar, where she could set up a small shop to help those without money who cannot visit hospitals. Nelly has a background in pharmacy, and therefore feels responsible to contribute to her town. And so, she opened her business 6 years ago, which is available to all clients from 6 a.m. until 10 p.m., and, seeing as the business is located inside her house, she can serve her clients without neglecting her children. If this were not the arrangement, Nelly would not be able to enjoy the company of her children, who also help her attend to clients when she needs to leave the house. Even though the business is going well, Nelly stills thinks about the future, and she has a goal to increase her business this year by adding a small library. Nelly found out about MFP 5 years ago, and this is already her 10th loan. The 2000 Soles she requests will be a great help to Nelly, who plans to re-stock her business with new goods, and with the most popular goods.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase inventory.

loans.name: Josefa Maricela

texts.es: La señorita Josefa tiene 22 años de edad, Soltera de oficios Costurera, “Confección de Pants” cuenta con un taller de 3 maquinas, habita junto a sus padres ellos  se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 6 años de elaborar pants en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Xepatriz del Cantón Nimapa , del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, y tener mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Miss Josefa is 22 years old and single. She is a seamstress and has a shop, "Confeccion de Pants", that has three sewing machines. She lives together with her parents, who are also in the same business. They have two employees. She has been making sweat suits for the last 6 years, in her home located at the Xepatriz del Canton Nimapa stop of the Totonicapan department in Guatemala. Currently the demand from her customers has grown, but her financial conditions are not enough for her to increase her capital. This is her reason for coming to ASDIR Association to request a loan, which will be used to purchase raw materials and result in increased sales and better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials

loans.name: Neli Jose António

texts.pt:
Neli Jose António N. é natural da província de Inhambane uma das província do sul de Moçambique mais ao norte, tem 46 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 4 filhos com idade entre 27, 23, 22 e 18 anos respectivamente.

Neli estudou até 5ºclasse e parou quando foi ao lar,  aos 5 anos mudou se da província de inhambane para cidade de Maputo na companhia dos pais, a mais de 10 anos que é gestora do negocio próprio que consiste na compra e venda de ovos, frangos e óleo alimentar, deste negocio tem um rendimento mensal de 10000,00mt. E faz poupanças
 
Neli solicita empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva pela primeira vez com qual pretende aumentar o seu estoque, futuramente Neli pretende solicitar um financiamento para construção de muro de vedação da sua casa.
texts.en:
Neli Jose António N. was born in Nhambane, a province in the south of Mozambique. She is 46 years old, a widow, and the mother of 4 children aged 27, 23, 22, and 18. When Neli was 5 years old, she and her family moved to Maputo. She had to stop going to school when she was in the 5th grade to become a homemaker. She has run her own business buying and selling eggs, chickens, and cooking oil for the last 10 years. Her monthly income is 10,000 MT, and she has a savings account. This is Neli’s first loan with Hluvuku and Kiva and she intends to use the money to increase her stock. In the future Neli would like a loan to build a protective wall around her house.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell eggs, cooking oil, and chickens

loans.name: Ricarda Benita

texts.es: Doña Ricarda H. cuenta con 28 años de edad, es casada de oficios Costurera, “Confección de Pants” cuenta con un taller de 3 maquinas, habita junto a su esposo y con  sus 2 hijos, ella y sus hijos se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 8 años de elaborar pants en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Xepatriz del Cantón Nimapa , del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Ricarda H. is 28 years old, married, and a seamstress. "Confección de Pants" has a workshop with 3 sewing machines. She lives with her husband and their 2 children. She and her children, together with two employees, run the workshop, for 8 years they have been making pants at their home located in Paraje Xepatriz del Cantón Nimapa, of the department of Tononicapán, Guatemala. Presently orders have increased but her economic conditions do not allow her to increase her capital and therefore she has requested a loan from Asociación ASDIR, to enable her to buy material and thus increase her sales hoping to help her children get ahead so they have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material

loans.name: La Fortaleza - Group 6

texts.en:
The members of this group of five entrepreneurs are requesting their second loan from Esperanza International. They live in an area of Santo Domingo named Los Coordinadores, which, despite being within the limits of Santo Domingo, is far less developed. Most of the residents live in inadequate houses and are at the mercy of the Ozama River as the rainy season, which has just started, constantly threatens floods and mudslides.

Aracelis V., the group coordinator, sells fruits and vegetables purchased in the market and products such as rice and beans which she buys at a warehouse. She will use her loan to restock her inventory and hopes to one day own a supply warehouse similar to the one from which she buys the products she sells. Aracelis also hopes this new loan will help her establish her business in her area. Her short term goal is to set up a colmado (a small convenience store).

Thank you for supporting these entrepreneurs!

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory.

loans.name: Amélida Graciela

texts.es: Doña Amélida Graciela cuenta con 35 años de edad, es casada de oficios Tejedora, “Elaboración de cortes Típicas” cuenta con un taller de  Telares, habita junto  con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, ella y sus hijos se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 10 años de elaborar Cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Xeatzam del Cantón Nimapa , del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y que tengan mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Amélida Graciela is 35 years old, married, and has a weaving workshop. She lives with her husband and their 2 children. She and her children work in the same shop (which is run from her residence), and have two employees. She has been doing this in for the past 10 years in the Paraje Xeatzam del Cantón Nimapa area of the Totonicapán department in Guatemala. Currently, the demand of her clientele has grown, but the economic conditions are not sufficient enough for her to increase her capital, which was why she went to the Association ASDIR to apply for a loan. Doña Amélida intends to buy raw material with her loan and thus increase her sales, and also hopes to help her children move ahead and have better living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Rita

texts.es: Rita tiene 39 años, y junto a su esposo luchan por mejorar la calidad de vida dentro de su hogar. Conseguir una casa propia ha sido uno de los mayores logros que han tenido, pues sus tres hijos tienen un lugar donde establecerse con mayor comodidad. Para incrementar los ingresos económicos en su casa, se involucró en la venta de materiales de construcción, negocio que viene funcionando desde hace 6 años, pero el cual ha empezado a administrador Rita hace tres años. Y para mejorar cada día trata de brindar una atención a tiempo completo, ya que el local está ubicado en su misma casa, así que tiene la posibilidad de atenderlo sin descuidar el cuidado de sus hijos. Pero en estos últimos meses, los precios de los materiales han aumentado, lo que perjudica el abastecimiento de su negocio, sin embargo, Rita  trata de comprar en pocas cantidades para que no corra el riesgo de perder sus inversiones frente a la competencia. Este es su treceavo crédito con MFP, y siente que los 7 años trabajando junto a sus compañeras han pasado muy rápido, pero han obtenido logros considerables, por su buen trabajo y compromiso con la institución. Los 1500 soles que solicita los invertirá en la compra de más materiales, pues tiene pendiente entregar grandes cantidades de solicitadas por diferentes clientes.
texts.en:
Rita is 39 years old, and alongside her husband, is struggling to improve her quality of life at home. Purchasing a home has been one of her greatest achievements, and now her three children have a place to establish themselves. To increase her income, Rita began to sell construction materials 6 years ago, and became the business manager three years ago. In order to improve every day, Rita strives to provide full-time attention, because the business is located in her house, which allows her to manage the business without neglecting the care of her children. But in recent months, the price of raw materials has increased, which reduced the supply of her business. However, Rita tries to buy in small quantities so that she does not risk losing her investments to her competition. This is Rita's thirteenth loan with MFP, and she feels that the 7 years working with her partners have passed very quickly. Nevertheless, Rita has gained considerable achievements due to her good work and commitment to the institution. Rita is asking for 1500 Peruvian Soles to invest in the purchase of more materials, in order to meet outstanding orders placed by different clients.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase raw materials.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa es una mujer de 47 años, desde que contrajo matrimonio se dedicó en brindar las mejores atenciones a su esposo y sus 8 hijos, quienes en su mayoría ya están casados y ahora sólo vive con los tres últimos. Para satisfacer las necesidades de tan numerosa familia tuvo que dedicarse a diversas actividades, ahora está dedicada a la venta de comida. Su labor consiste en preparar los alimentos durante la mañana, para luego llevarlos a sus consumidores, que en su mayoría son albañiles, por lo que Rosa se dirige a diversas obras de construcción con sus almuerzos. Esta rutina la realiza de lunes a viernes, dejando un espacio por las tardes para atender su hogar, ya que sus hijos aun son pequeños. Sin embargo, últimamente Rosa, ha notado que sus gastos diarios se están incrementando, debido al alza de precio de los víveres, pero como ella tiene un trato con sus clientes de cobrar su servicio a fin de mes, no puede incrementar el precio de sus porciones. Por lo que ahora está muy esmerada en ampliar su casa y ambientarla para instalar un restaurante, ya que tiene los muebles necesarios para iniciar su negocio y dejar de trasladarse de un lugar a otro. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y junto a sus compañeras, con las que conforma su banco comunal tratan de trabajar con responsabilidad para no perjudicar su imagen dentro de la organización. Los 1000 soles que solicita son de suma importancia para Rosa, pues comprará víveres al por mayor que disminuyan el costo de inversión en su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 47 years old. Since she got married, she has focused on providing the best care to her husband and their 8 children, most of whom are already married, and now only the last three live with Rosa. To meet the needs of so many people, Rosa had to engage in various activities, and she is now dedicated to selling food. Her job is to prepare food in the morning, and then take it to her customers. Most of Rosa's clients are masons, so Rosa drives to various construction sites to sell lunches. This is her schedule Monday through Friday, which leaves time in the evening to attend to her home, since some of her children are still small. Lately, however, Rosa has noticed that her household expenses are increasing due to the rising prices of food, but since Rosa has a deal with her customers to charge them at the end of the month, Rosa cannot increase the price of her meals. Rosa is now carefully expanding her home to install a restaurant inside, because she already has the necessary furniture, and could then stop moving from one place to another. This is her third loan with MFP, and along with her companions who form her community bank, Rosa works with responsibility in order to not harm her image within the organization. Rosa is requesting 1000 Soles in order to buy groceries at wholesale, and to decrease the cost of investing in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Lucas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for her meals.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.es: Rosalinda es una mujer de 36 años, se caracteriza por la dedicación que brinda a sus seres queridos, desde su pareja hasta sus 3 hijos, por quienes se sacrificó junto a su esposo, para darles una casa propia donde habitar. Durante todos estos años se ha dedicado al comercio, pero la necesidad de estar junto a sus hijos pequeños la llevó a buscar una actividad que le diera la oportunidad de trabajar en casa, y gracias a una vecina consiguió trabajar en la fabricación de aretes para damas, los cuales realiza  todo el día en su casa, ya que cuenta con los materiales y herramientas para elaborar los diversos diseños que le solicitan, a lo que está avocada 8 horas al día, pues trata que el trabajo que realice sea muy eficiente y llene las expectativas de sus clientas. Con la práctica adquirida, crea nuevos diseños que impacten y gusten para tener la posibilidad de vender al por mayor y así aumentar sus ingresos. Además, Rosalinda también desea instalar una tienda de abarrotes en su casa, ya que las que hay, está a gran distancia. Estar en su treceavo crédito con MFP, experiencia que la motiva a seguir trabajando como equipo, pues cada una de sus compañeras tratan de mantener el grupo en armonía y apoyándose frente a las circunstancias difíciles, y son muy agudas al evaluar a cada persona que desea integrar el banco comunal que tanto les costó formar. Con los 2500 soles que solicita comprará materiales y herramientas nuevas para hacer sus aretes con un mejor acabado.
texts.en:
Rosalinda is a 36-year-old woman characterized by the dedication that she offers to her loved ones, from her husband to her 3 sons, for whom she sacrificed together with her husband in order to provide them with a house of their own to live in. During many years she worked at a business away from her home, but the necessity to be with her young children led her to search for an activity that gives her the opportunity to work at home. Thanks to a neighbor she has found work making women's earrings, which she does all day in her house. Since she now has the materials and tools she needs to make the various designs that are requested from her by her customers, she keeps herself open to customers' orders 8 hours a day, trying to make sure that she carries out her work efficiently and fulfills her customers' expectations. With the skills that she has developed, she creates new designs to impress and please her customers in hope of selling a greater amount and by doing so increasing her income. Rosalinda also wants to install a grocery store in her house, since all the other grocery stores in the region are far away. She is in her thirteenth loan with MFP. Her experience with the group has motivated her to continue working as a team, since each of her partners tries to maintain harmony in the group, helps the other partners when they are faced with difficult circumstances, and is very smart and careful in evaluating new people who wish to join the communal bank that they all worked so hard to create. With the 2500 soles that she requests, Rosalinda will purchase new materials and tools with which she will be able to make her earrings with even greater results.

Translated from Spanish by Kevin Lenhart, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de materiales para la elaboración de aretes

loans.name: Marie  Joseph

texts.fr: Marie Joseph M. est une jeune femme qui vit avec ses deux enfants et sa petite soeur. Depuis qu'elle a quitté son mari, elle s'est adonnée à cette activité qu'elle dit trés rentable et qui lui permet de subvenir aux besoins de sa petite famille. Cependant elle voudrait disposer de plus de moyens pour accroitre son activité.
texts.en:
Marie Joseph M. is a young woman who lives with her two children and her younger sister. Since she left her husband, she has been devoting all her time to this work that she says is very profitable and enables her to provide for her small family. However, she would like to have more funds in order to grow her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell local alcoholic drinks

loans.name: Peniel - Group 4

texts.en: The members of this group of five entrepreneurs live in Guaricanos. It is a large neighborhood on the northern limit of Santo Domingo. The brand new Santo Domingo Metro (subway train) has a station right at the entrance of Guaricanos; however, modern improvements haven't reached many of our borrowers' homes. All services, especially water, are scarce. Finding employment is difficult, which is why many people, especially single mothers like Nereida P., find that they need to put their skills to work in order to support their families. Nereida is thirty-six years old and has two children. She didn't complete middle school, but went to beauty school and received a certificate in beauty culture. She set up a salon where she works alone. Peak days are Saturdays and Sundays. She explains that things are not easy lately. "People come less often than before," she points out. Even so, she's been able to build a faithful clientele that will still come to get their hair done at least once a week. Nereida knows they pay not only for the service, they also pay to have HER provide the service. She will use this loan to buy specific hair products so that she can offer "special services" to her customers. When you wash hair with brand name products you can charge more, and Dominican women are willing to pay well to have their hair well taken care of. She will also buy a few new brushes, rollers and pins. This beauty salon is this inspiring young woman's sole source of income. Please help us continue to support her and her work with this Kiva loan. Thank you!

loans.use: To buy brand name beauty products for her salon.

loans.name: María Viviana

texts.es: Doña María T. cuenta con 42 años de edad, es soltera de oficios Comerciante, “Compra y venta de consumo diario” cuenta con una tienda , habita junto a  sus 2 hijos, ella y sus hijos se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 12 años vender en la tienda  en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Xeatzam del Cantón Nimapa , del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención aumentar su mercadería y así poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria T., 42 years old, is single and operates a general store. She lives with her two children. She, her children, and several employees operate the store. For twelve years she has had the store in her residence, which is in the Paraje Xeatzam del Cantón Nimapa, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. The demand for her products has increased, but current economic conditions do not permit an increase in capital; therefore she has turned to the Asociación ASDIR and applied for a loan for the purpose of purchasing additional merchandise and, from the sale of this merchandise, increasing her income.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Commercial (working capital)

loans.name: Olímpia Virgínia

texts.pt:
Olímpia Virgínia M. é natural de Maputo, tem 40 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de uma filha com 23 anos de idade, alem da sua filha sustenta os seus  pais que vive com eles. Vive na casa dos pais.

Olímpia estudou até 6ªclasse e parou por falta de condicoes financeiras e vagas nas zonas periférica da casa que não lhe acarretasse custo de hospedagem ou transporte. A mais de 10 anos que vive de negocio que consiste na venda de produtos alimentares com destaque o leite Cremora que adquira a caixa por 1500,00mt e vende por 2000,00mt. Deste negocio tem um rendimento mensal liquido de 7000,00mt.

Olímpia solicita empréstimo pela primeira vez na Hluvuku e no Kiva, com qual pretende aumentar o seu estoque, futuramente pretende outro empréstimo para construção da sua própria casa e comprar uma viatura e tudo conta com credito.
texts.en:
Olímpia Virgínia M. is a native of Maputo and is 40 years old. She is single and the mother of a 23 year-old daughter. Besides her daughter she also supports her parents who live with them. She lives in her parents' home. Olímpia went to school until the 6th grade and stopped because of poor financial conditions, and she could not support the cost of housing or transportation for the vacancies in the zones around her home. For more than 10 years she has lived off her business that consists of selling food products. Her stand out product is Cremora milk that she acquires for 1,500MT per box and sells for 2,000MT. This business has monthly earnings of 7,000MT. Olímpia is requesting a loan for the first time with Hluvuku and with Kiva. She intends to increase her stock, and in the future would like another loan to start construction on her own home and purchase a vehicle. All of it depends on credit.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of various products

loans.name: Santa Rosa

texts.es: Doña Santa C. cuenta con 55 años de edad, es casada de oficios Costurera, “Confección de delantales” cuenta con un taller de 3 maquinas, habita junto  con su esposo y sus 4 hijos, ella y sus hijos se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 18 años de elaborar delantales en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Xeatzam del Cantón Nimapa , del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y tener mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Fifty-five years old, Mrs. Santa C. is married and a seamstress, a "maker of aprons." She has a workshop with three machines and lives with her husband and their four children. She, her children, and two employees work together. She has produced aprons in her residence for eighteen years. Her home is in the Paraje Xeatzam del Cantón Nimapa, Totonicapán department, Guatemala. The demand for her aprons has grown, but current economic conditions do not allow an increase of capital; therefore she has turned to the Asociación ASDIR and applied for a loan, with which she will purchase raw material. She will then be able to increase sales, hoping also to enable her children to advance and have a higher standard of living.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Craftwork (purchase of raw material)

loans.name: Yayi

texts.es: Yavi tiene 32 años, desde que contrajo matrimonio ha trabajado arduamente para ofrecer a sus 3 hijos un lugar donde habitar como familia. Desde muy joven le agradó ocuparse de las labores domésticas, ya que su madre la incentivó a aprender a cocinar, y con el tiempo se dio cuenta que era un don el que tenía, sobre todo por la deliciosa sazón que posee. Yavi realiza las compras todos los días, para luego preparar los diversos menús que le solicitan sus pensionistas, quienes trabajan en diversas obras de construcción. A pesar de tener dificultades con los pagos mensuales de algunos clientes, Yavi administra su dinero adecuadamente con la finalidad de ahorrar y poder realizar su deseo de  instalar un restaurante en su domicilio para generar mayores ingresos, sin tener que trasladarse a diversos lugares para vender su comida. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, y el tiempo que tiene en su banco comunal le ha enseñado a trabajar en equipo y a saber organizarse adecuadamente para conseguir sus objetivos. Comprar los utensilios de cocina necesarios le ayudará a Yavi a incrementar la producción de sus porciones para servir a las personas que se lo vienen solicitando, razón por la cual, solicita estos 1000 soles de crédito.
texts.en:
Yavi is 32 years old, and since the day she married she has worked hard to provide her three children with a place for them all to live as a family. Ever since she was very young she has enjoyed taking care of the household chores. Then her mother encouraged her to learn to cook and over time she realized that it was a gift that she had, most of all because of the delicious seasonings she has. Yavi does the shopping every day in order to prepare the various dishes requested by her lodgers who are working on various construction sites. In spite of having difficulties with some of her customers making their monthly payments, Yavi manages her money properly with the aim of saving some money and being able to achieve her dream of opening a restaurant in her house. This would increase her income without having to make deliveries to various locations in order to sell her meals. This is her third loan with Microfinanzas PRISMA and during her time with her communal bank, she has been taught teamwork and how to be properly organized to meet one's objectives. Purchasing these cooking utensils will help Yavi increase her production of meals in order to keep up with demand. That's why she is requesting this loan of 1,000 Sols.

Translated from Spanish by Daniel Kvaka, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cooking utensils.

loans.name: El Samaritano Group

texts.es:
el grupo el Samaritano esta integrado por tres personas residentes de la colonia Buena Vistas, todas ellas se conocen desde hace mucho tiempo atras, las actividades que realizan las integrantes del grupo son las siguientes:
la sra. Martha Marintez tiene 48 años de edad, ella viven en union libre con el sr. Jose Paz y tienen un hijo que depende de ellos, el esta estudiando en el colegio, ellos tienen una pulperia desde hace 4 años y en estos momentos necesitan el credito para poder surtirla ya que este es el unico trabajo que ella tiene y es su fuente de ingresos para sustentar su hogar.
La sra. Luz A. tiene 56 años de edad, es soltera y sus hijos ya estan todos casados, ella vive sola en su casa, dicha casa la esta construyendo, su negocio es vender ropa americana clasificada, esta ropa la compra en Tegucigalpa y la vende en la frontera de Honduras El Salvador, ella necesita comprar mas fardos de ropa para venderla y asi tener mayores ganancias. la meta de ella es poder terminar de construir su casa.
la Sra. Elba M. tiene 32 años de edad, ella es viuda y en estos momentos vive en union libre con el sr, Pablo Nuñez con quien tiene un niño de 8 meses de edad, el es zapatero y ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usada, ella necesita el credito para poder comprar fardos de ropa y tener mejores ganancias y asi poder cubrir con todos los gastos de su hijo que es recien nacido.
texts.en:
The Samaritano group is comprised of three residents of the Colonia Buena Vistas. They have all known each other for a long time. The member’s activities follow: Martha M., 48, lives in a common law marriage with Jose Paz. They have a dependent son. He is in school. They have had a mini market for four years. They now need a loan to be able to stock the store. This is the only work that she has, and it is her source of income to support her household. Luz A., 56, is single. Her children are all married, and she lives alone in her house. The house is under construction. She sells used American clothing. She buys the clothes in Tegucigalpa and sells it on the border of Honduras and El Salvador. She needs a loan to buy more bundles of clothes to sell in order to have greater earnings. Her goal is to be able to finish building her house. Elba M., 32, is a widow. She now lives in a common law marriage with Pablo Nuñez. They have an eight month old son. He is a shoemaker, and she sells used clothes. She needs a loan to be able to buy bundles of clothes and have greater earnings. This way she will be able to cover the costs of her recently born son.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy bundles of clothes, butter, rice, beans, sugar, coffee, pastas, maseca (brand of corn), cornmeal, tomato sauce, soups

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Herlinda Rosario

texts.es: Doña Herlinda A. cuenta con 55 años de edad, es casada de oficios Tejedora, “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para mujeres” cuenta con un taller de 2 Telares, habita junto a su esposo y con  sus 2 hijos, ella y sus hijos se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con dos empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 12 años de elaborar Cortes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Chichaclan del Cantón Paquí , del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y tener mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Doña Herlinda A. is 55 years old and married. She lives with her husband and two children. She is a weaver and works in the workshop “Elaboración de Cortes Típicos para mujeres”. The workshop has two looms. Both of her children are in the same line of work and work with her. She has been working for 12 years to establish her company 'Elaboracion de Cortes Tipicos para mujeres' in her home. Her house is in the Paraje Chichaclan del Cantón Paquí area in the Totonicapán region of Guatemala. Recently, the demand from her clientele has grown. However, the current economic conditions make it difficult for her to build up enough capital. For this reason, she approached the Asociacion ASDIR to request a loan. The loan will be used to buy more material and in this way she will be able to increase her sales. She hopes this will also help her children and improve the conditions in which they live.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrafts (buy more material)

loans.name: Quina Ernesto

texts.pt:
Quina Ernesto C. é natural de Maputo, tem 42 anos de idade, viúva e mãe de 6 filhos com idades entre o primeiro com 20 e o ultimo com 6 anos respectivamente. Apenas sustenta os filhos e todos moram com ela.

Quina estudou até 4ªclasse e parou quando faleceu a sua mãe, em 1996 inicia actividade comercial que consistiu na compra e venda de feijão Nhemba, milho e mandioca, negocio que veio a mudar para venda de roupa adquirindo na terra do rand e este segundo ela lhe proporcionou um avanço maior nos resultados dai que até data hoje vive deste negocio, qual tem rendimento mensal de 18000,00mt a 20000,00mt.

Quina solicita empréstimo pela primeira vez na Hluvuku com qual pretende aumentar o seu volume de negocio, futuramente pretende solicitar empréstimo para a conclusão da sua casa parte exterior.
texts.en:
Quina Ernesto C. is a native of Maputo and is 42 years old. She is a widow and the mother of 6 children. The oldest is 20 years old and the youngest is 6 years old. She only supports her children, all of whom live with her. Quina went to school until the 4th grade and stopped when her mother passed away. In 1996 she began her commercial activities which consisted of buying and selling Nhemba beans, corn, and cassava. Her business has changed to selling clothing which she acquires in South Africa. She was given an advance that allowed her to earn a living from her business. She has a monthly income of 18,000MT to 20,000MT. Quina is soliciting a loan for the first time through Hluvuku, and she intends to use it to increase the volume of her business. In the future she wants to request another loan to finish the outside of her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Jared Wandry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase and sale of clothing

loans.name: Micaela

texts.es: Doña Micaela G. cuenta con 46 años de edad, es casada de oficios Panadera, “Elaboración de Panes” cuenta con un taller de 1hormo, habita junto a su esposo y con  sus 3 hijos, ella y sus hijos se dedican al mismo oficio cuentan con un empleados para la misma actividad, lleva 12 años de elaborar Panes en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Chichaclan del Cantón Paquí , del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y tener mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
Doña Micaela G. is 46 years old and married. She lives with her husband and three children. She is a baker and works in a bakery with one oven. The bakery is called “Elaboración de Panes.” Her children are also bakers. For the past 12 years she has been developing the business 'Elaboracion de Panes' in her home. It is located in Paraje Chichaclan del Cantón Paquí in the Totonicapán area of Guatemala. Recently, demand from her customers has grown. However, because of the current economic conditions, it is difficult to build up necessary capital. For that reason she approached Asociacion ASDIR for a loan. With this loan she will buy more materials and will be able to increase her sales. By doing this, she hopes to improve the lives of her children and better the conditions in which they live.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Crafts (Buy more materials)

loans.name: Daniel

texts.es: Daniel tiene 32 años, vive solo en una casa alquilada. Hace 4 años implementó su propio taller donde ofrece el servicio de planchado y pintura de carrocería, el cual consiste en mejorar el aspecto exterior de los autos, anteriormente trabajaba en un taller de manera dependiente, pero reunió todos sus ahorros para hacer realidad su deseo de tener un negocio propio, donde maneja su propio capital de trabajo. Daniel trabaja todos los días durante todo el día, sólo descansa los domingos, y el trabajo que realiza es muy responsable y de calidad, por lo que ha atraído a nuevos clientes que solicitan de sus servicios. Para más adelante, Daniel está ahorrando para comprar un nuevo soplete de pintura y mejores herramientas. Es la tercera vez que viene solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y está muy comprometido con el  desarrollo de su banco comunal, por lo que es parte de la junta directiva de su grupo. El dinero requerido será usado en la compra de pinturas para carros y la válvula de su soplete, el costo es mayor al que solicita, pero será completado con sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Daniel is 32 years old and lives by himself in a rental home. Four years ago, he started his own auto paint and body shop. His business focuses on improving car exteriors. Previously, he worked as an employee at a different repair shop, but he gathered his savings to fulfill his dream of owning his own shop where he could direct his own work efforts.

Daniel works all day, everyday and only rests on Sundays. He is a responsible person and produces high-quality work. As a result, he has attracted new clients requesting his services. Daniel is saving money to purchase a new paint spray gun and better tools.

This is the third time that he is requesting a loan with MFP. He is very committed to the development of his community bank because he is a member of the board of directors. The requested loan will be used to purchase car paint and the paint gun valve. The cost of both items is more than the requested amount, but he will pay for the rest with his savings.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for his auto shop

loans.name: Juan Arnoldo

texts.es: El Señor Juan P. de 34 años de edad,  casado de oficios Sastre, “Elaboración de Pantalones” cuenta con un taller de 4 maquinas,  habita conjuntamente con su esposa,  desde su niñez se dedicaba en la Artesanía gracias a los préstamos  a podido llevar a su familia adelante donde es persona muy conocida, y su residencia en el Paraje Xerachochac, Totonicapán, Guatemala. Donde ha llegado a Solicitar a la Asociación Asdir un financiamiento para la compra de materia prima para dicha artesanía para facilitar y poder cubrir la demanda a su clientela y así poder darles mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Juan P. is 34 years old, married, and lives with his wife. He is a tailor by profession who specializes in making pants, and has a tailoring workshop with 4 machines. Since childhood he has worked making handicrafts, and thanks to loans he has been able to help his family get ahead. Juan is very well known in Paraje Xerachochac, Totonicapán, Guatemala, where he lives. He is asking the Asdir Association for a loan so he can purchase raw material for making pants. This will allow Juan to meet the demand of his clientele and thus help him improve his family's living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Christopher Knutson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Handicrafts (purchasing raw material)

loans.name: Edith

texts.es: Edith tiene 46 años, vive en casa de sus padres con sus 2 hijos. Tiene un salón de belleza desde hace 4 años en su misma casa, aprovechando que está ubicada en una avenida bien transitada, por lo que tiene gran demanda para realizar cortes de cabello, y su destreza para elaborar bellos peinados y tratamientos de belleza es muy reconocida, por lo que su clientela nueva es recomendada por sus clientes regulares. Edith quiere ser una de las mejores estilistas de su localidad, es por ello que se esmera en cada trabajo que realiza; y para el futuro quiere tener un salón de belleza muy grande en una zona más céntrica de su ciudad. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP, por lo que se compromete ser puntual en los pagos y muy responsable en las tareas que le asignen en su grupo. El dinero que solicita es para la compra de espejos y productos para los tratamientos de belleza que necesita incorporar en su salón de belleza.
texts.en:
Edith is 46 years old and lives in her parents' home with her two children. She has run a beauty salon for the past four years out of the home for the past four years, taking advantage of the location on a well-traveled avenue. For this reason, her haircuts are in high demand and her skill in hair colorings and beauty treatments is well known, so she gets a lot of new clients recommended by her regular customers. Edith wants to be one of the best stylists in her area, and this is why she works very hard on every job she does. In the future she wants to have a much larger salon in a more central area of her city. This is her first loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to be punctual with her payments and very responsible with the tasks she is assigned from the group. The money she is requesting will be used for the purchase of mirrors and hair treatment products that she needs to incorporate into her business.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase mirrors and other beauty products

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña María T. cuenta con 52 años de edad, es Soltera de oficios Comerciante, “Compra y venta de ropa típica” cuenta con un negocio de , habita junto a  sus 3 hijos, ella y sus hijos se dedican al mismo oficio, lleva 12 años de vender Ropa Típica en su residencia que se encuentra en el Paraje Paxocol del Cantón Paquí , del departamento de Totonicapán, Guatemala,  actualmente la demanda de su clientela a crecido, pero las condiciones económicas en que se encuentra no son suficientes para que el pueda aumentar su capital, por tal razón acudió a la Asociación ASDIR, a solicitar un préstamo, con la intención de comprar materia prima y de esa manera poder aumentar sus ventas, esperando también poder sacar adelante a sus hijos, y tener mejores condiciones de vida
texts.en:
María T. is a 52-year-old single merchant, saying she "buys and sells typical clothing." She lives with her three children, and they all make a living in the same trade. María has 12 years experience selling clothes from her home in Paraje Paxocol del Cantón Paquí, department of Totonicapán, Guatemala. Currently the demand from her clientele is growing, but with the economic conditions she's unable to increase her capital, which is why she has turned to Kiva partner Asociación ASDIR. She is requesting a loan to purchase raw materials for her business and in this way increase her sales. She's also hoping to make headway for her children and improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes to increase her inventory

loans.name: Israel Group

texts.es:
En la ciudad de el Alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal Villa Tejada, a este pertenece la asociación Israel, formada por trece miembros que trabajan con mucho entusiasmo por mejorar en sus pequeños negocios.
Diversas son las actividades que tienen dentro el grupo, por ejemplo: Venta de abarrotes, elaboración de comida, venta de juguetes, calzados, chompas, joyas, una de ellas tiene su tienda de lubricantes. Todos afirman que desean ampliar sus ventas, para esto necesitan reforzar su capital comprando mayor mercadería, tienen la seguridad que podrán generar mayores ganancias para el bien de sus familias.
texts.en:
In the city of El Alto is the focal center of Villa Tejada, a community bank to which the Israel association belongs. This group consists of 13 members who work with a lot of enthusiasm to improve their small businesses. The members are involved in diverse activities, such as selling groceries, making food, selling toys, footwear, sweaters and jewelery; one of the women has a shop of oils and lubricants. All the members attest to the desire to increase their sales, and to do this they need to strengthen their capital in order to purchase more supplies. They have the security that they will be able to generate better earnings for the wellbeing of their families.

Translated from Spanish by Marty Greenstein, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
La señora Hilda es socia del Banco Comunal “Yunga Uyo” en  Distrito de Yunguyo, la  provincia de Chucuito, departamento de Puno, tiene 39 años de edad, estado civil casada y tiene 03 hijos, Vive en el Barrio Alto Florida, ella posee estudios superior incompleto (agropecuaria). 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 8 años, la actividad a la que se dedica es la compra y venta de abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite).  Su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles con los cuales pudo comprar más productos para su negocio.

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional de S/ 3000.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo le servirá para comprar variedades de abarrotes como (arroz, azúcar, fideos, aceite, leche), su mayor deseo es poner una tienda grande bien surtida.
 
Nos cuenta que le gusta muchos las capacitaciones y las reuniones, y está agradecida a Manuela Ramos por el apoye que les da para que sus negocios sigan adelante
texts.en:
Hilda is a member of the "Yunga Uyo" Communal Bank in the Yunguyo district, Chucuito province in the Puno department. She is 39 years old and married with 3 children. She lives in the Florida neighborhood. She did not complete her studies (in agriculture). She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 8 years. Her business is the purchase and sale of groceries (rice, sugar, pasta, oil). Her first loan for 3000 soles enabled her to buy products for her business. Now she would like an additional loan of 3000 soles to purchase a greater variety of grocery products (rice, sugar, pasta, oil, milk). Her dream is to have a large, well-stocked store. She tells us that she enjoys the training and meetings, and is very grateful to Manuela Ramos for the support it gives them to continue their work.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, sugar, pasta, oil and milk

loans.name: Josefa

texts.es:
La señora Josefa pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Flores II ubicado en Jaillihuaya del  distrito de Chuchito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; ella tiene 42 años de edad,  2 hijos, de estado civil casada, posee estudios de segundaria completa. Vive en la Urbanización Ciudad Jardín, Maz-B2  Lte. 7.
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 años e inicio su negocio de venta de artesanías, con un préstamo inicial de S/.  300.00 nuevos soles, compro lanas.
En el momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 600.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en la compra de Lanas de diferentes colores  para la elaboración de de sus artesanías y también comprara napa (relleno). Su mayor sueño es formar una micro empresa de venta de artesanías.
A ella le gustan las reuniones de su Banco Comunal, las charlas,  la puntualidad y la forma de pago.
texts.en:
Josefa is a member of the "Las Flores II" Communal Bank located in Jaillihuaya in the Chuchito district in Puno. She is 42 years old and married with 2 children. She has completed her secondary school studies. She lives in the Garden City Development. She has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement for 2 years and started her business selling handicrafts. With the initial loan of 300 soles, she purchased wool. Currently she is seeking a loan of 600 soles to invest in the purchase of wools of different colors to create her handicrafts, as well as to purchase stuffing. Her dream is to form a microbusiness for handicraft sales. She enjoys the meetings at her Communal bank--the chats, the punctuality, and the form of payment.

Translated from Spanish by Kristen Beck, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase different colored wool and stuffing

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Magdalena, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Flores II ubicado en Jaillihuaya del  distrito de Chuchito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; ella tiene 29 años de edad, con 2 hijos, de estado civil conviviente, posee estudios de educación superior (educación Técnica en enfermería)  Vive en la Urbanización Ciudad Jardin, Maz W-5 Lte. 25

Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 años, ella inicio su negocio de venta de cereales de la región, con un préstamo de S/.  300.00 nuevos soles.
En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir en la compra de cereales de la región, los mismos que venderá solo en las ferias de ILave los días  domingos. Asi mismo ella invertirá en la crianza de aves de corral, para comercializarlos en las diferentes ferias de Puno.
Su mayor sueño es seguir trabajando y poner una tienda, o en su defecto un tópico, de acuerdo a su carrera profesional.
A ella le gustan los ahorros y los encuentros deportivos que organiza Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Magdalena belongs to the Banco Comunal “Las Flores II" in Jaillihuaya, located in the Chuchito district in the Puno Province in the Puno Region. She is 29 years old, has two children and lives with her partner. She completed her advanced studies in nursing at a technical school.

Magdalena has been working with the Manuela Ramos organization for four years. She started her business selling regional cereals with a loan of S/. 300.00 nuevos soles. At present, she is requesting a loan of S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles to invest in the purchase of additional regional cereals, which she sells at the markets every Sunday. She will also use the money to raise poultry to sell at the Puno markets.

Her biggest dream is to continue working and start a store, or even an infirmary, so that she can use her professional training. Magdalena enjoys both the savings trainings and the sports matches that Manuela Ramos organizes.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase barley, wheat, quinoa and poultry

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La señora Alejandrina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Flores II ubicado en Jaillihuaya del  distrito de Chuchito, Provincia de Puno, Departamento de Puno; ella tiene 47 años de edad, y 3 hijos.  De estado civil conviviente, posee estudios de primaria completa, Vive en la Urbanización Aziruni 3ra etapa, Maz-C4  Lte 6.
Trabaja con el movimiento Manuela R. desde hace casi 1 año e inicio su negocio de venta de artesanías gracias a su primer préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles.
En este momento ella requiere un préstamo de S/. 800.00 Nuevos soles, para poder invertir  en la compra de materia prima para la elaboración de sus artesanías (lanas de diferentes colores),  ella vende sus productos en las feria de la región,
Su mayor sueño, es hacer de su negocio una pequeña empresa, para así poder obtener más ganancias.
A ella le gustan mucho las reuniones de su Banco Comunal y la forma de pago.
texts.en:
Alejandrina belongs to Las Flores II Communal Bank, located in Jaillihuaya in the Chuchito District (Puno Province, Puno Department). She is 47 years old and has three children. She lives with her significant other and completed an elementary school education. She lives in the third phase of a development called Aziruni, Maz-C4, Lot 6. She has worked with the Manuela R. movement for almost a year, and she started selling handicrafts with the help of her first loan for S/. 300.00. At this time she needs a loan for S/. 800.00 to invest in the purchase of bulk material (different colors of wool) to make those handicrafts. She sells them at local fairs. Her greatest dream is to turn her business into a small company so that she can earn higher profits. She likes the Communal Bank meetings and the payment terms very much.

Translated from Spanish by Kelly Wester, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase different colors of wool

loans.name: Rosa Marina

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Marina C. D. C. tiene 55 años, vive en el distrito D. Casa GranD., provincia D. Ascope, departamento D. La Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria completa y tiene 3 hijos.
Rosa antes vendía productos D. belleza en mínimas cantidades (lo distribuía entre amigos y familiares).Recién ha iniciado como socia en Manuela Ramos y es miembro del Banco Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II.  Ahora con este crédito podrá ampliar su negocio adquiriendo nuevos productos D. belleza y ampliando su cartera D. clientes. 
Con este crédito D. 300 soles, lo invertirá para adquirir productos D. belleza para stock..
Rosa tiene como sueño instalar su tienda D. perfumería.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Marina C. D. C. is 55 years old and lives in the Casa GranD. district, Ascope province, La Libertad department, Perú. She completed high school and has three children. Rosa used to sell small amounts of beauty products to friends and relatives. Recently, she became a member of Manuela Ramos, and she is a member of the Banco Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II. Now, with this loan, she will be able to expand her business by purchasing new beauty products and adding to her list of customers. She will use this loan of $100 to purchase inventory. Rosa dreams of opening a store that sells beauty products.

Translated from Spanish by Jeff Schell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: for the purchase of inventory of beauty products

loans.name: Ana Geissel

texts.es:
En el municipio de Chichigalpa de la ciudad de Chinandega, la señora Ana L. se dedica a su actividad de venta de tortillas elaboradas por ella misma todos los días desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana siendo elaboradas y vendidas por ella misma en su localidad.

La razón por la que Ana ha acudido a Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para la compra de maíz, leña y cal para la elaboración de las tortillas. Con este crédito se beneficia grandemente porque permite adquirir ingresos para continuar manteniendo su hogar.
texts.en:
In the Chichigalpa of the city Chinandega, Ana L. sells tortillas she makes herself. Every day, starting very early in the morning, she makes the tortillas and then sells them in the area herself. The reason Ana has come to Ceprodel is to ask for a loan with which to buy corn, firewood, and lime to make tortillas. This loan helps her enormously because it allows her to generate the income she needs to continue maintaining her home.

Translated from Spanish by Hannah Lily, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing corn and firewood

loans.name: Santos

texts.es:
La señora Santos E. F. tiene 43 años, vive en el distrito de Casa Grande, provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió Secundaria Completa, tiene 1 hija que depende económicamente de ella.
Santos  se dedica a la venta de cerveza y en los fines de semana vende comida rápida, al inicio se dedicaba a la venta de productos de belleza, encontrando mas adelante un negocio más rentables en la venta de cerveza, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su Banco Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II, lo invirtió en la compra de insumos para la preparación de alimentos (yuca, arroz, cebolla, limones).
Con el crédito de 1700 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de cerveza.
Santos tiene como sueño terminar de construir su casa.
texts.en:
Mrs. Santos E. is 43 years old, lives in the Casa Grande district, province of Ascope, department of La Libertad in Peru. She finished secondary school and has a daughter that depends on her for her support. Santos makes a living selling beer and also sells fast food on weekends. Initially she sold beauty products, later finding the sale of beer to be more lucrative. She has her business in her home. The first loan of 300 soles from the Community Bank Romanas Luchadoras II she used to purchase supplies for food preparation (yucca, rice, onions, lemons). She will invest the proceeds of this loan of 1700 soles in the purchase of beer. Santos dreams of being able to finish the construction of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of alcoholic beverages (beer)

loans.name: Ana Isaura

texts.es:
En el municipio de Chichigalpa, la señora Ana M. se dedica arduamente a atender su negocio de pulpería el cual posee en su casa de habitación donde desde hace 12 años se dedica con gran ahínco a vender los diferentes productos ofreciéndolos a sus clientes.

Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel con el propósito de obtener un crédito para la compra de los productos ya que le es de importancia obtenerlos y de esta manera salir adelante en su negocio que tanto requiere de su apoyo en este momento para salir adelante.
texts.en:
In the town of Chichigalpa, Señora Ana M. arduously devotes herself to the grocery business she runs in her home. For 12 years, she has devoted herself with great determination to the sale of the various products she offers to her customers.

Currently, Sra. M. has come to Ceprodel to request a loan for the purchase of inventory it is important for her to obtain. In this way, she will progress in her business, where this assistance is now needed in order to proceed.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es:
La señora Maria Margarita P. V. tiene 28 años, vive en el distrito de Casa Grande, provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudió hasta 2do de Secundaria, tiene 3 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
María se dedica a la venta de verduras y de comida rápida, cuando inició tenia un pequeño puesto donde vendía verduras, al darse cuenta que aumentaban sus clientes empezó con la venta de comida rápida (esto desarrollado desde su puesto y en su casa).
Recién ha iniciado como socia, y es miembro del Banco Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II.
Con el crédito de 300, lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de comida (arroz, azúcar, aceite, legumbres)
María tiene como sueño poner un restaurante
texts.en:
Señora Maria Margarita P. V. is 28 years old, and lives in the Casa Grande district, in the province of Ascope, La Libertad, Peru.

Maria studied through the second year of High School, and has three children who depend on her financially. Maria devotes herself to selling vegetables and fast food. When she began, she had a small shop where she sold vegetables, but when she realized her number of customers was increasing, she began to sell fast food (prepared in her home).

She has recently become a client and member of the Community Bank Romanas Luchadoras II. With a loan of 300, she will invest in the ingredients she needs to prepare meals (rice, sugar,oil, vegetables).

Maria's dream is to own a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for meal preparation (rice, sugar, oil, vegetables)

loans.name: Maria Ángela

texts.es:
La señora Maria Ángela M. M. tiene 23 años, vive en el distrito de Florencia de Mora, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad; Perú.
Ella cursa estudios Superiores Técnicos (Secretariado).  Ella pertenece al Banco Comunal Unidas para un Futuro Mejor II.
Maria se dedicaba a la venta de ropa interior, trabajando solo con pedidos (empezó con poca mercadería), ahora su producto lo distribuye por su casa entre sus familiares y vecinos; y también los ofrece en su centro de estudios entre compañeros de clases y profesores.
Recién se ha iniciado como socia en Manuela Ramos.
Con este crédito de 300 soles, lo invertirá  en la compra de mercadería (ropa interior) en diferentes tallas y modelos.
Maria tiene como sueño poner una tienda de ropa.
texts.en:
Señora Maria Ángela M. M. is 23 years old, and lives in the Florencia de Mora District in the province of Trujillo, La Libertad, Peru.

Maria is currently completing studies in Advanced Secretarial Skills. She is a member of the Community Bank "United for a Better Future" II.

Maria devotes herself to the sale of undergarments, working only on orders (she began with little inventory). Currently she distributes her products from her home to her extended family and neighbors. She also sells in her school to her classmates and instructors.

Maria has recently become a client of Manuela Ramos. With a loan of 300 soles, she will invest in the purchase of inventory (undergarments) in different sizes and styles.

Maria's dream is to own a clothing store.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purhcase of inventory (undergarments)

loans.name: Ana Patricia

texts.es:
En el municipio de Chichigalpa, la señora Ana B. se dedica a su labor de venta de tortillas las cuales son comercializadas en su establecimiento donde a diario atiende a sus clientes ofreciéndoles riquísimas tortillas elaboradas por ella misma.

Hoy en día ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de las tortillas y para ello espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito será otorgado y de esta manera logrará salir adelante en su desarrollo económico.
texts.en:
In the town of Chichigalpa, Señora Ana B. devotes her time to the sale of tortillas. She sells them in her shop, where she serves her customers delicious tortillas she prepares herself.

Currently Ana is requesting a loan from Ceprodel to purchase the tortillas. Ana confidently hopes that her loan will be granted, and this way she will be able to progress with her economic development.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Novesky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw ingredients.

loans.name: Luz Y Vida Group

texts.es:
En la zona 16 de julio de la ciudad de El alto se encuentra ubicado el centro focal Alto Lima, a este pertenece la asociación “Luz y Vida” formado por catorce  miembros que trabajan junto  a Pro-Mujer hace un año aproximadamente.
La mayoría de ellas son casadas y con familias numerosas. Existen varias actividades dentro el grupo, algunas tienen tiendas de barrio, otras de ellas  venden chompas, repuestos de vehículos, letreros, material de escritorio, Juan Carlos tiene un taller de electricidad. La asociación Luz y Vida necesita comprar mercadería para ampliar sus negocios, de esta manera generaran mayores ingresos para sostener económicamente a sus familias.
texts.en:
The "Luz y Vida" Association belongs to Alto Lima center in the 16 de julio district of the city of El alto. The group was created by 14 members who have worked together with Pro-Mujer for approximately one year. The majority of the women are married with large families.

Members of the group participate in a variety of activities. Some own neighborhood stores, while others sell chompas (traditional sweaters), spare parts for vehicles, signs and stationary supplies. Juan Carlos owns a repair shop for electrical items. The Luz y Vida Asociation needs to purchase merchandise to increase their sales so that they can earn higher incomes and support their families.

Translated from Spanish by Priya Bapat, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: María Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora María Cecilia T. O. tiene 31 años, vive en el distrito de Casa Grande, provincia de Ascope, departamento de La Libertad; Perú.
Ella estudios Superiores Concluidos, tiene 2 hijos.
Ruth tiene se dedica a la venta de comida rápida, su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Recién ha iniciado como socia en Manuela Ramos y miembro del Banco Comunal Romanas Luchadoras II.
Este crédito de 300 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de comida rápida y compra de platos descartables.
María tiene como sueño poner una tienda de abarrotes en un lugar céntrico de su distrito.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maria Cecilia T. is 31 years old and lives in the Casa Grande district, province of Ascope, department of La Libertad in Peru. She finished secondary school and has two children. She makes a living selling fast food and runs her business from her home. She has recently become a member of Manuela Ramos and member of the community bank Romanas Luchadoras II. This loan of 300 soles will be invested in the purchase of raw materials for the making of fast food and disposable plates. Maria dreams of being able to establish a grocery store in a location in the center of the district

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase raw materials for the preparation of fast food and purchase of disposable plates.

loans.name: José Dolores

texts.es:
El señor José U. se dedica con mucho esfuerzo a su negocio de pulpería donde vende los productos comestibles y en especial los granos básicos que son la razón por la cual posee su pulpería.

A pesar de las difíciles circunstancias que él ha atravesado ha logrado salir adelante gracias al apoyo que le ha brindado Ceprodel por medio de los créditos y por este motivo es que hoy en día espera una vez mas muy confiadamente sabiendo que obtendrá el crédito y así saldrá adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
José U. works hard at his business, a local grocery store. In particular, he sells staple grains, which is the reason he has the store. Despite the difficult circumstances he has come across, José has been able to make it thanks to the support provided by Ceprodel through its loans. For this reason, today he confidently waits, knowing that he will obtain the loan and thus continue to advance his business.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of products for store

loans.name: Julia Yamileth

texts.es:
La señora Julia S. se dedica a atender su negocio de pulpería en la ciudad de Chinandega y específicamente en el municipio de Chichigalpa donde a diario ofrece los diferentes productos comestibles a sus clientes. Ella ha sido una excelente trabajadora habiendo mejorado su condición económica gracias a los créditos que le ha brindado Ceprodel.

Hoy en día, una vez más ha espera muy confiadamente en que su crédito le será otorgado y así saldrá adelante en el negocio mejorando su condición y beneficiando a su amada familia que está a su cargo.
texts.en:
Julia S. dedicates herself to looking after her grocery store in the city of Chinandega, located in the municipality of Chichigalpa. Daily she offers various food products to her customers. She has been an excellent worker having improved her economic condition through the loans provided by Ceprodel. Today, once again she confidently expects that she will obtain a loan so that she can succeed in her business improving her status and thus benefiting her beloved family that she cares for.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Elizardo Perez Group

texts.es:
Doce personas conforman la asociación “Elizardo Pérez”, trabajan junto a la familia de Pro-Mujer  hace tres años en el centro focal Alto Lima ubicado  en la zona 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto.
Varias son las actividades que realiza este grupo algunas se dedican a la costura; otras realizan tejidos en maquina; venden pantalones  deportivos; chompas tejidas a mano; chamarras,  también otras se dedican a la carpintería.
La asociación Luz y Vida afirma que necesitan generar mayores ingresos, ya que lo que obtienen no les alcanza para mantener económicamente a sus familias, para esto necesitan de créditos para comprar mercadería en mayor cantidad.
texts.en:
Twelve people make up the "Elizardo P." group. They have been working alongside the Pro-Mujer family for three years at the focal point Alto Lima located in the July 16 area of the city of El Alto. This group engages in several activities such as sewing, weaving by machine, selling sports pants, hand-woven sweaters, jackets and others are engaged in carpentry. The group Luz y Vida affirms that it needs to generate more income, because what the members earn is not enough to support their families economically. This is why they need this loan to purchase merchandise in larger quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise in larger quantities.

loans.name: Fanny Brigida

texts.es: Fanny tiene 1 hijo de 4 años de edad. Fanny se dedica al corte de carne, tiene un puesto junto a su hijo donde han comprado una cortadora de carne, por otra parte, su esposo tiene su auto propio con el que trabaja personalmente. Cuentan con mucha experiencia en el negocio ya que anteriormente solo trabajaban como dependientes y en la actualidad ya son propietarios del negocio. El sector donde se desarrolla su actividad es en el mercado la pampa sector venta de carnes sector accesible donde los clientes están cerca de la caseta donde cortan la carne. La competencia es moderada ya que son muy conocidos en el rubro. El destino del crédito fue para  capital de operación, en el crédito anterior a tenido retrasos debido a que la cliente a estado viajando constantemente a la ciudad de La Paz donde vive su papa esto porque su padre esta en muy mal estado de salud.
texts.en:
Fanny has 1 son who is 4 years old. Fanny is a butcher and has a stall with her son. They have purchased a meat cutter. Her husband has his own car with which he works on his own. They have extensive business experience since they previously worked as employees but currently own their own businesses. The sector where her business is located is in the La Pampa market in the meat selling area which is accessible for customers so that they are near where the meat is cut. Competition is moderate as they are well known in the area. Fanny's previous loan was used as operating capital. Payments of her previous loan were delayed because she had to constantly travel to the city of La Paz where her father lives because he is in very bad health.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for her business.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es: Ricardo cuenta con 40 años, esta casado con la Sra.
