Teresa, contando con una hija de 13 años de edad respectivamente, todos viven juntos y en una casa que es propia, también señalar que cuenta con un vehiculo que el mismo lo trabaja de taxi de día y de noche lo alquila a un chofer  y su esposa se dedica al comercio de cítricos al por menor y mayor entregando directamente al mercado abasto, donde existe buena competencia en los dos rubros, pero la pareja ya cuentan con buena clientela fija con las que trabajan directamente, lo cual le da estabilidad a sus ingresos. El destino del crédito será para la compra de un nuevo motor a su vehiculo y pago de pasivo en agrocapital. La pareja cuenta con un buen comportamiento en sus pagos en agrocapital y otra entidad financiera donde su saldo es pequeño, también señalar que no cuenta con malos antecedentes.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 40 years old, he is married with Teresa and they have a 13 year old daughter and they all live in a house of their own. Also worth mentioning is that they own their own vehicle, and he uses it as a taxi during the day and at night he rents it to a driver, and his wife distributes citrus fruits wholesale to the markets, both occupations being very good fields of work. The couple have built a good and steady client base with whom they work directly, all this yielding a steady income for them. The loan will be destined to purchase a new motor for the vehicle and to invest in a harvest. The couple have been responsible with their payments to Agrocapital (Kiva Field Partner) and another financial institution. Their income is modest but they do not have any previous delinquent credit.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repair.

loans.name: Hernán

texts.es: La familia de Hernán esta compuesta por 5 integrantes: él, su esposa y sus tres hijos menores de edad. Cuentan con casa propia. Hernán se dedica al transporte con su moto taxi, adicionalmente cuenta con una  vagoneta que también presta servicio de taxi los dos vehículos en la zona. La esposa cuenta con un  negocio dentro del mercado central de la localidad donde vende todo tipo de comidas  desde la mañana hasta la noche. El nivel de competencia es medio en sus actividades. El crédito será destinado para la compra de un equipo de gas para su vehiculo. Esta es su quinta operación con un cumplimiento excelente en todas ellas.
texts.en:
Hernán's family consists of five members: himself, his wife, and their three young children. They own their house. Hernán works in transportation with his motorcycle-taxi. He also has a minibus that provides taxi service and the two vehicles operate in their local area. His wife owns a business in the town's central market; she sells various types of food at all hours from morning until night. She has intermediate business skills. The loan will be used to buy a gas tank for Hernán's vehicle. This is his fifth loan cycle and he has an excellent record of loan repayment.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of gas tank

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
Pedro que cuenta con 62 años de edad,  vive en su propia que se encuentra ubicada en la zona oeste de la localidad, vive junto a su esposa de 52 años respectivamente. Sus hijos que ya son mayores lo visitan cada fin de semana. Pedro se dedica a la venta de plásticos, abarrotes y otros de manera ambulante y en la misma venta de abarrotes que maneja su esposa. Ambas actividades en su misma casa donde viven y con sus buenos años de experiencia. La verdad que la competencia es mediana en ambos negocios, ya que están ubicados en muy buena zona y principalmente en su misma vivienda, además por los años de antigüedad en los mismos tienen sus clientes ya establecidos. Pedro ha invertido todo su crédito en lo que tenía previsto, es decir: abarrotes y plásticos. 
Este es el tercer préstamo de Pedro y todos los anteriores los ha cancelado excelentemente. Él tiene una pequeña deuda en otra entidad financiera que ya esta por terminar y de una forma muy puntual.
texts.en:
Pedro is 62 years old. He lives in his own place that is located in the western area of town. He lives with his 52-year-old wife. Their children are already grown and they visit every weekend. Pedro works selling plastics, groceries and other products as a street vendor and in the same place he wife also sells groceries. Both activities are done in their own house and they have many years of experience. The truth is that both businesses are relatively competitive, since they are located in a good area and mainly run out of their own home. In addition, now they have established clients. Pedro has invested his entire loan in what he proposed, which is to say: groceries and plastics. This is Pedro's third loan and all of his previous ones have been paid back. He has a small loan with another financial institution that is almost up and has been paid in a timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by Tara Binetti, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He plans to invest capital in plastics and groceries.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan que cuenta con 54 años vive en su propia casa, ubicada por el Stadium de la localidad, vive junto a su esposa de 52 años respectivamente, la pareja cuenta con 4 hijos de 25-22-20 y 15 años. Los mayores ya le ayudan en sus actividades los más pequeños todavía estudian. Juan se dedica al transporte público de carga pesada con dos camiones en la Asociación  "el tiluchi". También tiene su tejería, para lo cual cuenta con un terreno propio y especifico para tal actividad. Ambos con buenos años de experiencia. La competencia es mediana en ambas actividades, ya que están ubicados en muy buena zona y principalmente con buenos años de antigüedad en los mismos, lo que lo hace tener muchos clientes. Juan ha invertido todo su crédito en lo que tenia previsto es decir, en el arreglo de su camión para la zafra azucarera. Este es un préstamo paralelo del cliente y todos los esta cancelando excelentemente. El tiene una deuda en otra institución financiera  que esta pagando de una forma muy puntual.
texts.en:
Juan is 54 years old and lives in his own home which is located by the Stadium of the town. He lives with his wife who is 52 years old. The couple has 4 children ages 25, 22, 20 and 15. The older children help with the work and the younger ones are still in school. Juan dedicates himself to the public transport of heavy cargo with two trucks in the "El Tiluchi" association. He also has does tile work for which he has his own land specifically for this activity. They both have good years of experience. There is average competition for both businesses since they are located in a good area and have been located there for a good amount of time which allows him to have many clients. Juan has invested his loan in fixing his truck for the sugar harvest. This is a parallel loan for Juan and he has been paying his loan excellently. He has another loan with another financial institution which he is paying punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance for his truck.

loans.name: Juvenal

texts.es: Juvenal A. tiene 57 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Cinda y tienen 3 hijos de los cuales niguno depende de ellos ya que son mayores de edad. Juvenal tiene su casa propia bien ubicada sobre una avenida asfaltada y en una zona populosa entre la Villa 1ro de Mayo y La Pampa de la Isla. En su domicilio tienen una tienda de abarrotes bien surtida y bien ubicada ya que queda en esquina y es bien visible por la vecindad. Juvenal es veterinario de profesion y tiene su pequeño consultorio en su domicilio. Adicionalmente a estas actividades tambien estan confeccionando prendas de vestir para damas las cuales en colaboracion de una de sus hijas llevan hacia la frontera. En su barrio tiene competencia con la tienda de abarrotes pero no hay ningun consultorio veterinario cerca.  El credito tiene como fin el inyectar capital de trabajo para su taller de confeccion y para su tienda de abarrotes lo cual le generara mayores ingresos. Juvenal ha tenido un buen comportamiento de pagos en todos sus creditos demostrando responsabilidad y organización.
texts.en:
At age 57, Juvenal is married to Cinda and they have three children, and none of them are dependent upon their parents since they are older now. Juvenal has his own home which is well-located on an asphalt avenue and in a populated area between Villa 1ro de Mayo and La Pampa de la Isla. In their house, they have a grocery store that is well-stocked and well-located since it lies on a corner and visible to the neighborhood. Juvenal is a veterinarian by profession and has his small office in his house. In addition to these activities, they are also making clothing for women in collaboration with one of their daughters, who carries the products to the border. In their neighborhood they have competition for their grocery store, but there is no other vet nearby. The loan's goal is to increase working capital for their clothing shop and for their grocery store, which will generate the most income. Juvenal has had a good record of making payments in all his loans demonstrating responsibility and organization.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Efren

texts.es: Efren S. vive junto a su familia en la comunidad de villa carmen caluyo provincia aroma, desde hace 43 años atrás. Efrén se dedica a la compra y venta de papa, chuño y tunta, comercializa al por mayor en las diferentes ferias de la localidad, realiza esta actividad junto a su esposa desde hace 22 años atrás. Si bien existe competencia en el mercado, el cliente tiene un buen trato a sus clientes y responsabilidad y su puesto de venta se encuentra en la plena plaza principal. Además que los 22 años de experiencia apoyan bastante al desarrollo de sus actividades. Efrén destina el crédito  para la compra de  ganado vacuno. Efrén no tiene antecedentes negativos en la central de riesgos ni en otros buros de información.
texts.en:
Efrén lives with his family in the community of Villa Carmen Caluyo in the province of Aroma; he has lived here for the past 43 years. Efrén is dedicated to purchasing and selling potatoes, chuño and tunta (a freeze-dried potato product dating back to times before the Incan empire), in bulk at the various markets in his region. He has been doing this activity with his wife for the past 22 years. Indeed competition exists in the market. He treats his clients well and with responsibility, and his sales stand is located entirely in the main plaza. Plus his 22 years of experience really supports his business. Efrén plans to use his loan to buy a cow. Efrén does not have any bad history with the credit bureau.

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cow.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
La señora Maria Luz, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Virgen de las Mercedes”, vive en el Jr. Huallaga Nº 1415, Distrito Tarapoto, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 47 años y es madre de 03 hijos, dos que aun dependen de ella.

Maria, nos cuenta que se inicio con S/. 50.00, se dedica a la venta de comidas a Pensionistas que requieren sus servicio durante todo e mes, entre los que tiene docentes, alumnos, familiares y personas particulares. Su comida tiene muy buena demanda ya que vive cerca de un colegio de la ciudad, y eso le da ventajas para sus ventas.
Actualmente continua con el mismo negocio, y mas adelante piensa ampliar su negocio con un restaurant bien acondicionado; para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y pensionistas. 

Con este préstamo de S/ 1,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando insumos para la preparación diaria de sus alimentos como arroz en kilos, azúcar; paquetes de aceites, pollos en javas y también  algunos utensilios  para implementar su negocio y dar una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Nos cuenta: Estoy bien y tranquila al realizar este trabajo, todavía tengo fuerzas para hacerlo y lo haré hasta donde Dios me lo permita, también agradezco a Manuela Ramos, por haberme apoyado en la meta que quería realizar, espero que sigan así ayudando a más mujeres.
texts.en:
Maria Luz is a member of the community bank "Virgen de las Mercedes". She lives in Jr. Huallaga No. 1415 in the District of Tarapoto of the Province of Mariscal Caceres in San Martin. She is married and is 47 years old and a mother of 3 children, two who are still at home.

Maria says that she started out with S/.50 and she sells prepared foods to retirees who require her services regularly. Among her clients are also students, family and other individuals. There is a great demand for her food, especially from the nearby school, the location being especially important for her sales. Currently she is still running the same business she started out with and in the future she hopes to expand the business into a well equipped restaurant. She wishes to provide better service to her clients and the retirees.

This loan of S/1000 will be invested in the purchase of ingredients for the daily preparation of her foods, such as rice, sugar, cooking oil, and chicken, as well as some utensils to better set up her business and provide better customer service.

Maria Luz says "I am doing well and feel happy carrying out my work. I am still strong enough to do it and I will continue working as long as I can. I am grateful to Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) to having supported me in accomplishing my goals. I hope they will continue to help more women."


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To invest in ingredients for the preparation of her foods.

loans.name: Emiliana Melchora

texts.es:
La señora Emiliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Palomas D. Oro” del Distrito D. Puno, la  provincia D. Puno, departamento D. Puno, tiene 60 años D. edad, está casada y es madre D. 6 hijos, Vive en el Barrio Santa Rosa, ella tiene estudios D. primaria incompleta (3er grado). 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 02 años, ella tiene su negocio D. venta D. abarrotes y verduras, su primer préstamo fue D. S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional D. S/ 500.00 nuevos soles, este préstamo le servirá para comprar mas verduras y abarrotes como huevos, especerías, sal, fideos azúcar, arroz, para luego venderlos en su puesto (local comercial).  Le gustaría ampliar mas su negocio y convertirlo en una tienda granD. y muy surtida.

Le gustan las reuniones D. su Banco Comunal pero nos indica que preferiría el préstamo individual ya que en el grupal a veces hay problemas.
texts.en:
Emiliana is a member of the Community Bank "Palomas D. Oro" (meaning Golden Doves), in the District and Province of Puno. She is 60 years old, is married and has 6 children. She lives in the Santa Rosa neighbourhood. She has a graD. 3 education. She has been with the Manuela Ramos movement (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 2 years. She has a convenience store business selling groceries and vegetables. Her first loan was in the amount of S/300 neuvos soles. Currently she requires an additional loan of S/500 to purchase more vegetables and other grocery store items such as eggs, spices, salt, pasta, sugar, and rice to restock her stand. She would like to expand her business into a large general store. She enjoys partaking in the Community Bank meetings but she says that she would prefer an individual loan because sometimes group loans are problematic.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase onions, carrots, rice, sugar and pasta.

loans.name: Constantina Maria

texts.es:
La señora Constantina es socia del Banco Comunal “Punta Sahuacasi” en la  provincia de Azangaro, departamento de Puno, tiene 45 años de edad, es casada con 02 hijos, vive en la Comunidad Punta Sahuancasi, en el Sector Acochupa, ella posee estudios  de primaria completa. 

Trabaja con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos hace 2 año, la sra. Constantina se dedica a la Venta de carne, su primer préstamo fue de S/ 300.00 nuevos soles.

Actualmente ella desea un préstamo adicional de S/ 600.00 nuevos soles,  con este préstamo ella  desea comprar mas carne, quesos, para poder venderlos en la feria de la zona, le gustaría poder tener mas capital para comprar mas degollados (ganado) y distribuir a los mayoristas.  Desea poder ser mayorista y ganar mas dinero para así poder darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.

A la señora Constantina le gustan mucho las reuniones de su Banco Comunal y las capacitaciones.  Está agradecida al apoyo que da Manuela Ramos.
texts.en:
Constantina is a member of the Punta Sahuacasi community bank in the Azangaro province, Puno department. She is 45, married, and has two children. She lives in the Puna Sahuancasi community, Acochupa sector. She has an elementary school education. She has worked with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for two years. Constantina sells meat. Her first loan was for 300 PEN. She currently wishes to have a loan for an additional 600 PEN. She wants to buy meat and cheese to be able to sell them in the fair in the zone. She would like to be able to have more capital to buy livestock and distribute it to the wholesalers. She would like to be able to be a wholesaler and earn more money. This way she would be able to give her children a better education. Constantine really likes her community bank’s meetings and the trainings. She is grateful to Manuela Ramos for the support they give.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sheep and alpaca

loans.name: Lucas

texts.en:
"I started to farm with only 2-hectares of land that my parents gave me when I married my wife. I have just harvested our rice and I am planning to improve upon what we gained recently from our farm. The income that I get from farming is what I and my wife used to buy all our family needs including the school fees for our 3 children", says Mr. Lucas T., 39-year old father from Agusan Del Sur in Mindanao.

He would like to ask for a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy 1 unit of sprayer and 1 quart of fertilizer. He believes that by doing so, he could improve the yield of his farm.

CEVI provides not just loans to their clients, they also offer credit, education and insurance coverage services as well.

loans.use: To buy sprayer and fertilizers for farming.

loans.name: Liway

texts.en:
"For now, I am busy maintaining a 1-hectare farm. I never owned it. I was just there taking care of everything including the plants and the owner will just pay me or give me a share from the harvest. But I never stop dreaming that someday I will be able to own even a small parcel of land. To provide for the growing needs of our family", says Liway M., 34-year-old mother of four children. 

She is asking for a loan of Php 4,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase foliar fertilizer, seeds and insecticide. The loan will really help her improve the harvest and income as well.

CEVI gives not just loans. They also give training and insurance coverage.

loans.use: To purchase foliar fertilizer, seeds and insecticide

loans.name: Ruben

texts.en:
"I am working very hard to provide all the needs of my family. I am a family man and I do have big dreams especially for my three children", says Mr. Ruben B., a farmer from Agusan Del Sur in Mindanao. 

He needs a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI. He will use the loan to buy herbicide and insecticide. These are very important to ensure a quality harvest from his farm. 

CEVI is helping small business grow. CEVI provides their clients with not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase herbicide and insecticide

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
"I married a farmer and like a typical wife, I stayed in the house taking care of the children and the rest of the household chores. But now, I often help my husband on the farm. I know how hard it is to work under the heat of the sun, touching the dirt and wet soil. But we are able to manage working industriously without complaining to ensure food for our family", says Merlinda D., a 44-year-old mother of four children.

She would like a loan of PHP 6,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase one bag of seeds and herbicides. She believes that by doing so, she can somehow improve the harvest of their farm.

CEVI helps small business grow. It provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and herbicides

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
" This is my second time on KIVA. I ended my previous loan successfully, and I want to use the same program through CEVI. I started my farming business using a one-hectare farm. I also raise ducks, more than 400 and counting, to be able to support all the needs of our two children," says Nelia T., farmer, duck raiser and a mother from Agusan Del Sur in Mindanao.

She would like to ask a loan of Php 6,000 (US$ 125) from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase feed for the ducklings and fertilizers for her rice farm. 

"My previous loan has really helped me in my business. I am hoping that I will be able to achieve the same success with my new loan," she said. 

CEVI helps small businesses grow. They provide clients with not just credit but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase feed for the ducklings and fertilizer for her rice farm

loans.name: Monica

texts.es:
La señora Mónica, pertenece al Banco Comunal “El Abiseo”, vive en el Jr. Pajaten Nº 1046 – La Merced, Distrito de Juanjui, Provincia Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 28 años, 02 hijos estudientes.

Mónica, es una mujer joven, se dedica al servicio de Internet, implementaron su negocio que se encuentra ubicado en su misma casa, atiende diariamente con muy buena demanda de clientes,  por lo que se siente muy contenta ya que es el único Internet en el barrio.
Nos cuenta también que para iniciarse, tuvo que haber pasado por muchos retos, empezaron solo con dos cabinas, viendo que rendía el negocio ampliaron el local y hoy se encuentran trabajando 6 PC`s.
En la actualidad ya es conocida por sus clientes, que son sus amigos, vecinos y clientes fijos, cuenta con un personal que la apoya y brinda servicios de tipeos y otros trabajos.

Con este préstamo de S/ 3,000.00, desea invertirlo comprando equipos para pc`s, ya que algunas maquinas están lentas, y necesitan cambios. Parte del dinero también lo invertirá para implementar su propia red inalámbrica, para así no tener dificultad con la línea y brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.

Mónica, hoy en día se siente una mujer muy capaz, con más ganas de seguir adelante y hacer realidad sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida, con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos que le ayudo a iniciarse como una mujer empresaria.
texts.en:
Sra. Monica belongs to the El Abiseo community bank. She lives in the Peruvian "departamento" of San Martin. She is married, 28 years old and has two school-aged children.

Monica operates an Internet services business. They--she?--set up her business in her house and she tends her customers there every day. The demand for her services, the only Internet services business in the neighborhood, is high, something that gives Monica great pleasure. She tells us, too, that she had to overcome many challenges to start the business. She started with just two cabins but, seeing the potential for the business, they--she?--expanded the shop which now has 6 PCs. Now that she's a fixture among her customers--her friends, neighbors and regulars--she's hired staff to help with typing services and other work.

With this S/.3,000 [3,000 Peruvian soles] loan, she wants to purchase PC-related equipment because some machines are slow and need to be changed out. Another part of the money will be used to set up a wireless network to avoid problems with the fixed-line system and to provide a better service to her customers.

Monica now believes that she can do anything and she's anxious to get ahead and make her dreams come true. She's very grateful to the Moviemiento Manuela Ramos which has helped establish her as a woman entrepeneur.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy computer equipment for Internet services business.

loans.name: Cham Nap

texts.en:
O. Cham Nap, 29, raises a few pigs and typically earns $3 per day. His wife, Sea Sophea, 27, sells desserts and eggs and has a daily income of $2.50. Together, they have one young child. 

Their family expenses are a bit high since the price of goods and services keeps going up relative to their small amount of income. With the current difficult economic downturn, they are trying their best to generate more income to maintain their moderate standard of living. 

They want to take out a loan of $1000 to buy pigs to raise. Basically, Cham Nap hopes he will be able to build a new house, improve his child’s education, and ensure his family sustainability.

loans.use: To buy more pigs to raise and sell

loans.name: Rorn

texts.en: Rorn S. is forty-nine years old and lives with his forty-eight-year-old wife, Vet Ren. They grow vegetables on their plot of land, from which they earn $2 a day. Vet Ren buys additional vegetables that she sells at the local market in their provincial town, making approximately $5 a day. This provides them with a moderate standard of living and also supports the education of their three children. They would like a loan to buy a motorbike and a trailer to transport large amounts of vegetables to their stand at the market. He hopes that he can expand his business over time, and that he will be able to build a new house and pay for further education for their children.

loans.use: To buy a trailer and motorbike for transporting vegetables to market.

loans.name: Rong

texts.en: Rong R. is thirty-two years old and is a construction worker who earns a daily income of $4. He lives with his two young children and his wife, Chheoun Kosal, who is twenty-nine and an accomplished, experienced seamstress and tailor. To improve their standard of living, Rong has decided to take out a loan to buy more fabric for his wife's business, which will generate a higher daily income for the family. He hopes he will be able to open a tailor shop near the market in his own province. He would also like to build a new modern house, and help his children further their education as teachers. (This picture is of Rong's wife.)

loans.use: To buy more fabric for his wife's tailoring business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen T. is from the town of Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 34 years old. Helen has two school-aged children. To make a living, Helen owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector operating a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruits and vegetables in the local community. 

Helen joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP (US$250) which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be taken out by Helen from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida C. is from the town of Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 44 years old. Leonida is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Leonida owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorcycle transport services to local community members. Leonida also has been engaged in raising pigs. 

Leonida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP (US$225), which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be taken out by Leonida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita L. is from the town of Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 48 years old. Rosita is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosita owns and operates a retail business venture selling meat products. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling frozen meat products. Rosita earns an income of 6,000 Php monthly.

Rosita joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP (US$225), which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be taken out by Rosita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna C. is from the town of Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 43 years old. Lorna is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Lorna owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. 

Lorna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP (US$150), which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This loan will be taken out by Lorna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and working capital

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma S. is from the town of Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 36 years old. Gemma is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma raises livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale. 

Gemma joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP (US$125), which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be taken out by Gemma from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. The loan will be a big help in providing the necessities of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia D. C. is from the town of Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 58 years old. Virginia is married and has three adult children. To make a living, Virginia owns and operates a retail business selling variety of cooked snacks like grilled meat. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from her snack vending.
  
Virginia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Virginia is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP (US$150), which will be used as additional working capital. This loan will be taken out by Virginia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.
