loans.use: For additional working capital

loans.name: Rubilyn

texts.en:
Rubilyn S. is from the town of Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 26 years old. Rubilyn is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Rubilyn owns and operates a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. 

Rubilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rubilyn is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP (US$250), which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be taken out by Rubilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is a 24-year-old mother of two children.  She is married to Jonard, and the couple is working very hard to somehow improve their poor living conditions in the village of San Pablo Alicia, Isabela.  

Her husband manages their rice field while she is busy selling salted eggs or red eggs.  She started this business to help her husband in providing for the needs of their family.  

Due to lack of financial capital, she decided to ask for a loan of PHP 6,000.00 ($125) for her business to grow.  Divina promised to use it wisely and do her best for the success of her business.

loans.use: Business Improvement

loans.name: Antonia

texts.en:
Antonia is requesting a loan from KIVA lenders amounting to PHP15,000 ($325) as her working capital for the maintenance of her hog raising business.  She is 54 years old and single. She is happy with her life and raising her hogs.  

She considers her business a family, a home, a habit and a good livelihood that she hopes to grow in the future for it really helps her in providing for the needs of her parents and assisting her younger sister and brothers with their own families.

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza seeks a loan from Kiva lenders of PHP 6,000.00. This amount will assist her in improving her duck-raising business, which is their source of income. She also sell duck eggs on a retail and wholesale basis. She believes that the business is good and really generates income for her family. She hopes for her business to become progressive and somehow produce more eggs. Her business also provides her children with their school allowance and provides for the daily needs of their family.

Flordeliza said that “patience is the key to success,” and this is what she always keeps in mind.

loans.use: Business improvement

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
“Always seek God’s support for something you want.“ This is a motivational quote from Leonora, who is 39 years old and is married to Orlando P.. They were blessed with four children, Sadiri - 18 years old, college student; Richard Dean - 14 years old, high school; Princess Mae - 9 years old, grade school; and Princess Bea - 2 years old. The family resides in Barangay San Pablo, in Alicia, Isabela, Philippines. It is a peaceful village where farming is the major source of income of most of the residents in the area.

Leonora has been a vegetable vendor in their village for 14 years. At present, she would like to borrow PHP 8,000.00 to use as additional capital for her business. Leonora plans to open a store with the extra income. In addition to selling vegetables, she also raises hogs. She hopes that someday, through her hard work and patience, she may continue to send her children to college, and that they may able to overcome the difficulties in life.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Muon

texts.en:
Muon Y. was born in 1984 and is a resident of Siem Reap province. She has been married for a long time but has no children. She grows vegetables on farmland that she inherited from her grandparents. To help supply the family with more food, her husband works as a local construction worker.

Muon Y. will use the loan money to purchase a plot of land near her house in order to grow other types of crops. The loan will help the family to attain a better standard of living and provide them a new fixed asset.

loans.use: To purchase a plot of land

loans.name: Aval

texts.en:
K. Aval is 46 years old. He is married and has four children. After getting married, he arduously dedicated himself to the livestock business. When he recognized the need to invest in his work, Aval decided to construct a place to start an animal breeding business. He started only with one cow, but now he has two cows and three sheep.

Now, Aval wants to expand his business and to buy two cows. Trustingly, he has sought a loan from IMON, believing that his loan request will be granted, and he will be able to move forward in his work. Your support will really help to Aval and his family to get ahead.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase young cattle

loans.name: Hem

texts.en:
Mr. Hem P. is 54 years old and is a good father to his three children. All three of his children are single and enrolled in the local public school. He makes a daily income of $4.00 each day by selling firewood. He usually goes to a place full of wood pieces, although it is located far from his house, and collects and sells the wood. His wife, Mrs. Vaiy, sells a few grocery items from their home.

Hem P. is applying for a loan to purchase an ox, which he will use to transport the firewood, allowing him to sell it more efficiently.

loans.use: To purchase an ox

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna has been operating a general store and a hog-raising business for many years. She is hoping that her request for a loan of PHP 15,000 will be granted so she can buy more inventory for her store. The income from her business greatly assists her in providing education for her children. She hopes that all her businesses will become sustainable in the future, so the family can have a progressive and comfortable way of life. She works hard so that she can help her husband to meet the needs of their family.

Myrna is married to Virgilio Villanueva. They were blessed with seven children. Four of her children are already married. Two of the children work in a factory. Her youngest child is 13 years old and still studying. Her family lives in the agricultural community of San Pablo Alicia, in Isabela, Philippinwa. She is thankful for her happy family and disciplined children.

loans.use: To buy more inventory for her store

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is 52 years old and married to Wilfredo Dacanayan. They have four children; the eldest child, Fredelita, is 33 years old, married and presently working as a domestic helper abroad. Aida’s second child is Wilson, 32 years old; her third is Elizabeth, 23 years old and the youngest among them is Mayflor, 21 years old. According to Aida, none of her children were able to pursue their studies in college because of a lack of financial support. 

Aida is engaged in the vegetable vending business. She sells a variety of vegetables in their village and from this business she is able to generate an income of  PHP 1,000 weekly. She wants a loan for she believes that it will be of great benefit to her business. She requests a loan of PHP 8,000 to be used as additional working capital for her business. Aida believes that time is gold so she is working very hard in order to become successful.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is 37 years old and lives in Barangay Minallo, Naguillan, Isabela. She is a housewife married to Nelson P., who is 40 years old and works part time as a carpenter and farmer. They have three children who are all still in school. Violeta is 21 years old and a high school graduate; Russel is 13 years old and a high school student; and Rochelle is 8 years old and attends elementary student. According to Amelia, her family is happy and she is thankful that she was blessed with a family full of love and respect.

Amelia has a business selling vegetables and rice. She is requesting a loan for PHP 8,000. She is longing to expand her business to have enough products to sell and increase her daily income. She hopes to continue to send her children to school through college so that they may have better job opportunities in the future.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 22 years old and a resident of Barangay Minallo Naguillian, Isabela. She is married to Richard P. and they are blessed with a young daughter, Andrei Lhei P., who is 3 years old. Bernadeth is very happy to have her child and is doing her best to give her a better future.

Bernadeth’s primary business activity is hog raising. She is requesting to avail of a second loan of at least PHP 7,000 to have additional working capital for the maintenance and growth of her business. She will utilize part of the loan to purchase additional piglets to further increase her income. Her first loan was a great help to her and she is hoping to avail of another loan from lenders to continue her success. She hopes that she can send her only child to school someday by saving more money from her income.

loans.use: Additional Capital

loans.name: Kreum

texts.en: Kreum O., 46, lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She earns a living by selling groceries from her house, including items such as cooked foods and sweets for kids. She has worked in this field for a long time. Kreum O. is married and has two children, both of whom are single and work in a nearby hotel. Her husband, Roun, 47, sells vegetables in the local market. The family is having transportation problems because they have to spend a lot of money on taxis. To reduce their transportation costs, Kreum O. is seeking a loan of $1,200 to buy a new motorcycle, which they will use to make their businesses run more efficiently.

loans.use: To buy a new motorcycle

loans.name: Nou

texts.en: Nou S. is 38 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She earns a living by raising pigs in a stall behind her house. She sells the pigs six months after she begins raising them, and can raise at least two pigs per year. Nou S. has run this business since 2007, and is currently earning $4 a day. She is married with one child, a teenager, who is in school. Her husband, Mr. Sry Ny, 36, owns a rice-milling machine and earns his income by selling hulled rice. The family's living conditions are poor because their house is old and small. That is why Nou S. is applying for a loan, which she will add to her personal savings, to begin building a new house.

loans.use: To begin building a new and larger house.

loans.name: Mukaddam

texts.ru: Мукдам Исобоева 1971 года рождения , замужем имеет 4 детей.  Окончила 9 классов , родители  были против того что бы она училась в университете. Через некоторое время вышла замуж. Семья росла, она вынуждена была выйти на рынок.  В Микроинвест обратилась из-за не хватки собственных средств на  расширение бизнеса. Торгует на рынке детской одеждой около 7 лет. Она планирует расширить свой ассортимент товара.
texts.en:
Mukaddam I. was born in 1971; she is married and has 4 children. She finished 9 grades; her parents were opposed to her studying at university. After some time she got married. Her family grew and she was forced to go to work at the market. Mukaddam turned to MicroInvest because she did not have enough personal resources to expand her business. She has been selling children’s clothing at the market for about 7 years. She plans to expand her product assortment.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase product assortment

loans.name: Marice

texts.en: Marice P. owns a small grocery store in Cabacungan, Claveria Misamis Oriental. She is married and lives happily with her husband and two children. Her husband makes a living driving a motorcycle. Marice believes that she does not have enough money to support her children, and has decided to begin growing cassava on her family's land to increase her income. She needs financial help to start this business, and has applied for a loan from Kiva partner HSPFI to make this possible. She has already taken out and successfully repaid two loans from our organization, and wants us to mention how helpful it would be to secure this third loan.

loans.use: To establish a cassava farm and incease the inventory of a grocery store

loans.name: Sras

texts.en: Sras R. is 50 years old and lives in Siem Reap Province, where she has owned a plot of land for many years. She grows many types of crops on this land, in two harvests a year. Sras is a widow with three children, all of whom are students who help on the farm as time permits. One her sons, Mao, 22, also works in construction. Sras R. works hard at her business every day, and never wastes time because she knows that earning enough income is the key to giving her children a higher education. She is applying for this loan to support her farm during the upcoming rice-growing season.

loans.use: To support a farming business during the upcoming rice-growing season

loans.name: Nurhon

texts.ru: Эргашева Нурхон-женщина 30 лет. Нурхон замужем мать 2-х детей. Нурхон занимается продажей пряжи и шерстенных носков. Нурхон закупает товары у оптовых поставщиков и реализует на рынках Аппон, Ошоба, Мархамат Аштского района. Нурхон хочет получит займ для того что бы расширить свой оборот если. Нурхон с мужем также имеют большой сад они посеяли помидоры и когда поспеют, они  продаст их. Нурхон впервые получает, займи она надеется что получит хорошую прибыль и улучшат материальное состояние семьи.
texts.en:
Nurhon E. is a 30 year old woman. Nurhon is married and is the mother of 2 children. Nurhon sells yearn and wool socks. Nurhon purchases her products from wholesale suppliers and sells them at the Appon, Oshoba, and Marhamat markets in the Asht region. Nurhon would like to take out a loan in order to increase her turnover. Nurhon and her husband also have a big garden where they have planted tomatoes and when they will ripen they will sell them. Nurhon is taking out a loan for the first time. She hopes that she will earn good profits and will improve the living conditions of her family.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of yarn and socks

loans.name: Malang Group

texts.en: Malang is the leader of the three-member Malang group. Each of them wants to receive a loan for advancing their business, and have requested a group loan. Malang wants to take out a loan for his general store, Halema wants to take out a loan for her tailoring business, and Habibullah wants to take out a loan for his business of selling fresh fruit.

loans.use: To expand and improve their businesses

loans.name: Von's Group

texts.en:
This loan will go to a group of three women who live in Siem Reap Provence, Cambodia. Mrs. Von S., who is 23 years old, has been chosen as group leader by the other members. She earns a living growng many kinds of crops on her farm in the village. She learned farming from her grandparents, and has worked in this business for many years. Her husband, Mr. Koun, 25, works in construction. The young couple has been married for years and plans to have a child next year. Von S. is applying for this loan to buy a used motorbike to make it easier to meet the family's transportation needs. 

The other two borrowers are Naing N., a local farmer, who needs to buy fertilizer to grow her crops, and Kao S., who makes a living growing vegetables and wants to buy a used motorbike to help meet her family's transportation needs.

loans.use: To buy two used motorbikes and fertilizer

loans.name: Rasuljon

texts.ru: Ахмедов Расулжон- мужчина 31 лет. Расулжон женат, имеет одного ребёнка. Расулжон занимается торговлей скота. Расулжон закупает и перепродает скот на рынках Аппон, Булок и Жигда. Расулжон  работает  колхозником. У Расулжона также имеют знакомые мясники, которые покупает у него скот. Каждый год он со своей семьей выходит на сбор хлопка, и получают деньги за свой труд, который является дополнительным и сезонным доходом для семейного бюджета.
texts.en:
Rasuljon A. is a 31 year old man. Rasuljon is married; he has one child. Rasuljon trades livestock. Rasuljon purchases and resells livestock at the Appon, Bulok and Zhigda markets. Rasuljon works as a collective farmer. Rasuljon is also acquainted with butchers who purchase livestock from him. Every year together with his family he goes out to harvest cotton, they earn money for their labor which provides supplementary and seasonal income for the family budget.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock sales

loans.name: Alikul

texts.ru: Аликул Сафаров живет в районе Абдурахмони Чоми. Возраст 52 года. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Образование среднее. Аликул занимается услугой такси более 25 лет. Этот вид бизнеса является одним из источников дохода. Кроме этого двое сыновей работают в России, они также помогают семье. Клиент хочет взять у нас кредит, чтобы отремонтировать свою машину.
texts.en:
Alikul S. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 52 years old, married and has six children. He has secondary education. Alikul has been providing taxi services for more than 25 years. This business is one of the sources of income. Besides that two of his sons work in Russia and also help the family. He want to take out a loan to repair his car.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To repair the car

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Khudoykul

texts.ru:
Худойкул Исмоилов  1960 года рождения. Занимается животноводством 15 лет. Дома имее 8 голов крупнорогатого скота. В откорме скота Худойкулу помогают его сыновья Назир и Насим.
Жена Худойкула и его 3 дочерей перерабатывают молоко полученное от дойной коровы. Даже самая младшая дочка Худойкула, которой исполнилось 6 лет, уже умеет доить корову, и без страха подходит к ней.
 Наш клиент просит сумму в размере 1500 сомони сроком на 6 меясцев, так как хочет купить баранов.
 Дополнительный доход в его семью приносит занятие нашего клиента сельским хозяйством. Он выращивает кукурузу.
texts.en:
Khudoykul I. was born in 1960. He has been in the animal husbandry for fifteen years. He has eight heads of large cattle. Khudoykul's sons Nazir and Nasim are helping him in feeding of the cattle. Khudoykul's wife and his three daughters process milk from the milk cow. Even his youngest daughter who just turned six already can milk a cow and approaches it without fear. Our client is asking for a loan for 1500 somoni (US$375) and wants to buy sheep. Khudoykul's family has additional income from his agriculture business, he grows corn.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Mavzuna

texts.ru: Мавзуна - женщина 34 лет, учительница в политехническом институте по предмету модельера. Её заработная плата маленькая , не хватает на жизнь.Поэтому она занимается откормом и продажей скота.У неё трое детей, которые учатся в старших классах средней школы.Мавзуна на сегодня имеет шесть коров,которые дают в день по семь литров молока.Мавзуна договорившись с мороженым цехом оптом сдаёт им своё коровье, домашнее молоко.Мавзуна кредитуется уже второй год.Благодаря кредитам у Мавзуны постоянно обменивается скот и она имеет хороший дополнительный доход с продажи скота.
texts.en:
Mavzuna is a 34 year old woman, she is a professor of fashion design in a polytechnic college. Her salary is very small and is not enough for her life. This is why she feeds and sells cattle. She has three children who study in high school. At this time Mavzuna has six cows, which give seven liters of milk a day. Mavzuna has an agreement with an ice cream factory and sells the milk to them in wholesale. Mavzuna has been taking out loans for the second year. Thanks to the loans Mavzuna's cattle is regularly renewed and she has a good additional income from the sales.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For feeding and sales of cattle

loans.name: Kumri

texts.ru: Шамсиева Кумри- женщина 43 лет ,замужем, имеет четверых детей. Она занимается шитьём постельного белья и национальных платьев с национальной вышивкой. У неё  свои постоянные клиенты, которые с дома покупают у неё и с наценкой перепродают на рынке. Для увеличения своего бизнеса, Мавзуна решила получить кредит. Она хочет закупить ткань для пошива постельных комплектов.Мавзуна шьёт на дому, на снимке Мавзуна за работой шьёт платье.
texts.en:
Kumri S. is 43 years old, married and has four children. She is involved in sewing of bedding goods and traditional embroidered dresses. She has long-term loyal clients who buy her products and then resell them at a market. Kumri decided to obtain this loan in order to increase her business. She wants to purchase fabric for making bedding sets. Kumri sews at home. The picture shows her at work, making a dress.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fabric purchase

loans.name: Turdimat

texts.ru: Абдуллоев Турдимат- мужчина 54 лет. Турдимат женат отец 5-х детей. Турдимат занимается купле продажей скота. Его жена занимается переработкой пряжи. Также у Турдимат также работает колхозником  в фермерском хозяйстве. Турдимат имеет достачно большой опыт работы в сфере   скотоводства.  Скот он продает на рынках Аппон и Булок Аштского района. Сейчас у его жены только одна дойная корова. Турдимат планирует купить для своей жены еще одну дойную корову с теленком, и он благодарен нашим кредиторам за помощь в осуществлении его планов
texts.en:
Turdimat A. is 54 years old, married and has five children. He is involved in livestock sales. His wife is involved in yarn processing. Turdimat also works as a farmer at a local farm. He has a fairly long experience in the livestock field. He sells livestock at the Appon and Bulok market in the Asht district. His wife currently owns only one dairy cow. Turdimat plans to purchase an additional dairy cow with a calf for his wife. He is grateful to our creditors for the help in achieving his goals.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow with a calf

loans.name: Emomiddin

texts.ru: Тошев Эмомиддин в возрасте 54 года, живет в районе Абдурахмони Чоми. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Эмомиддин, услугой такси занимается более 20 лет. Клиент хочет взять кредит, чтобы отремонтировать автомашину. Трое сыновей также работают и помогают семье.
texts.en:
Emomiddin T. is 54 years old; he lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is married and has 5 children. Emomiddin has been providing taxi services for more than 20 years. The client would like to get credit in order to repair his car. Three of his sons also work and help the family.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase auto parts

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To advance their businesses

loans.name: Shoyra

texts.ru: Усмонова Шоира кредитор в Микроинвест с 2005 года. Она торгует на рынке Паншанбе. Детской обувью и одеждой.За четыре года кредитования у Шоиры улучшилось семейное положение и увеличился товарооборот. Раньше она ездила за товаром в Истаравшан, а на сегодняшний день  она способна ездить раз в месяц в Бишкек. В Бишкеке очень большой выбор хорошего качественного товара. Товар с Бишкека пользуется большим спросом.Шоира благодарит инвесторов , за то что она смогла твёрдо поставить на ноги свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Shoyra U. has been a MicroInvest client since 2005. Shoyra sells shoes and clothing for children at a local market. Over the four years of working with MicroInvest, Shoyra's business grew and her family's quality of life improved. In the past, Shoyra had to travel to Istaravshan to purchase her goods, but today, she goes to Bishkek once a month. In Bishkek, the selection and quality of goods is better, and the goods brought from Bishkek are in greater demand. Shoyra thanks Kiva investors for helping to build a solid foundation for her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing for children

loans.name: Abdujalil

texts.ru: Абдучалил Кароматов живет в районе Вахш. Возраст 31 год. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Абдучалил занимается земледелием. Этим видом деятельности он занимается более 10 лет. Это является главным источником дохода, для содержании семьи. Клиент хочет взять у нас кредит, чтобы купить семена пшеницы и подсолнуха. После благоприятного посева, собрать и продать. А на полученные деньги купить еще семян.
texts.en:
Abdujalil K. lives in the Vakhsh region. He is 31 years old. He is married and has 3 children. Abdujalil works in agriculture. He has been in this business for more than 10 years. This is his main source of income for supporting his family. The client would like to get a loan from us in order to purchase seeds for wheat and sunflowers. After a good planting he will collect the harvest and sell it. He will use the received money to purchase more seeds.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds

loans.name: Betania Iv-A Group

texts.en:
Yustinus T. leads a group of 10 people which is named Betania IV-A. He is aged 44 years and married to Naema T., a 40-year-old lady. Both Yustinus and Naema have been living in Nekmese Village for years, since they were children. This village is situated 55 km from Kupang City, and it takes about two and a half hours' ride to get into the village from Kupang City. The road to this village is bumpy and hasn’t been asphalted yet. Most of the community in this village relies on the agricultural sector to generate money to support their lives, including Yustinus and the group members of Betania IV-A.

In Nekmese Village, Yustinus finances his family by farming. His marriage has been blessed with 2 children, aged 9 to 14 years; they are Bifeni and Yosafat. As a farmer, Yustinus is only able to generate income in a small amount. The income is unstable, depending on the season and crops. To generate money, Yustinus usually sells bananas and areca nut in the market. His wife also helps him to generate money by selling vegetables. The hardship that Yustinus faces in financing his family motivates him to find another alternative to support his family life. This is the reason why Yustinus is intereseted in joining TLM Cattle Fattening Program.

Yustinus is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 3,200,000 from TLM to buy cattle to be fattened over a 12 month period. The other members of this group are also requesting loans to buy cattle to be fattened. They hope that the cattle fattening program will help them in improving their lives.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Honorata

texts.en:
Honorata is 39 years old and is married to Mario S., who is a humble farmer in the peaceful village of Magsaysay Naguillan, Isabela. The couple is blessed with four children. Three of them are already studying in high school, while her youngest is four years old and is not yet attending school.

Honorata further believes that patience and hard work mean a lot in reaching for success. She sells vegetables from their small farm at a local market. When they are not harvesting, or their crops are not sufficient for their sales, she also purchases other vegetables wholesale to sell along with her own goods. Currently, she sells vegetables three days a week as that is the only time that there are tricycles to rent, which is how she gets to the market. She is requesting to avail of a loan amounting to PHP 9,000 to expand her business. She hopes to be able to use any increase in profits to expand the education of her children.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Betania Iv-B Group

texts.en:
Betania IV-B is a group of 10 farmers living in Nekmese Village, Kupang District of East Nusa Tenggara Province. This group is led by Margen R., a 43 year old man. He is married to Sarci R. and has 4 children. The children are: Erwin, who is 12 years old and in the 6th grade of elementary school; Yatni, who is 10 years old and in the 4th grade of Elementary School; Apreli, who is 8 years old and in the 2nd grade of Elementary School and Yimri, who is 5 years old and in Kindergarten. Margen works as a farmer to meet his family's needs and his children's education needs. His wife helps him to generate money by selling coconut oil in the market. His income is unstable. Sometimes he is able to generate money in a big amount, but sometimes he is only able to generate money in a small amount. Supporting 4 children at school with an unstable income is not easy for Margen and his wife. They can only eat rice with salt without any side dish when the income generated is small. Margen works hard to generate as much income as possible to meet his family needs and his children's education needs. Margen then had an idea to fatten a cow, but the problem is he doesn’t have any capital to buy cattle. That is why he requesting loan amounting to IDR 3,300,000 to buy cattle to be fattened. 
The same as Margen, the other group members also want to improve their lives and they are requesting a loan from TLM to buy cattle to fatten over 12 months. 

Note: James and Melkianus were replaced by their family members in the group picture.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Fret's Group

texts.en:
Oliftataf 44-A is a group of 8 people in Riumata Village, Kupang District of East Nusa Tenggara Province. Riumata Village is situated 36km from Kupang City. The land in Riumata Village is quite fertile and many banana and coconut trees grow in this area. Most of the community members living in this area lean upon the agricultural sector to support their lives. 

Oliftataf 44-A is led by Fret P., a 46 year old man. Fret is married and has 4 children. The children are: Mayesti, who is 19 years old and studies at the university in Jakarta (supported by Fret’s relative); Randy, who is 13 years old and in the 1st year of Junior High School; Desy, who is 9 years old and in the 4th grade of Elementary School and Tomy, who is 7 years old and in the 1st grade of Elementary School.  

Fret has a background as a poor farmer who usually sells his crops (bananas, coconuts and areca nuts) to meet his family's needs and to finance his children's education. His wife always helps him in supporting their family. Working as a farmer is challenging work. The main challenge for Fret and many other farmers in this area is the low price offered for the crops that they sell. As a result, he is only able to generate a small income from his crops. It is not easy for Fret, because he has to finance the education of three of his children. This situation and a hope for a better future for his children motivate Fret to find a way to increase his income. He then heard about the TLM Cattle Fattening Program and became interested in joining the program.

Together with 7 other farmers in Riumata Village, they formed a group to apply for a loan from TLM. Fret is requesting a loan amounting to IDR 3,500,000 to buy cattle to be fattened over a 12 month period. He hopes that this loan will help him improve his living standard. The other group members also have the same dream as Fret, which is to have a better life.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 44 years old and a resident of Barangay Minallo, Naguillan, Isabela. She is married to Ferdinand P. and blessed with five children. Her two youngest children are still studying in high school and elementary school. She hopes that someday she will be able to send them to college to earn degrees for their future.

Josephine sells AVON and Cooler Life products in her village. She is requesting her second loan for PHP 18,000 to use as additional working capital. She earns her income through commission. She wants to improve her current 25% commission to 30% by purchasing more products from the companies. She hopes to use the extra income to pay for her children to acquire a higher level of education.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Oliftataf 44-B Group

texts.en:
Yerdi P. is 32 years old. He leads a group of eight farmers called Oliftataf 44-B in Riumata Village in the Kupang District of the East Nusa Tenggara Province. Just like many other communities living in rural areas, the community of Riumata Village also relies on agriculture for income to fulfill each family's needs.

Yerdi is married with two children. Ari is seven years old and attending the first grade of elementary school, and Natalia is five years old and in Kindergarten. To earn money, Yerdi usually sells his crops in the traditional markets. The nearest market is about 20 minutes drive from his village. The road in Riumata Village is bumpy with many holes and it's hard for public transportation to serve in this area in the rainy season.

Even though he has worked hard, Yerdi feels that his income is not enough to fulfill his family needs, and it is usually unstable. He really wants to provide nutritious food to his children because they are in a growth period and need adequate nutrition. He dreams of sending his children to the university so they will have a bright future. Not many children in this area are able to have a better education because of their parents' economic difficulties.

This situation drives Yerdi to increase his income with another business by joining the TLM Cattle Fattening Program. By joining the program, he will be able to earn a profit from selling fattened cattle. Yerdi is requesting a loan from TLM for IDR 3,400,000 to buy cattle to be fattened in 12 months. The other members of Oliftataf 44-B are also requesting loans to buy cattle to be fattened.

Note: Yunus A. and Anderias P. were replaced by their family members in the group picture.

loans.use: To buy cattle to be fattened.

loans.name: Marievic

texts.en:
Marivic D. is 32 years old and resides in Hinaplanan, Claveria, Cagayan de Oro City. She has four children, four of whom go to school. Her husband is a farmer, primarily of corn and cassava. Because farming is seasonal, they need a permanent source of income. Marivic started a variety store that caters to the needs of her village. Her store is in full demand of all the people in their village and she manages to procure items three times a week. In this way, Marivic is a big help to her husband in raising their family well.

Marivic wants to avail herself of the assistance offered by HSPFI, a Kiva partner that supports small entrepreneurs all over the world. Marivic is looking forward to making more improvements to her business.

loans.use: To increase her inventory.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz is a vegetable vendor in the village of Minallo, Naguillan, Isabela. She is 43 years old and is married to Charlie R.. The couple is blessed with three children. Cherry is 21 years old and a high school graduate; Laila is 18 years old and working as a restaurant server in Manila; and their youngest child Charlie R. Jr. is 13 years old attending high school student.

Luz is requesting a loan through ASKI for PHP 12,000 to use in her vending business. She earns around PHP 300 in net income each week, which helps cover the family's basic daily commodities. Luz is grateful that she is able to help her husband provide for their important needs, especially in giving financial support towards the studies of her youngest child. She hopes that the loan will pave the way to a progressive business that enables her to continue sending her child to school through college. Aside from that, Luz also dreams of having their house renovated someday and is working very hard for the attainment of all her life dreams.

loans.use: To expand her vegetable vending business.

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Мавлуда Иброхимова живет в районе Абдурахмони Чоми. Вдова, имеет 2 детей. Возраст 38 лет. Этим видом деятельности занимался муж, но после его смерти Мавлуда взяла все в свои руки. Этот вид бизнеса является основным доходом семьи и он существует более 10 лет. Клиентка хочет взять кредит, чтобы отремонтировать хлебопекарню.
texts.en:
Mavluda I. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. She is a widow and has 2 children. She is 38 years old. This occupation was her husband’s, but after his death Mavluda took everything into her own hands. This business is the main source of income for the family and it has existed for more than 10 years. The client would like to take out a loan in order to repair the bread bakery.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair bakery

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying seeds and some necessary things for his land

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is 31 years old and resides with her family in Minallo, Naguillan, Isabela. She is married to Allan B., a carpenter, who is also 31 years old. They already have a child named Alain Bless, who is three years old.

Maribel is engaged in a livestock business to earn income for their daily needs since her husband has no permanent work as a carpenter. And to further earn income daily, Maribel also sometimes sells vegetables in their village since hog raising does not generate income daily. She even goes to the city market of Cauayan City just to buy vegetables at a cheaper price to retail in their villages.

She is hoping to obtain a loan of PHP 8,000 as additional working capital for both of her businesses. She hopes to save some of her extra income so she can pay for the future schooling of her child and future children. Furthermore, Maribel shared that she believes in the saying that states “time is gold”, which is similar to “time is of the essence”, thus giving the importance of what she can do now while she is still strong and able.

loans.use: To use as working capital

loans.name: Mahmudchon

texts.ru:
Махмудчон Хакимов работает охранником в городской библиотеке. Но на зарплату охранника в нашей стране не прожить, поэтому он уже три года занимается микропредпринимательской деятельностью, в чем помогает ему жена Фируза. 
 Они торгуют на вещевом рынке, и в ассортимент их товара входят носки и колготки.
 У Махмудчона с Фирузой  двое детей, которых надо растить,  а для того чтобы увеличить прибыль получаемую от продажи носков и колготок, им необходимо увеличить свой товарооборот. С этой целью они запрашивают сумму в размере 1600 сомони сроком на 4 месяца.
texts.en:
Mahmudchon K. works as a security guard at a local library, but his pay is not enough to meet the needs of his family. Therefore, for three years now, Mahmudchon, with the help of his wife Firuza, has been selling socks and pantyhose at a local flee market. Mahmudchon and Firuza have two children and to make the ends meet, Mahmudchon and Firuza must expand their business. They ask for a 4-month loan of $400 (1600 TJS).

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Leela Group

texts.en: Leela is the leader of the four-member Leela group. Each member wants to take out a loan for their own business. Leela wants a loan for her tailoring business, M. Naseer wants a loan for his business of selling fruits and vegetables, Gul S. wants a loan for the business of quilt-making, and M. S. wants a loan for his general store. They are all very thankful to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For developing their businesses.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 52 years old and is married to Armando T.. They live in the village of Minallo Naguillan, Isabela. They are blessed with 4 children who have all graduated from high school. None of them pursued studies in college because they could not afford the cost.

Marilyn has been selling vegetables for many years. Since she does not have enough capital to grow her business on her own, Marilyn is asking for the support of ASKI. She wants to borrow PHP 7,000 to help expand her business. She also admits that her weekly income from her vending is not enough to support her family's needs and she is hoping to increase her capital to generate an income that can fully support her family.

loans.use: Business Expansion

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is 30 years old and is married to Freddie M., who has been encouraging her to further develop her business. The couple resides in the village of Minallo, Naguillan, Isabela. They have three children. Freddie Mar, 11 years old, and Jesus, 7 years old, are both studying in the primary school. The youngest is Princess who just turned 2 years old. Marivic hopes that her children remain healthy and become successful in their chosen careers.

Marivic operates a “sari-sari” store, a common term for a typical village store business. She is requesting to borrow PHP 20,000 for the development of her store that she has been running for three years. According to her, she will double her patience and diligence to be able to achieve her goals in life. She wants to provide a good future to her three children by sending them to school until they finish their studies. This way, they will have a better chance to improve their own lives someday.

loans.use: Business development

loans.name: Leonila

texts.en:
Leonila S. is 54 years old. She has four children, three of them are married already and the other one is solely dependent on her. Her husband is a cassava farmer.

Leonila is known in their place as a reflexologist or locally known as a masahista. She provides body massage and all related services. This provides Leonila with another source of income. She's been with this kind of work for several years already, but she needed to look for another, more permanent way to gain money.

Leonila, joined the loan assistance program offered by HSPFI and decided to have a mini grocery store. The money will be used by her to buy items for her store. Leonila is looking forward for such a good opportunity. She is hoping for the improvement of her business.

loans.use: To purchase addtional items for her variety store

loans.name: Parmon

texts.en: D. Parmon is 53 years old. He is married and has six children. Parmon is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children, who today are working adults thanks to his example. Parmon is a manufacturer. With the help of his son (pictured), he produces wooden doors and window frames. His workshop is located in his house. Working in this business for 39 years, Parmon became a rather experienced master and now he has apprentices. By producing goods of good quality at acceptable prices, Parmon has many customers. He sells the doors and window frames from his house. At the same time there is a trading place located in the local market. In general, Parmon’s business is very successful and generates stable incomes for the family. Now Parmon is planning to purchase the additional equipment required for expansion of his business. With this purpose in mind he requests $3000 for the term of 12 months. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase additional equipment required for expansion of his business

loans.name: Bahtiyor

texts.ru: Файзуллаев Бахтиер живет в районе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 23 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Бахтиер имеет магазин у себя дома и занимается продажей продуктов питания. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 5 лет. Клиент хочет получить у нас кредит и пополнить свой ассортимент. На полученный доход, хочеть увеличить свой оборот.
texts.en:
Bahtiyor F. lives in the Khuroson region. He is 23 years old. He is married and has 3 children. Bahtiyor has a store in his home and sells food items. He has been in this business for more than 5 years. The client would like to get credit from us in order to increase his product assortment. He will use the received income to increase his turnover.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase assortment

loans.name: Washma Group

texts.en: Washma is the leader of the four-member Washma group. They want to expand their businesses and are requesting a group loan. Washma wants a loan for her tailoring business, Pakhma wants a loan for an embroidery business, Muhammad Aliam wants a loan for the business of selling fruits and vegetables, and Shawaer wants a loan for the business of selling wood. They greatly appreciate this loan process.

loans.use: To build up their businesses

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.en: F. Khurshed is 28 years old and is married with three children. Khurshed sells confectionery and other foodstuffs in the market and has been in this business already for two years. This activity generate the main income for his family. Since Khurshed is very popular in the market selling the fresh and tasty products, he tries to maintain a wide range of goods. Thus, today Khurshed requests $2,600 for the term of 12 months to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. The loan will greatly improve his income and his family's living standards. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more confectionary to sell

loans.name: Sam's Group

texts.en:
The man in the picture above is Mr. Sam C.. He is 32 years old and has been selected as the group leader by the other four women in the group loan. Sam C. generates his daily income by driving a motor taxi, and earns around $2 per day. He uses the profit to manage his family's daily expenses. He is married with two teenage children, who are enrolled in the local school. His wife is a staff member at a restaurant in Siem Reap province. He has been trying to build his house since past few months, but the construction has been halted due to lack of money. Therefore, Sam C. has decided to seek a loan to complete his house construction. 

There are other four borrowers in the group loan: Mrs. P. is a grocery seller seeking a loan to buy more items to sell. Mrs. P. is a fish catcher who is asking a loan to purchase more tools for fishing. Mrs. E. is applying for a loan to expand her grocery item selling business. Mrs. L. is involved in fishing at Tunle Sap Lake; she requests a loan to buy a boat for fishing. All the borrowers live in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia.

loans.use: To complete house construction

loans.name: Vorona

texts.en: V. Vorona is 45 years old and currently resides at Mulberry, Hinaplanan, Claveria, Misamis Oriental. She has three children: one is employed and two attend school. Her husband is into Cassava farming. To support her husband financially, V. is involved in fruit vending business and has a fruit stall at her residence. At times she peddles around the village and nearby towns to sell fruits. She has her loyal customers, who sometimes call her to place their orders. V. then delivers to them. V. reckons that to cater to all orders of her customers, she needs to have more stock and, to realize that, she needs additional money to procure additional fruits. V. avails the loan program of HSPFI, a KIVA partner. She is optimistic that she would be able to use the loan to expand her fruit vending business.

loans.use: To procure additional fruits for her fruit vending business

loans.name: Prescilla

texts.en: Prescilla C. is a resident of Hinaplanon, Claveria, Misamis Oriental, in Southern Philippines. She has five children. She and her husband work as fish vendors; they use their motor vehicle to peddle fishes to nearby villages. They also have a small stall in Claveria public market for their established consumers. They desire to expand their existing business to earn more profit. Prescilla is hence availing a loan of PHP 6,000 with a repayment term of five months.

loans.use: additional capital for fish selling business

loans.name: Ruziboy

texts.ru:
Рузибой Файзоев  занимается сельским хозяйством , выращивает пшеницу на арендованной земле.  Выращенный урожай продает мельникам. Сельским хозяйством Рузибой занимается уже около 6 лет. В этой сфере деятельности ему помогает отец Анорбой.
  Дополнительный семейный доход в семью приносит мастерство Рузибоя, он опытный столяр. Изготавливает предметы, полезные в  домашнем хозяйстве.
  Для  выращивания пшеницы запрашивает сумму в размере 1300 сомони.
  Рузибой женат, и имеет 3 детей.
texts.en:
Ruziboy F. grows wheat on a rented parcel of land. He sells the wheat he gathers to local mills. Ruziboy has been growing wheat for 6 years with the help of his father Anorboy. Ruziboy earns an additional income working as a carpenter. He makes a variety of useful household items. To sustain his wheat farming business, Ruziboy needs a loan of $325 (1300 TJS). Ruziboy is married and has 3 children.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: wheat farming

loans.name: Abdugafur

texts.en: M. Abdugafur is 44 years old. He is married and has a son. Abdugafur sells toys for children. He rents a place for selling which is located in one of the local markets. He has been running his own small business for 15 years. Having only a couple competitors in the market he is doing well with his business. Abdugafur always dreamed of owning his own small store and not having to depend on anyone else. He believes that someday his dream will come true and he will open his own store. Today he is requesting 6500 Somoni for the term of 9 months for purchasing new toys to increase his range of goods. Abdugafur thanks everyone for supporting him and promises to be accurate with the loan repayment. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase more toys to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en:
Cecelia G. is the mother of four children, three of whom are in school. The family is living at Purok 1-B Del Carmen Iligan City.

At present, Cecelia’s only source of income is her fruit business but she has financial difficulties over the educational expenses of their children. But she is motivated to work for the betterment of their daily living. She want to expand her business through additional capital with a loan from HSPFI in the amount of PHP 5,000. This could be a good start for her to reach her ambition to have a fruit stand in their nearby villages.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit for her business

location.town: Purok 1-B, Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Nort

loans.name: Salomat

texts.en: S. Salomat is 45 years old. She is married and has four children. Salomat runns a cafe where she provides the meals of the national cuisine. She’s renting the catering room which is located in the central local market which allows Salomat to have many clients, the majority of which are those making purchases in the market. Every day she purchases the latest foodstuffs and cooks delicious dishes. Her daughter helps her with the business. Now Salomat is asking for a loan $1300 for the term of 12 months that will be used to buy a refrigerator and more foodstuffs. Salomat thanks all those supporting her and promises to repay the loan promptly. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and more foodstuffs

loans.name: Makhfurat

texts.en: Makhfurat is a hard-working person and, over many years, this has allowed her to earn enough income to support her five children alone. Together with her husband (pictured), Makhfurat is devoted to the raising of animals, especially cows which she buys and sells in her local market. In this manner, she obtains the income that she needs. In order to increase her income and revitalize her business, Makhfurat is requesting a loan of 4300 Somoni for the term of 6 months for purchasing young cattle. This purchase will enable her to increase her sales, to earn more, and to meet the needs of her children. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle in order to expand the business

loans.name: Lateafa Group

texts.en: Lateafa is the leader of the four-member Lateafa group, and they want take out a group loan. Lateafa wants a loan for her brother who sells curtains, M. Farhad wants a loan for his general store, Baras wants a loan for his shop where he sells slippers, and Raksar wants a loan for her embroidery business. They are all thankful for this loan process.

loans.use: For the progress of their businesses

loans.name: Abdukahhor

texts.en: K. Abdukahhor is from Kanibadam, Tajikistan. Currently, he dedicates himself to his livestock business together with his wife (pictured), a popular enterprise that is characteristic of the region. He is the father of four children who he cares for and has the responsibility of educating. It’s important to note that Abdukahhor is very conscious of his duty to support his family financially. It’s for this reason that he turned to IMON International to obtain a loan to purchase some pregnant cows to help him increase his income. With your help, Abdukahhor will be able to make his business succeed and support his family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase some pregnant cows to expand his business

loans.name: Lun's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan group made up of four people, all residents of the province of Siem Reap. Mrs. Lun N. has been selected to be leader by the other members.

Lun N.'s is age 32 and is married with three children, who are studying in the local school. Her husband is a security guard for a small company in Siem Reap Province. Lum N. currently makes a daily income by driving a motor taxi, and is earning approximately of $2 a day to supply her family's food needs.

Unfortunately, she can't attract as many clients as before because her motorbike has frequently broken down. To solve the matter, she is looking for a loan from Kiva to add with her saving to buy a new motor to replace the old one.

The other three borrowers are:

K. sells fish that she catches from Tunle Sap Lake. She requests a loan to purchase a boat for fishing.

S. is a fisherman who is seeking a loan to buy more nets and traps for fishing.

K. owns a boat to pick up passengers for income and she is looking for a loan to buy a piglet to raise.

loans.use: To buy a new motor

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en: Angelina O. cooks and sells Sudanese local bread and is requesting a loan to open up a place to sell tea. She is 33 years old and married a soldier. They have five children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel. BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a place to sell tea

loans.name: Annabe

texts.en:
Annabe Y. is 31 years old. She is married and living happily with her three children. Her husband is into farming where cassava, corn and banana are their primary products.

Annabe has had her variety store for almost a year. She wants to gain more profit from her business to support her children’s needs (education, food and clothing). In this connection, she needs additional money to procure additional items to add to her inventory and generate a much higher income.

Annabe is working on her loan proposal to HSPFI, a Kiva partner. She is positive enough to think that her business will improve with the help granted by the organization.

loans.use: To purchase more items for her variety store

loans.name: Muhayo

texts.ru: Ниезова Мухайе проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 26 лет, замужем и имеет одного ребенка.Муж находится  в России на заработках. Деньги не высылает, так что семью обеспечивает сама. Занимается торговлей. Опыт в данном бизнесе уже четыре года. Торгует на рынке "Ориеи.". Для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот , она планирует получить кредит . Так она сможет привезти летний ассортимент товара и таким образом привлечь новых клиентов.
texts.en:
Muhayo N. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. She is 26 years old, is married and has one child. Her husband is in Russia earning money. He does not send money, so she provides for the family. She works in sales. She already has four years of experience in this business. She sells at the “Oriei” market. In order to increase her turnover she plans to get credit. This way she will be able to purchase a summer assortment of products and attract new customers this way.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Joan's Group

texts.en: Joan N. is a hardworking and devoted lady who has run a retail shop in Jinja for seven years. She is so grateful for her previous loans, which have allowed her to restock her shop with more products, helping her to increase profitability and income. Joan is married with five children, and she is happy that she is able to pay their school fees since their father has many other responsibilities. She buys her retail shop stock at a discount from wholesale shops in Jinja and Iganga, and then sells it at a retail price. Joan is seeking another loan to buy more goods (for example, sugar and maize flour among others). She is grateful that many people care about her welfare and wellbeing.

loans.use: To buy more goods for her retail shop

loans.name: Jasmina

texts.en: Jasmina Alibašić was born in 1978 and comes from the suburbs of the town of Banovići. She is a married mother of two children. Her husband is employed in construction and works in agriculture in his free time. Jasmina is a housewife who takes care of her children and garden. She also raises poultry for her own use. Now, Jasmina is requesting her first loan from Kiva partner, Women for Women International (WWI), for the amount of 600 BAM to purchase poultry and food. She will fatten the poultry to resell and thereby raise her family income.

loans.use: To purchase poultry and poultry food

loans.name: Rayno

texts.ru:
Раъно Салимова родилась в 1960 году. Замужем, проживает с 3 детьми. Место жительства город  Истаравшан.
 Клиентка занимается животноводством у себя дома уже около 15 лет. В откорме скота ей помогают сыновья Равшан и Джасур. 
 Дополнительный источник дохода это работа Равшана таксистом, а сама Раъно работает в школе преподавателем родного языка и литературы.
 К сожалению, заработная плата учителя  невилика, и поэтому Раъно приходиться подрабатывать животноводством. Для откорма скота Раъно запрашивает сумму в размере 200 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Rayno S. was born in 1960. She is married and lives with 3 children in Istaravshan. Rayno teaches Tajik language at a local school. Unfortunately, the teacher's pay is low and, to supplement her income, Rayno has been farming cattle at her home farm for almost 15 years. Rayno's sons Ravshan and Dzhasur help her feed the animals. Ravshan earns additional income driving a taxi. This loan, Rayno will use to purchase food for her cattle. She plans to repay the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Livestock food

loans.name: Sheren Dell Group

texts.en: Sheren Dell is the leader of the three-member Sheren Dell group, and each of them wants to take out a loan for their own business. Sheren Dell wants a loan for her business of selling fruits and vegetables, Anusa Gul wants a loan for her husband's blacksmith shop, and Faqir M. wants a loan for his general store. They are happy that these loans are available for the support of entrepreneurs.

loans.use: for expanding business

loans.name: Quvatali

texts.ru: Алтыбаев Куватали  житель Вахшского района. Возраст 52 года, женат и имеет четверых детей. По специальности водитель. Занимается сельским хозяйством. Имеет участок земли , засеевает Пшеницей и подсолнечником. Сейчас необходимо закупить удобрения и поэтому для этого он решил получить кредит . Занимается данным видом бизнеса уже 26 лет.
texts.en:
Quvatali A. lives in the Vakhsh region. He is 52 years old, is married and has four children. He is a driver by profession. He works in agriculture. He has a plot of land on which he plants wheat and sunflowers. Right now he needs to purchase fertilizer and this is why he decided to get credit. He has been in this business for 26 years.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Akram

texts.en:
M. Akram is 27 years old and married. He is an expert in computer services and has run his own business for the last two years providing services such as internet, printing, scanning, lamination and so on. Akram tries to use up-to-date technologies in his work in order to satisfy his customer's demands and requirements. For example, he is now planning to purchase a new modern computer to improve the quality of his work and to expand the business. For this purpose Akram is requesting a loan of $2500 USD for the term of 12 months. This is Akram's first loan; he thanks Kiva lenders for their support and promises to pay the loan on time.

More about Tajikistan
Tajikistan, a key post on the Silk Road, is perhaps best known for its rich history. It was the location for the end of Alexander the Great's rule, and is known for its great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country, with its epic mountain passes, is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language and a civilization that dates back to the fourth millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mix of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

However, Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 per cent of the country is mountainous and only 7 per cent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands of people to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

More about IMON International
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase a new modern computer

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary M. is currently selling coffee, powdered milk, sugar, etc at her shop and is requesting a loan to open up a restaurant in order to expand her business. She is a 24 year old woman whose husband is a business man. She has three children and two attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay school fees for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To open up a resturant

loans.name: Elen

texts.en:
Elen B., at 35, helps her husband through selling cellphone accessories. Elen saw the demand for these products so she wanted to pursue it and make it a profitable business. As for her current business status it’s quite improved but she doesn't have the resources to maximize profit.

With this in mind, she wants a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase new designs and fashionable cellphone accessories. According to Elen, if given the chance to excel in this business, she desires to have not only a store for cellphone accessories but to have a cellphone repair shop as well.

loans.use: To purchase new designs and fashionable cellphone accessories

location.town: Purok 1-B, Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Nort

loans.name: Safeta

texts.en:
Safeta Ikanović comes from a village near the town of Banovići. She is divorced and lives alone. Safeta has one adult daughter who is married.

Safeta is employed in a primary school as maid and earns well. Beside that she does agriculture and raises poultry in season. Safeta requested her second loan from WWI in the amount of 800 KM to invest in her business at home. She increases her household income in this way and supports her daughter.

loans.use: To purchase  poultry

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru:
Дилбар Бурхонова женщина 49 лет. Проживает в городе Истаравшане вместе со своим мужем и 2 детьми. 
Дилбар занимается предпринимательской деятельностью, торгует на рынке сладостями.   Это печенье и конфеты. Дилбар арендует магазин, который находится возле хлебобулочного цеха, и стаж ее работы около 2 лет. 
С самого начала предпринимательской деятельности Дилбар  помогал сын, сейчас  она торгует на рынке сама.
Товар привозит с города Худжанда у оптовиков, и реализует  его в Истаравшане.
Наиболее прибыльными месяцами для реализации товара  это с мая месяца по январь месяц. 
Для реализации и товарооборота она запрашивает сумму 2000 сомони сроком на 10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Dilbar B. is a 49 year old woman. She lives in the city of Istaravshan together with her husband and 2 children. Dilbar is an entrepreneur; she sells sweets at the market. This includes cookies and candy. Dilbar rents a store which is located next to a bread plant and she has around 2 years of experience. From the very start of her business, Dilbar’s son helped her, now she sells at the market herself She brings her products from the city of Khujand, from wholesalers and sells it in Istaravshan. Her most profitable months for selling products are from the month of May to the month of January. She is asking for a sum of 2000 somoni for sale and turnover.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For sales and turnover

loans.name: Haitmuhammad

texts.ru: Зияев Хаитмухаммад проживает в районе Вахш. Возраст 42 года, женат и имеет пятерых детей. Всю жизнь занимается сельским хозяйством. Имеет участок земли засеевает  пшеницей, картофелем , сейчас наступило время посева подсолнечника.Поэтому он решил обратиться к нам за кредитом , планирует использовать деньги для закупки семян и удобрений. Если он сможет получить качяественный урожай , то получит хорошую прибыль.
texts.en:
Haitmuhammad Z. lives in the Vakhsh region. He is 42 years old, is married and has five children. He has worked in agriculture for his entire live. He has a plot of land on which he plant wheat and potatoes. The season to plant sunflowers is now. This is why he decided to turn to us for credit; he plans to use the money to purchase seeds and fertilizer. If he is able to collect a good harvest, then he will earn good profits.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: "I started tilling a 1-hectare (approximately 2.5-acre) piece of land. I am a tenant but I never stop dreaming that someday I will be able to own the land I am farming. Before, we experienced our farm being flooded. That was the most difficult time because everything was destroyed, including our crops. CEVI came and helped us recover. They provided us with capital to start a business. They are reaching out to a lot of poor communities. They really help small business to grow," says Mary Jane D., 42-year-old farmer and mother of two children. Mary Jane would like a loan of Php 8,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase 18 liters of diesel fuel and three sacks of fertilizer. The loan will really help her increase her harvest. CEVI continues to extend its services to rural communities. It gives not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase 18 liters of diesel fuel and three sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Chheng

texts.en:
Chheng C. is 33 years old and is married to Mr. Thy who is aged 42. The couple now lives with five single children who are students.

They work selling fresh fish that they catch from Tunle Sap Lake. They get up in the dark to go fishing and hurry to bring their fish to sell in the local market.

Recently, the family can't catch as many fish as before due to the lack of fishing tools. Thus, Chheng C. is looking for a loan to purchase nets and traps to support their fishing activities.

loans.use: To purchase nets and traps for fishing

loans.name: Bimukarram

texts.ru: Умарова Бимукаррам  1959 года рождения имеет 2 детей. Высшего образования не имеет. Торгует семенами, рисом и другими бобовыми культурами. Торгует на рынке  18 лет.  В Микроинвест обратилась посовету мужа. Муж зарабатывал в то время мало денег и ей пришлось выйти на рынок торговать рисом. Раньше она была просто продавщицей, со временем она выкупила рис и продолжала продавать сама. Благодаря КИВА она вышла из своей трудной ситуации.
texts.en:
Bimukarram U. was born in 1959; she has 2 children. She does not have a higher education. She sells seeds, rice and other legumes. She has been selling at the market for 18 years. Bimukarram turned to MicroInvest on the advice of her husband. Her husband was earning little money at the time and she needed to go out to the market to sell rice. At first she was just a saleswoman, with time she purchased the rice and continued to sell it herself. Thanks to KIVA she was able to resolve her difficult situation.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase turnover

loans.name: Mkasi

texts.en:
Mkasi has been a bread seller in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She belongs to Ishalla kheri group loan (Group code 2041). She currently earns an average monthly profit approximately $20. Every day she works at her business for eight hours.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for her business. She is hoping that, through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use.

Mkasi is 41 years old, married, and has given birth to three children: ages 23, 19 and 13.

loans.use: To buy more wheat flour, sugar and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine F., a 35-year-old woman married to a businessman, sells tea  on Juba's main street and requests a loan in order to stock more milk and sugar for her business. Christine has three children, two of whom attend school at Malakia Primary school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to build a rental house.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as  measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more sugar and milk for her business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice O. is 30 years of age. She is married and lives with her two children, all of whom are still in school. Her husband is into farming. They have their own little piece of land that her husband cultivates.

Alice’s passion is dressmaking. She loves it and has been doing it since she was single. Eventually, when she got married, she still loved dressmaking and made it into a business.

At present, Alice has her dress shop where she offers dressmaking and rents gowns for all occasions. She wishes to expand her dress shop and produce new gowns for rent. She is now working on her loan proposal to HSPFI, a Kiva partner, where she is thinking positively that this amount may be granted to her. From this loan, she is looking forward to more improvement in her business which will eventually reflect in her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To procure additional materials used in her dressmaking business

loans.name: Abdullo

texts.ru: Абдуллоев Абдулло живет в раоне Рудаки. Возраст 42 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Абдулло занимается пчеловодством т.е. прожадей меда. Этим видом бизнеса занимется более 15 лет. Жена тоже работает швеей. Клиент хочет взять у нас кредит, для увелечения объема своих продаж.
texts.en:
Abdullo A. lives in the Rudaki region. He is 42 years old. He is married and has 3 children. Abdullo raises bees and sells honey. He has been in this business for more than 15 years. His wife also works as a seamstress. The client would like to take out a loan from us in order to increase the size of his sales.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mayasa

texts.en:
Mayasa is 36 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 13 and 4. She also cares for an additional dependent.

She has owned a small food store in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar for three years. She works at her business for eight hours every day and currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $60.
