She belongs to the Msimamo group loan (Group code 2015) and is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania. She plans to use the loan to add more items to her current stock and expand her business. She is hoping that this loan will enable her to increase profits, grow her business and save money for future use.

loans.use: To buy more items to add to her current stock and expand her business.

loans.name: Maria Prima

texts.en: Maria Prima A. offers her services to everybody who wishes to take advantage of them. She serves as "manicurista", a person who offers manicures and pedicures to customers. With her 3 children, Maria needs to have 6 or 7 clients every day to be able to keep up with the children's daily expenses. She knows that  if she had the complete materials and various nail polish colors, her business would be more attractive to her local market. A loan amounting to PHP 5,000 payable in 5 months' term would be of great  help to her.

loans.use: to purchase nail polish, etc.

location.town: Purok 1-B, Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Nort

loans.name: Jesovie

texts.en:
" I am happy that finally my husband agrees with me to engage in farming. Now, it's really easy to provide food for our family. Now, we are busy preparing the land. My husband and I hope that we will be able to have a good harvest to pay the school fees of our 8 children",says Mrs. Jesovie F., a 38-year old farmer from Agusan Del Sur.

She would like to ask for a loan of Php 7,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to purchase of fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides. The loan will really help her improve her harvest and income as well.

CEVI gives their clients not just loans. They also provide training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase of fertilizer, herbicides and pesticides

loans.name: Umarboy

texts.ru: Усмонов Умарбой 1951 года рождения , женат имеет 3 детей. Высшего образования не имеет. Сотрудничает с Микроинвест 2005 года. Торгует рисом на рынке. Частично также работает в государственном предприятии водного хозяйства. Но изза низкого оклада занялся бизнесом в 5 лет назад. Узнал о кредите Микроинвест от друзей и родственников и решил получть также кредит и сейчас благодаря кредиту от КИВА улучшил свое положение и рад этому.
texts.en:
Umarboy U. was born in 1951, married, and has 3 children. He has a high school education. Umarboy has been working with MicroInvest since 2005. He sells rice at a local market. Umarboy U. also works at a state water supply management organization, but his pay there is low. To supplement his income, Umarboy started his rice selling business 5 years ago. Umarboy learned about MicroInvest and Kiva loan programs from his friends and relatives. The previous loans helped Umarboy improve his life quality and expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Savriya

texts.ru: Косимова Саврия проживает в районе Рудаки. Возраст 53 года, замужем и меет 5 детей. Саврия имеет торговую точку на рынке "Корвон". Она продает женскую одежду. Этим видом бизнеса занимается вместе с сыном. Бизнес существует более 25 лет. Еще один сын в России на заработках. Муж занимается земледелием. Клиентка хочет взять у нас кредит чтобы звкупить новую одежду.
texts.en:
Savriya K. lives in the Rudaki region. She is 53 years old, is married and has 5 children. Savriya has a sales location at the “Korvon” market. She sells women’s clothing. She works in this business with her son. The business has existed for more than 25 years. Another son is in Russia earning money. Her husband works in agriculture. The client would like to get a loan from us in order to purchase new clothing.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothing for sale

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Tung

texts.en:
Tung S. is 53 years old, married, and the mother of five children: two are still single and attending school and the others are married. Two of them are employed as grocery sellers.

Tung S. and her husband currently cultivate rice and vegetable crops. On the other hand, Tung S. is also a local tailor. Tun S. will use the loan money to increase the quantity of grocery items for her children to sell and use the rest to buy a bicycle for her single children to ride to school.

loans.use: To increase the quantity of grocery items

loans.name: Baroat

texts.ru: Ашрафова Бароат 1970 года рождения ,  имеет семью 2 детей. Закончив школу сидела дома, на поступление в университет денег не хватило, после замужества муж  также был против работы. Со временем когда дети подросли жить стало трудно и дорого.  Уговорив мужа начала торговать нитками , иглами и детской одеждой. В Микроинвест обратилась 2006 году. На рынке торгует более 10 лет.
texts.en:
Baroat A. was born in 1970. She is married and has 2 children. After graduating high school, Baroat stayed at home having no money to go to college. After she got married, Baroat's husband was against her going to work. Later, as Baroat's children were growing up, living become more difficult and expensive. Baroat persuaded her husband to let her start a business. For more than 10 years, she has been selling sewing supplies and clothing for children at a local market. Baroat has been a MicroInvest client since 2006.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase store inventory

loans.name: Nazer Muhammad Group

texts.en: Nazer Muhammad is the leader of the three-member Nazer Muhammad group, and they want to take out a loan to expand their businesses. Nazer Muhammad wants a loan for his taxi business, Matab wants a loan for her embroidery business, and Farnaz wants a loan for her tailoring business. They are very happy that these small loans are available in Afghanistan.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Rahima

texts.ru: Рахима Бабаджанова проживает в районе Рудаки. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Возраст 47 лет. Старший сын в России на заработках. Рахима занимается пашивом одеяло. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 20 лет. Муж работает таксистом. Клиентка хочет взять у нас кредит, чтобы увеличить свой объем продажи.
texts.en:
Rahima B. lives in the Rudaki region. She is married and has three children. She is 47 years old. Her oldest son is working in Russia. Rahima makes quilts and has been doing it for more than twenty years. Her husband works as a taxi driver. The client wants to take out a loan to increase the volume of her sales.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales volume

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Kamaladin Group

texts.en:
Kamaladin is the group leader of the Kamaladin group. There are four members in this group. They would like to receive loans to be used for their various businesses, as follows:

- Kamaladin would like to obtain a loan to use toward his fresh fruit vending business. He hopes to buy necessary materials for his shop.

- Reza G. hopes for a loan to use for her business of carpet-weaving.

- Sakena wants to take out a loan for her tailoring work, specifically to buy a new machine for her business.

- Sayamoy is hoping to receive a loan for her husband’s general-store business, which he hopes to expand.

With this loan, these group members can improve and grow their businesses, support their families, and make a better future for themselves and their families.

loans.use: To improve and expand their businesses

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en: Analiza D. C. is the mother of 3 children. Presently, she is helping her husband prepare and save for the schooling of the children. She is currently engaged in making chorizo, longganisa (types of sausage), and snacks to sell to her neighbors in their village. Sometimes she  also sells dried fish on credit to her established customers. She is happy to know that HSPFI has micro-finance loans that can give her the opportunity to increase her income. She wants to access a loan amounting to PHP 5,000.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for chorizo and longganisa and dried fish

location.town: Purok 1-B, Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Nort

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: Саида Тагоймуродова проживает в районе Рудаки. В возрасте 51 года. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Саида занимается пошивом одеяла и его продажей. У нее имеются постоянные покупатели, которые торгуют на рынке. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 22 лет. Муж находится на заработках в России. Клиенка хочет взять у нас кредит, чтобы увеличить объем продажи.
texts.en:
Saida T. lives in the Rudaki region. She is 51 years old. She is married and has 3 children. Saida makes and sells quilts. She has regular customers who sell at the market. She has been in this business for more than 22 years. Her husband is earning money in Russia. The client would like to get credit in order to increase her sales.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Enriquita

texts.en:
" It's always been my dream to see my children provided with all the things they need. I want them to continue and do a lot of hard work in studying their lessons so that they will be able to have a good education and become somebody in the future," says Enriquita C., 33-year-old mother of two children.

She is asking for a loan of Php 14,000 from CEVI. She will use the loan to buy 5 sacks of Ammonium fertilizers and to buy pesticides as well. The loan will really help her improve their harvest and have more income.

CEVI provides not just loans but training and insurance coverage as well.

loans.use: To purchase 5 sacks of Ammonium fertilizer and  buy  pesticides as well.

loans.name: Komi

texts.fr: Komi T. est conducteur de moto à Wome. Agé de 33 ans, il est marié et père d’un enfant. pour imiter les dépenses causées par les pannes régulières et épargner pour la survie de sa famille, Komi espère avec ce crédit acheter une nouvelle moto. il compte sur cette chance pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Komi T. is a moto driver in Wome. He is 33 years old, married, and the father of one child. To limit the costs from regular breakdowns and to save money, so that his family may survive, he hopes to use this loan to buy a new moto He’s counting on this chance to improve his family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Khun

texts.en: Khun K., a 45-year-old living in the province of Banteay Meanchey, earns a living selling marbles. She normally collects the marbles from mountains located far from her house and sells them around her village. Khun is a widowed mother of three children: one is married and the other two are single and employed in different jobs in Phnom Penh.  Because selling marbles is her main source of income, she s requesting a loan of $1000  to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business of selling marbles.

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en: Ofelia is 36 years old and is married to Wilfredo T., who is a farmer. They live in the village of Minallo Naguillian, in Isabela. They are blessed with three children who are all currently studying. Her eldest child, Tiffany Joy, is 14 years old. Her second child, John Mark, is 12 years old. The youngest child, Wilfredo, is 9 years old. She feels happy because her family members have good relationships with one another and her children are disciplined. Ofelia diligently maintains her general store to help her husband provide for the children’s educational needs. She is requesting her second loan, amounting to PHP 20,000, to fund additional working capital to further improve her business. She hopes that someday she will attain all her goals in life through the support of lenders and her hard work. She will use the majority of the loan in purchasing different groceries to retail in her store. Ofelia says that Kiva lenders are of great help in the improvement of her business and maintenance of basic necessities at home.

loans.use: Working Capital for General Store

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica A. sells goods in her shop and is requesting a loan to stock more goods in her shop to sell. She is 42 years old. Her husband was shot dead in the power struggle between the Southerners against Khartoum government, which has been going on for two decades. She has five children and only three go to school. In the future, she also needs to buy a grinding mill for grinding maize.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services.  These programs are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more goods in her shop

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi T. est un jeune homme de 35 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il fait la pépinière des jeunes plants de tecks, palmiers, caféiers et cacaoyers à Wome. Il exerce cette activité depuis 8 ans. Son activité est très prospère à cause de la demande sans cesse croissante. Koffi espère avec ce crédit augmenter la taille de son activité en payant des intrants et des outils de travail nécessaires
texts.en:
Koffi T. is a young man, 35 years old, married, and the father of two. He has a nursery in Wome for saplings: teak, palm, coffee, and cocoa. He has been in this business for eight years. It’s a prosperous business because of the ever-growing demand. He hopes to use this loan to expand his business by buying the necessary fertilizers, supplies, and work tools.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other supplies for his plant nursery

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma V. is 41 years old and a resident of Minallo Naguillan, in Isabela. She is married to Guillermo V., Jr. Her husband is a farmer and Vilma raises hogs. They are blessed with five children: Jemalyn, Jemar, Jennyfer, Jennylyn, and Vince. Two of them are already attending the primary school. By maintaining a hog raising business, Vilma is able to support her husband in providing for their family needs.

To expand her business this year, Vilma is seeking financial assistance from the lenders amounting to PHP 4,000. With the loan, she plans to buy additional piglets and a sack of feed for the pigs she is already raising. Vilma also sells vegetables to generate extra income. Vilma is fighting her fear that she will be unable to send all her children on to a higher level of education by trusting that her business will become successful and therefore she will be able to pay for their education.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets and feed

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta R. is from the town of Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 38 years old and married, with three school-aged children. To earn a living, Violeta owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. The business’ main source of revenue is raising pigs for sale. Violeta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Violeta is requesting a new loan from ASKI for 6000 PHP to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay her children’s tuition fees.

About ASKI: ASKI is a pioneering microfinance institution in the Philippines. It is committed to serving the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella B. is a 48-year-old woman from the town of Lallo, Cagayan. Bella is married and she has 6 school-age children. To make a living, Bella owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector by raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising chickens and ducks for sale.

Bella joined ASKI to gain much-needed access to capital so that she could improve both her living situation and her ability to engage in various business activities. Bella is thus requesting a loan via ASKI in the amount of $100 (4,000 PHP) which will be invested in order to expand the business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business as a result of the loan to pay the tuition fees of her children.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines. ASKI is committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business

loans.name: Akuvi

texts.fr: Akuvi S. est productrice de l’huile de palme à Wome. Agée de 46 ans, elle est mariée et mère de  3 enfants. cette activité est est sa principale source de revenus et elle en fait une bonne gestion. Avec ce crédit, Akuvi souhaite acheter des matières premières notamment des noix de palme afin d’augmenter sa production et par conséquent ses revenus.
texts.en:
Akuvi S. produces palm oil in Wome. She is 46 years old, married, and the mother of 3 children. This business is her principal source of revenue and she runs it well. With this loan, Akuvi wishes to buy raw materials, notably palm nuts, so as to increase her production and thus her income.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing palm nuts for producing palm oil

loans.name: Jovelyn

texts.en:
Jovelyn Z. is a married, 20-year-old woman. Her husband is 57 years old, and they are blessed with two children. At present, she is trying to help her husband generate additional income in order to pay for their family's daily expenses.

Her husband supports her ready-to-wear (RTW) clothing business. Fortunately, there is very high demand for the items Jovelyn sells. Therefore, Jovelyn is seeking a loan in the amount of $125 (5,000 PHP) so that she can expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing additional ready-to-wear clothes for resale purposes

location.town: Purok 1-B, Del Carmen, Iligan City, Lanao del Nort

loans.name: Rejoice

texts.en:
Rejoice J. is currently selling clothes and is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell.  She is 33 years old, married and has four children whom all attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to buy a sewing machine.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs, as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: buy more clothes

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Fatima is 33 years old and comes from a suburb of a town in Banovići. She is married and has one child who is in primary school. She is a diligent young woman who works hard in her fields to produce as much food as possible to sell. Her husband is employed but in his free time he works with his wife in agriculture. They have a small tractor and it helps them to work their fields more easily. Fatima decided to take her first loan from WWI in the amount of US$425 to purchase poultry and poultry feed. She has clients who buy vegetables from her and they will buy chicken meat also. This will increase Fatima`s household income.

loans.use: To purchase poultry and poulltry feed

loans.name: Huon

texts.en:
Huon K. is a 26-year-old, married woman. She is the mother of two children, both of whom are teenagers and attend school.

She currently generates an income of approximately $4 per day by selling stone. More specifically, she and her husband first purchase large stone blocks from the people who live near the mountains, then carve and break down the stone blocks into small pieces, and finally sell the stone pieces to people who need them to build their houses. The stone-selling business is the family's main source of income. Huon is now applying for a loan in the amount of $400 to purchase additional stone blocks for resale purposes. In turn, she expects that the loan will enable her to generate additional income.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional stone blocks

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia is 29 years old and married with four children. She sells roasted yam in Lagos State, Nigeria. There is high demand for her roasted yam and she is enjoying considerable success.

Felicia hopes to obtain a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more yam tubers to roast and sell.

She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more yam tubers to roast and sell

loans.name: Msimu

texts.en:
For the last year, Msimu has owned a small firewood store in the Mikunguni neighborhood of Zanzibar. She currently earns an average monthly profit of approximately $90. Every day, she works at her business for eight hours. She belongs to the Tujikomboe group loan.

She is requesting her second loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more firewood to add to her current stock, hoping to expand her business. She is hopes to increase her profit through this loan so that she can grow her business and save money for future use.

Msimu is 27 years old and married, and she has three children, ages three, six, and nine.

loans.use: To buy more firewood to add to her current stock

loans.name: Nzovwe '1' Group

texts.en:
This group is made up of Getruda and Roda.

Getruda is an animal-feed seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She currently earns a very minimal monthly profit. Every day, she works at her business for 12 hours.

She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more animal feed to add her current stock for the improvement of her business. She hopes to increase her profit through this loan so that she will be able to grow her business and save money for future use; she also wishes to improve her home and to pay school fees for her children.

Getruda is 32 years old and married, and she has five children, ages 6, 10, 12, 14, and 15.

Getruda is sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Roda, who has her own small business selling charcoal in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more animal feed for sale.

loans.name: Ajka

texts.en:
Ajka comes from a suburb of the town of Banovići. She is 51 years old and lives with her husband; their children are adults and live away from the parents' home. Ajka works as a cleaning lady in a local school; her husband is employed too.

Ajka, like most Bosnian women, has a garden where she produces vegetables for her own use. Besides that, Ajka has one hobby - raising turkeys. Turkey meat is very popular and healthy and Ajka keeps always two or three for her own use. But now she has decided to make more out of her hobby and she has requested a loan from Kiva's partner MFI, WWI, in the amount of 800 KM, to purchase more turkeys to raise for resale.

loans.use: To buy turkeys to raise

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells baby items and clothes. She is 48 years old and married with 4 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more baby clothes to sell. Theresa says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more baby clothes to sell

loans.name: Nuriddin

texts.ru: Очилов Нуриддин 1962   года рождения женат имеет 3 детей. Имеет среднее образование. Более  20 лет торгует продуктами питаниями в магазине. После выхода на пенсию сыновья помогли приобрести магазин что бы он мог дальше сам работать. Нуриддин обратился в Микроинвест для бизнеса и продолжает до сих пор развивать свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Nuriddin O., born in 1962, married, has 3 children. For over 20 years, Nuriddin has been selling food products at a grocery store. After his retirement, Nuriddin's sons helped him to purchase a store so that he could continue on his own. This loan Nuriddin will use to expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng H. is 60 years old and a resident of the province of Banteay Meanchey where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows both rice and vegetable crops, which she plants twice a year. She is widowed and the mother of six children, all of whom are married.

Two of her children help support the family by working at different jobs; one sells boiled corn and the other one is a construction worker. Seng H. requests a loan in the amount of US$ 300 as capital to cultivate crops during the farming season.

loans.use: To cultivate crops during the farming season

loans.name: Mariame

texts.fr:
Madame  Mariame Djiré a 46 ans et vit  dans une famille polygame avec  ses 7 enfants (3 garçons et 4 filles), son époux et sa coépouse  à Sanoubougou II, un des quartiers périphériques de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas été à l’école pour des raisons sociales, cette  femme s’est initiée à une activité génératrice de revenus qui  est la teinture,  apprise à Bamako (capitale du Mali) auprès d’une célèbre teinturière de la place ANTOU. Elle jouit d’une forte réputation dans cette activité et reçoit beaucoup de commandes surtout lors des cérémonies (mariage, baptême, fêtes, etc.) mais ses ressources propres ne peuvent pas lui permettre de les satisfaire.  C’est ainsi, qu’elle sollicite la collaboration de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son 4ème prêt individuel, après avoir correctement  remboursés  tous les prêts précédents.
Elle compte acheter, 5 pièces de bazins blancs, 10 sachets de soude caustique et 10 boites de teinture de couleurs différentes. Elle s’approvisionne auprès des grossistes à Bamako en matières premières (bazins blancs, soude caustique et teintures). Les bazins blancs sont mis dans les différentes couleurs avant d’être revendus  soit au comptant ou à crédit, à une clientèle composée en grande partie de revendeuses des bazins teintés, des couturiers et des femmes de son quartier.
Avec ce quatrième prêt, elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 300 000 FCFA qu’elle utilisera essentiellement pour ses dépenses personnelles, contribuer aux dépenses familiales en aidant son époux, payer les intérêts de son prêt et renforcer son activité de teinture.
texts.en:
Ms. Mariame Djiré, age 46, lives in a polygamous family with her seven children (3 boys and 4 girls), her husband, and her co-spouse in Sanoubougou II, an outlying district of Sikasso City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having gone to school due to societal reasons, this woman was introduced to an income-generating business, the dyeing of cloth. She learned this trade in Bamako (capital of Mali) from ANTOU, a local celebrated dye expert. Mariame enjoys a solid reputation in this business and receives many orders, especially for ceremonies (marriages, baptisms, holidays, etc.). But her own resources cannot allow her to meet the demand. And so, she's requesting a collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso, with which she is on her fourth individual loan, after having correctly repaid all the preceding ones. She intends to buy five bolts of white damask fabrics, ten bags of caustic soda, and ten containers of dyes of different colors. Supplies are gotten from wholesalers in Bamako for her raw materials (white damask, caustic soda, and dyes). The white damask is put into different colors and then sold, either in cash or credit transactions, to customers composed of women in her area. With this fourth loan, she intends to realize an average monthly profits of 300,000 francs CFA that she'll use essentially for her personal expenses, for helping to cover family expenses by helping her husband, for making loan interest payments, and for bolstering her dye business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy white damask fabrics, caustic soda, and dyes

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Холматова Гульсара- женщина 43 лет , мать троих детей. Проживает и работает в Худжанде. Её муж работает в мастером по ремонту автомашин. Сама Гульсара занимается откормом и продажей скота. Ей на счёт продажи помогает её муж. Узнав от соседей, Гульсара решила получить кредит и увеличить свой бизнес. Хочет купить ещё пару голов коров, которые дают молоко. Для чего Гульсара и обратилась в Микроинвест. На снимке Гульсара  кормит баранов.
texts.en:
Gulsara K., 43, mother of 3, lives and works in Khujand. Her husband is an auto mechanic. Gulsara is a cattle farmer. Having learned from her neighbors about MicroInvest, Gulsara decided to apply for a loan to expand her business. She plans to use the money to purchase a pair of milk cows.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase milk cows

loans.name: Oybegim

texts.ru: Шукурова Ойбегим жительница района Рудаки. Возраст 48 лет, замужем и имеет четверых детей. Муж работает строителем , находясь в Российской федерации. Ойбегим занимается пошивом одеяла и его продажей. Этим видом деятельности занимается  более 20 лет. Ей также помогает ее дочка. Клиентка хочет взять у нас кредит, чтобы закупить материалы и увеличить объем производства.
texts.en:
Oybegim S. lives in the Rudaki region. She is 48 years old, is married and has four children. Her husband works as a construction worker and is in the Russian Federation. Oybegim sews quilts and sells them. She has been in this business for more than 20 years. Her daughter helps her. The client would like to get a loan from us in order to purchase fabric and increase her production volume.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.ru:
Назира Назарова  торгует на рынке. Продает капусту и зелень, которую она покупает у оптовиков - дехканинов.  Супруг Назиры Соли Назаров тоже торгует на рынке, он продает помидоры и огурцы.
У них трое детей, семья проживает в городе Истаравшане.
Назира в предпринимательской деятельности уже 10 лет, и имеет достаточный опыт в этой сфере. 
Назира хочет разнообразить ассортимент своего товара, а значит торговать не только капустой и зеленью, но и болгарским перцем, чесноком и баклажанами. Для этого, ей необходима сумма в размере  1300 сомони на 6 месяцев.
texts.en:
Nazira N. sells cabbage and other greens at a market. She buys the vegetables wholesale from dehkan farmers. Nazira’s husband, Soli Nazarov, sells tomatoes and cucumbers at the market as well. They have three children and live in the city of Istaravshan. Nazira has been an entrepreneur for 10 years and has ample experience in this field. Nazira wants to diversify her product assortment so that she can start selling bell peppers, garlic and eggplants. She needs a loan in a sum of 1300 somoni for this purpose.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To diversify product assortment

loans.name: Mary-Rose

texts.en: Mary-Rose is 40 years old and married with 2 children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria  and she sells clothes. Mary-Rose has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Aun

texts.en:
Aun H., 29, lives in Banteay Meanchey Province where she has had a medium-sized plot of farmland since she was single. She grows rice and has two crops per year, in both the dry and rainy seasons. She is married and has two children. Both of them are students and still live in the family home. Her husband, Keo Phalla, 32, works as a domestic construction worker around his community.

Because the rainy season is coming, Aun H. needs a loan of US$ 300 to buy seeds and fertilizers to grow crops and to pay to have her farmland plowed. The loan will help to increase the farm's income and sustain her family's needs.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers to grow crops

loans.name: Dilnoza

texts.ru: Дилноза Шарипова 1980 года рождения имеет 2 детей. Замужем имеет детей. Муж работает таксистом . Дилноза работает в салон красоты ,она предоставляет различные услуги: стрижка, укладка волос и краска волос, а также услуги маникюра  макияжа.  Кредит получила для  приобретения специальной мебели для салона, что бы в будущем было удобно клиентам. Благодарна Микроинвесту и КИВА  потому  что ей не отказали.
texts.en:
Born in 1980, Dilnoza S. is married and has 2 children. Her husband works as a taxi driver. Dilnoza works at a beauty salon. She offers various services, such as haircuts, styling and coloring, and also manicure and makeup. She wants to use this loan to purchase specialty furniture for her salon and to improve service for her clients. Dilnoza is grateful to MicroInvest and Kiva for approving her request.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of specialty furniture

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Né le 09 Août 1978 à N’Golo-Diassa situé à environ 6 km de la ville de Sikasso, Monsieur Moussa Berthé vit avec deux enfants et son épouse dans une grande famille traditionnelle élargie  dans son village natal, relevant de la préfecture de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Moussa Berthé est  mécanicien de profession depuis maintenant huit ans et mène  parallèlement à son métier l’achat et la vente des pièces détachées d’occasion. Il  est beaucoup sollicité  par les garagistes et propriétaires de véhicule  pour la qualité de ses articles.
Pour permettre  à sa clientèle  plus en plus croissante  d’acquérir des pièces automobiles d’origine de qualité et sans faire le tour de la ville, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso depuis le 10 septembre 2008 et avec laquelle il est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Son prêt précédent a été remboursé par anticipation.
Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter,  des bielles, arbre à cames , pistons, jantes, etc. Les marchandises (pièces) achetées proviennent  des véhicules  démontés sur place et sont revendues dans son magasin au sein de son garage.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 150 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born on August 9, 1978 in N’Golo-Diassa, located about 6 km from Sikasso City, Mr. Moussa Berthé lives with two children and his wife in a large traditional extended family in the village of his birth in Sikasso Prefecture (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). He has been a mechanic by profession for eight years now. And concurrent to this trade, he buys and sells used spare parts. He is in high demand by those in the garage business and by vehicle owners for the quality of his merchandise. To enable his burgeoning customer base to acquire quality auto parts and without having to run about town to do so, he decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso on September 10, 2008. He is now on his second individual loan. His preceding loan was repaid in advance. With the current loan, he intends to buy piston rods, camshafts, pistons, rims, etc. The merchandise (spare parts) comes from automobiles disassembled locally and is resold in a store located within his garage. He envisions using this loan to realize a monthly profit of 150,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to augment his working capital, to help with family expenses, to make loan interest payments, and to invest the rest in his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy used spare parts

loans.name: Juneper

texts.en: Juneper F. is 27 years old and is married. He lives with his wife and child in Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City.  He is a motorcycle driver and his wife manages their variety store. Juneper is working hard to save money for their child's education. He has decided to improve his variety store by purchasing more stock to sell. He is applying for the loan program offered by HSPFI, a KIVA partner. According to Juneper, if his loan is granted, it will be of great help to his business and to his family. He is looking forward to a positive response to his request.

loans.use: To purchase addtional stock for his variety store

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nzovwe '1' A Group

texts.en:
For many years, Veronica  has owned a small shop selling animal feed in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya. She currently earns very little monthly profit. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.  


She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more animal feed for resale. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  


Veronica is 45  years old, married, and has five children aged 25, 24, 18, 16, and 15. She also cares for two additional dependents. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Jestina, who has her own small business selling milk in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more animal feed for resale.

loans.name: Nzovwe '1' Group

texts.en:
Rehema is 33 years old, married, and has four children aged 13, 10, 6, and 3. She owns a small hotel in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya where she works twelve hours every day. She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more items to add to her current stock. She is hoping that through this loan, her profit will increase and she will be able to improve her business.

Rehema will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Hilda, who also has her own small business in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more items to add to her current stock

loans.name: Bobosafar

texts.ru: Шарипов Бобосафар проживает в районе Хуросон. Возраст 45 лет. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Один сын работает в России на заработках. Бобосафар занимается земледелием. Этим видом деятельности занимается более 10 лет. Клиент хочет взять у нас кредит, чтобы закупить минералы и в дальнейшем после обработки собрать благоприятный урожай. А на полученный доход женить сына.
texts.en:
Bobosafar S. lives in the Khuroson region. He is 45 years old. He is married and has 5 children. One son works in Russia earning money. Bobosafar works in agriculture. He has been in this business for more than 10 years. The client would like to get a loan from us in order to purchase minerals and after processing them to collect a good harvest. He will use the income to marry off his son.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase minerals

loans.name: Oumou

texts.fr:
Née le 02 Octobre 1987,  Oumou Coulibaly  est une célibataire qui vit chez sa sœur à Hamdallaye, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle  s’initia très vite aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment l’achat-vente des pagnes wax, de soutien-gorge, de slip et des tissus brodés. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée  de sa clientèle (composée essentiellement des femmes) pour la qualité de ses produits.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier prêt  individuel.
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 4 douzaines de slip, 6 douzaines de Soutien- gorge et 4 pièces de pagnes wax.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Elle achète ses marchandises auprès des grands commerçants de la ville, ensuite elle les revend de façon ambulante à Sikasso.
 Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 50 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born on October 2, 1987, Oumou C.is single and lives with her sister in Hamdallaye, one of the working-class neighborhoods of the town of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Not having had the chance to get ahead in school for socio-economic reasons, she began early on to work at money-earning activities, notably selling "wax pagnes" (high-quality, brightly patterned African fabrics), bras, women's underwear, and embroidered cloth. She is much in demand with her clientele (composed essentially of women) for the quality of her products.

With the intention of satisfying her ever growing clientele, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom she is on her first individual loan. This loan will be used to buy 4 dozen pairs of women's underwear, 6 dozen bras, and 4 bolts of "wax pagne" fabric. She buys her merchandise from the big merchants of the town, then she sells it on foot throughout Sikasso.

She expects to earn a monthly profit of 50,000 F CFA with this loan which will be used essentially to increase her working capital, contribute to family expenses, and pay the interest on the loan, investing any remainder in her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of "pagnes", bras, and underwear

loans.name: Bisi

texts.en: Bisi is 28 years old and married with a child. She sells kerosene in Lagos State, Nigeria. Bisi hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more kerosene to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more kerosene to sell

loans.name: Muhabbat

texts.ru: Юсупова Мухаббат- женщина 41 года, мать троих детей, муж строитель. Сама Мухаббат портниха с большим опытом работы. Она работает в городском ателье, у неё много клиентов. Кроме шитья на заказ Мухаббат шьёт платья на продажу. Продаёт её платья её дочь . которая выходит торговать на воскресные базары. Для покупки весенних тканей Мухаббат хочет получить кредит.
texts.en:
Muhabbat Y. is 41 years old and has three children. Her husband is a construction worker. She has extensive experience in her work as a seamstress. She has many customers at the city tailor shop where she works. In addition to custom tailoring she also makes dresses which her daughter sells at the market on Sundays. Muhabbat would like to receive a loan for purchasing fabric for the spring season.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cloth purchase

loans.name: Téréko

texts.fr:
Madame  Téréko Diakité a 43 ans et vit dans une famille polygame avec son époux, sa coépouse et leurs enfants à Médine, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali)
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle a choisi de faire une activité génératrice de revenus. C’est ainsi qu’elle décida de se  spécialiser dans la fabrication et la vente de la poudre de “Djafarana” il y a environ 17 ans avec une ivoirienne qui était venue à Sikasso pour en faire son activité principale. Cette poudre appelée communément “Djafarana mugu” ou “Tamati mugu” est fabriquée à base de mil, de la graine de l’arbre ou légume de “Djafarana” et du beurre de karité.
Elle pile le mil et la graine de “Djafarana” pour en faire le mélange avec le beurre de karité qui va donner  par  la suite la poudre proprement dite.
Elle  collabore avec Soro Yiriwaso depuis maintenant cinq ans. Après plusieurs prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier, elle est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Tous les prêts  précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Avec ce prêt, elle compte acheter, 3 sacs de mil, 8 sacs de graine “Djafarana” et 30kg de beurre  de Karité. Elle s’approvisionne en graines de “Djafarana”, de mil et de beurre de karité dans les localités environnantes de la ville de Sikasso (Loulouni, Lobougoula, Gnangasso, etc.) sur commande.
La rotation de son activité est très élevée et elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui servira à assurer certaines de ses dépenses, aider  son époux à subvenir aux dépenses de la famille, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Ms. Téréko Diakité, age 43, lives in a polygamous family with her husband, co-wife, and their children in Médine, a working-class district of Sikasso City (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having had the chance to go to school due to societal reasons, she chose to work to earn an income. Thus, she decided to become specialize in making and selling "djafarana" powder about 17 years ago. She learned how to do this from a woman from Cote d'Ivoire who had come to Sikasso to make it her principal business. This powder, commonly called “djafarana mugu” or “tamati mugu”, is made with millet, the seeds of the djafarana tree or plant, and shea nut butter. She pounds the millet and the djafarana seeds to make the powder, to be mixed with shea nut butter, in turn yielding the powder itself as mentioned. Téréko has been collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso for five years now. After several solidarity loans (group loans) in a women's association of her area, she is on her second individual loan. All the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. With the current loan, she intends to buy three sacks of millet, eight sacks of "djafarana" seeds, and 30 kg of shea nut butter. Supplies of the seeds, millet, and the butter are gotten in towns surrounding Sikasso City (Loulouni, Lobougoula, Gnangasso, etc.) by special order. Her business cycle is very rapid, and she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used to ensure that certain expenses are covered, to help her husband support the family, to make loan interest payments, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of millet and djafarana and some shea nut butter

loans.name: Masuda

texts.ru: Бобочонова Масуда кредитор Фонда, которая занимается продажей канцелярских товаров. Её точка реализации  находится на рынке Худжанда. Свои кредиты она использует на расширение своего бизнеса. Она закупает школьные товары, тетради, ручки, пеналы и т.д . Следующий займ она хочет потратить на завоз общих тетрадей и школьных альбомов.
texts.en:
Masuda B. is a client who works selling school supplies. Her sales booth is at the Khudjand market. She uses loans to expand the business. She buys school supplies, notebooks, pens, pencil cases, etc. The next loan will be used to supply writing and sketch books.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School supply sales

loans.name: Ysuf

texts.ru: Юсуф Шерназаров в возрасте 43 года, проживает в районе Хуросон. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Старший сын находится в России на заработках. Юсуф занимается животноводством, т.е. закупает скот, откармливает и продает. Этим видом бизнеса занимается более 5 лет. Также он работает таксистом более 15 лет. Клиент хочет получить у нас кредит, чтобы закупить крупно рогатый скот.
texts.en:
Yusuf S. is 43 years old and lives in the Khuroson region. He is married and has 6 children. His oldest son is in Russia earning money. Yusuf raises livestock; he purchases livestock, fattens it and sells it. He has been in this business for more than 5 years. He has also worked as a taxi driver for more than 15 years. The client would like to get credit from us in order to purchase livestock.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase livestock

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary A. is 26 years old. She is married with three children. At the moment, they are all schooling. She has been a local manufacturer of palm oil for three years now. Palm oil is produced from palm nut fruits. The palm oil is processed through various stages to obtain the palm oil. Her production is on a small scale due to having inadequate capital to buy machines for processing.

Mary A. wants to use the loan to buy more palm nuts to increase her efficiency and produce in larger quantities. She believes this will help expand her business to raise more income to help her husband to provide food and finance her children’s education. She said she would be grateful for your assistance. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Power and might’.

loans.use: buy more palm nuts and a small milling machine

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn D. is 42 years old. She is married and has four children. Her husband is CAFGU in their village, in other words, he serves as the village army. When off duty, her husband goes to do traditional gold mining. They both work hard for the needs of the family.

Evelyn has owned a variety store for almost a year. She is now applying for loan to HSPFI, a KIVA partner. She is in need of additional capital for her business. She plans to use the loan money to purchase additional items for her variety store. From this she will be earning a much higher income and will be able to accommodate all the needs of her family.

loans.use: purchase of addtional items for her variety store

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Drissa

texts.fr:
Né vers 1974 à Sikasso ville, Monsieur  Drissa Traoré  réside avec son épouse dans la grande famille traditionnelle élargie  Wayerma II, un des populaires de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Drissa Traoré opta pour le commerce de vêtements et plus précisément de la friperie  apprise  auprès de son père qui est un vieux vendeur de la ville. Il mène cette activité depuis plus de trente  ans. Il est beaucoup sollicité de sa clientèle pour la qualité de ses produits.
 Pour satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, il décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ deux  ans . Il est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Son prêt précédent a été remboursé par anticipation.
Avec ce premier prêt, il compte acheter, un  ballon de maillot et un et demi (1 et ½) ballon de chaussettes. Les vêtements sont achetées sur place auprès des grossistes de la ville et revendus en détail au comptant et à crédit.à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes.
Il envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born around 1974 in Sikasso City, Mr. Drissa Traoré resides with his wife in a large traditional extended family in Wayerma II, a working-class district of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). He opted for commerce in clothing, more precisely in second-hand clothing, a business he learned from his father, who is an elderly vendor in the city. He has been in this business for over 30 years and is much in demand by his customers for the quality of his goods To satisfy his burgeoning customer base, Drissa decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso two years ago. He is on his second individual loan. His preceding loan was repaid ahead of schedule. With this loan, he intends to buy a ball of jerseys and one and a half balls of shoes. The clothing is purchased locally from city wholesalers and is resold at the retail level, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of women and men. With this loan, he envisions realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to augment his working capital, to help with family expenses, to make loan interest payments, and to invest the rest in his business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy second-hand clothing

loans.name: Kate

texts.en:
Divorced with two children who are working, Kate Boabeng is 51 years old. She sells foodstuffs like cassava, plantains, maize and gari (manioc couscous) etc., in the local market of Mankessim where she lives. She is been selling there for the past four years, so she has lots of sales experience to win customers.

Kate is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to strengthen her business right now while she is not taking care of her children. She wants to use the loan to buy increased stocks of cassava, plantains, maize, beans and gari, etc. to serve her customers. She would be grateful for your assistance. She belongs to a village bank called ‘Power and might’.

loans.use: To buy increased stocks of cassava, plantains, maize, beans, and gari, etc.

loans.name: Idayat

texts.en: Idayat lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells drinks and provisions. She has been in this business for a long time. Idayat is 61 years old and married with 4 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more drinks and provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and provisions to sell

loans.name: Sodir

texts.ru:
Ашурматов Содир- парень 23 лет, женат, имеет двоих детей. Он занимается продажей женских платков на «Авган базаре» города Худжанда. За товаром ездит сам в Бишкек. Его оборотный капитал среднего уровня. Поэтому для расширения своего  бизнеса Содир хочет получить кредит.
Он планирует съездить за товаром весеннего ассортимента. У него много знакомых , которые покупают у него платки, при мониторинге  было явно видно. Что у Содира стабильная торговля.
texts.en:
A. Sodir is a young 23 year old man; he is married and has two children. He sells women’s handkerchiefs at the “Avgan Bazaar” in the city of Khujand. He travels himself for products to Bishkek. He has an average level of working capital. This is why Sodir would like to get a loan to grow his business. He plans to travel to purchase spring products. He has a lot of acquaintances who purchase handkerchiefs from him. It was obvious during monitoring that Sodir has stable sales.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sale of handkerchiefs

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort E. is forty-four years old. She is married with five children; three are currently in school. She lives with her family at Cape Coast in the central region of Ghana. She is a food vendor and sells "banku" with fried fish. "Banku" is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup.

Comfort has many customers since that dish is enjoyed by many Ghanaian as breakfast, lunch, and supper. She wants to use the loan to buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She hopes to raise increased income to pay for her children’s education. She has been in business for two years now and she belongs to the village bank called ‘Power and might’.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood.

loans.name: Yemi

texts.en: Yemi is 58 years and married with 6 children. She sells crates of eggs wholesale and retail to her customers. Yemi hopes for the loan amount of N 100,000 to purchase more crates of eggs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more crates of eggs to sell

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica L. is 31 years old, She is married and blessed with three children. Her husband serves in the village army in their place of residence.They both work hard for the education of their children.

Veronica has been running a variety store business for almost a year. She sell items according to the demand of her customers. Veronica wants to add more items to her variety store. She is in need of additional money to realize such a plan. She is now applying for a loan from HSPFI, a KIVA partner. Veronica is expecting more improvements in her business from the loan she has requested.

loans.use: to procure additional items for  her variety store

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Alayar

texts.ru: Алаяр Зияев проживает в районе Вахш. В возрасте 61 года. Женат, имеет 5 детей. Алаяр и члены его семьи занимаются земледелием. Этим видом деятельности занимаются более 20 лет. Клиент просит у нас кредит, для закупа минералов, чтобы использовавшись получить хороший урожай картошки и пщеницы.
texts.en:
Alayar Z. lives in the Vakhsh region. He is 61 years old. He is married and has 5 children. Alayar and members of his family work in agriculture. They have been in this business for more than 20 years. The client is asking for credit from us in order to purchase minerals, which he will use to get a good harvest of potatoes and wheat.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase minerals

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Fatoumata Traoré a 54 ans mariée et mère de quatre   enfants (3 garçons et 1 fille) Elle réside avec son époux et leurs enfants à Wayerma II, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso ( troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Fatoumata Traoré est une secrétaire de formation, niveau Certificat d’Aptitude Professionnel (CAP). Après la fermeture d’une structure de l’état appelée   la  C.A.C il y a environ quinze ans, qui avait comme activité principale le stockage et commercialisation des céréales, cette  femme a repris en se lançant dans cette même activité de stockage et commercialisation des  céréales (maïs, mil, sorgho,arachides, fonio, etc.) qui marche bien avec elle. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso  depuis maintenant quatre  ans. Après 3 prêts solidaires (prêt de groupe) dans une association des femmes de son quartier (Association MALI BOMO de Wayerma II), elle est actuellement à son quatrième prêt individuel de stockage et commercialisation. et tous ses prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés. 
Elle compte acheter avec ce prêt 2 sacs de maïs, 3 sacs de Sorgho, 2 sacs d’arachide, 2 sacs de fonio, 4 sacs de mil, etc. Elle s’approvisionne à Zégoua et dans les localités environnantes de Sikasso avant de les stocker  dans son magasin situé au marché de son quartier afin de les revendre en détail à une clientèle composée généralement des chefs de famille.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Fatoumata Traoré, age 54, is married and the mother of four children (3 boys and 1 girl). She resides with her husband and their children in Wayerma II, a working-class district of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She is a secretary by training, achieving the Certificat d’Aptitude Professionnel (CAP). After the closure of a state organization called C.A.C. about 15 years ago that use to stock and to market grains, this women picked up again by getting started in this same business of stocking and marketing grains (corn, millet, sorghum, peanuts, fonio, etc.), which is going well for her. Concerned about doing better in satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso four years ago now. After three solidarity loans (group loans) in a women's association in her area (Association MALI BOMO de Wayerma II), she is now on her fourth individual loan for stocking and marketing. All of her preceding loans have been correctly repaid. With this loan, she intends to buy two sacks of corn, three sacks of sorghum, two sacks of peanuts, two sacks of fonio, four sacks of millet, etc. Supplies of these goods are gotten in Zégoua and in towns surrounding Sikasso. The goods are then stocked in her store located at the marketplace in her district in order to be resold at the retail level. Customers are generally the heads of households. She envisions realizing a monthly profit of 100,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to augment her working capital, to help with family expenses, to make loan interest payments, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains (millet, corn, peanuts, sorghum, etc.)

loans.name: Muattar

texts.ru:
Муаттар  Муродова имеет 10 летний стаж работы в предпринимательской деятельности. На рынке она торгует зеленью и капустой. Так же, Муаттар привозит товар с Узбекистана, города Бекабада, который граничит с Таджикистаном, и разадет своим клиентам оптом.
Дополнительный доход в семью приносит муж Муаттар Аъзамчон, он тоже торгует на рынке. Продает фрукты: яблоки, груши, бананы и мандарины.
Муаттар запрашивает сумму в размере 1300 сомони сроком на 6 месяцев для оборота товара.
 У Муаттар и Аъзамчона 4 детей.
texts.en:
Muattar M. has 10 years of entrepreneurial experience. At the market she sells greens and cabbage. In addition, Muattar brings products from Uzbekistan, from the city of Bekabad which borders Tajikistan and sells it to her clients in wholesale quantities. Muattar’s husband, Ayzamchon brings additional income to the family; he also trades at the market. He sells fruits: apples, pears, bananas and tangerines. Muattar is asking for a sum of 1300 somoni for a in order to turnover products. Muattar and Ayzamchon have 4 children.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Turnover

loans.name: Rohat

texts.ru: Рохат Исобоева в месяц несколько раз ездит за товар в Истаравшан. Дорога трудная и долгая. У нее есть подруги и попутчики в дороге.  Раньше она сидела на улице и торговала , иногда ее прогоняли из-за отсутствия необходымых документов, а для этого нужно внести необходимую сумму. Или арендовать помещение или магази. Обратилась в Микроинвст , получила кредит  и арендовала небольшой участок , для  торговли. Где она может спокойно продавать.
texts.en:
Rohat I. travels to Istaravshan several times a month to buy goods. The road is long and not good. She has friends and companions on it. She used to sit on the street and sell, and sometimes be sent away because she lacked the right documents. She needed to either pay the set price or rent a stall or store. She turned to Microinvest, received a loan, and began renting a small space for sales where she can work in peace.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase sales turnover

loans.name: Uk's Group

texts.en:
This group of borrowers consists of three people. Its leader, Mrs. C., 45, makes a living selling Chinese noodles and porridge in the busy market. She generates an income of approximately US$ 6 each day and started her business back in 2004. Her husband, Savorn, 50 years old, is a staff member for an organization. The humble couple are responsible for two teenage children, both attending school.

C.'s business is running very well and she has gained much profit because she cooks tasty foods for her customers. To earn additional income, C. is looking for a loan to increase her business capital in order to meet her customer's demands.

The other two borrowers are:

B. T., who works as a local chef for wedding parties; she needs a loan as capital to buy wedding equipment so she can rent it out to gain additional income; and

H. who owns a small laundry and provides a clothes-washing service. She is applying for a loan to add to her savings to purchase a used car for her husband to use as a taxi.

The borrowers are people living in Battambang Province.

loans.use: To increase her business capital

loans.name: Mariam

texts.fr:
Née le 17 Octobre 1968 Mariam C. est une femme mariée, mère de six  enfants qui réside avec son époux et leurs enfants à Sanoubougou I, un des quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas eu la chance d’avancer à l’école pour des raisons sociales, cette femme s’est initiée aux  activités de petit commerce avec l’achat et la vente des pagnes wax et des tissus brodés, de chaussures, de bazins etc il y ‘a six  ans environ. Elle est beaucoup sollicitée par sa clientèle (composée essentiellement des femmes) pour la qualité de ses produits.
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’intégrer l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son premier prêt individuel pour acheter, 9 complets de tissus brodés, 30 paires de chaussures féminines, 4 pièces de pagnes wax et 5 complets de bazin moins riche.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        
Elle achète ses marchandises auprès des commerçants grossistes  de la ville, ensuite elle les revend de façon ambulante à Sikasso.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales, payer les intérêts de son prêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Born on October 17, 1968, Mariam C. is a married woman and the mother of six children. She resides with her husband and children in Sanoubougou I, a working-class district of Sikasso (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Having lacked the chance to continue with her schooling, this woman got introduced about six years ago to small-scale businesses buying and selling Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), embroidered fabrics, shoes, damask, etc. She is in high demand by her customers (composed essentially of women) for the quality of her goods. Concerned about doing better in satisfying her burgeoning customer base, she decided to join the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso and is on her first individual loan for buying: 9 outfits of embroidered fabrics, 30 pairs of women's shoes, 4 bolts of Wax pagnes, and 5 outfits of less-rich damask. She makes her purchases from wholesale merchants of the city and then resells them door-to-door in Sikasso. With this loan, she envisions realizing a monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to augment her working capital, to help with family expenses, to make loan interest payments, and to invest the rest in her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cloth, embroidered fabrics, and damask

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia T. is 34 years old; she is married and the mother of two children. Currently both her children are in school. She lives at Mankessim in the central region of Ghana. She is a petty trader who deals in assorted products like cooking utensils and plastic bowls, lunch boxes, etc. She mostly sells through hawking, that is, house to house selling. She has been trading for five years now. She also carries cosmetics products and baby care products.

Lydia has attracted lots of customers who purchase from her. She treks to Accra to purchase her stock of goods. Recently she has been facing challenges in her business as a result of inadequate funds to buy stock. She requests a loan to buy more of the products such as cooking utensils, cosmetics, and baby care products which are frequently demanded by her numerous customers.

With the loan she believes she will be better placed to make lots of profit to build a store to reduce the frequent walking in the street selling her goods. She would be grateful for your assistance. Lydia belongs to a village bank called ‘Power and might.

loans.use: increase her stock of inventory such as cooking utensils

loans.name: Wahab

texts.en: Wahab is 42 years old and married with 5 children. Wahab sells food products and drinks. She is hoping she will receive a loan amount of N100,000 (US$700) to purchase more food and drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more food products and drinks to sell

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Aba A. is fifty-two years old. She is a divorced mother with five children. Currently two of them is in school while three are independent.

Aba has been a food vendor for seven years now. She sells rice with beans stew; this food is mostly purchased by the schoolchildren during their break time. Aba says she has extended her production to serve people in the community as well so when she closes in the morning she would prepare some in the afternoon and sell it in the community market.

Aba wants the loan to buy more bags of fresh rice, meat, vegetable oil and charcoal to avoid price hikes. She is much convinced that the loan would help her increase her profit margin.

She also believes in her ability to save more to support her kids, especially their education, which she believe is the best legacy she want to leave with children. She would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To buy rice, cooking oil, charcoal, spices and meat etc.

loans.name: Alisher

texts.ru: Азамов Алишер проживает в городе Яван. Возраст 22 года. Холост. Живет с родителями в большой и дружной семье. Занимается животноводством. Отец работает в дехканеском хозяйстве. Уход за животными производит сам Алишер. Кроме того он учиться в университете. В его отсутствие за животными присматривает его мать и сноха. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличитьо поголовье скота. Он сможет купить одного породистого бычка.
texts.en:
Alisher A. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 22 years old and single. He lives with his parents and large, friendly family. He practices animal husbandry. His father works on a small farm. Alisher makes a profit from his work with the animals, in addition to studying at the university. When he is gone his mother and daughter in law look after the animals. He decided to request a loan in order to expand his herd. He will be able to buy one pure-bred calf.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase livestock herd

loans.name: Danaya Group

texts.fr:
Les quatre femmes du groupe Danaya sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles polygames avec en moyenne 48ans et 6 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le quartier Bamanan kin de Markala (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de mariage et d’appartenance à une même association traditionnelle des femmes du quartier.
Grâce à la bonne organisation de cette association traditionnelle, elles ont eu à bénéficier de la part de l’ONG ROCAM des formations en teinture, alphabétisation, assainissement et la réorganisation des tontines en caisses de micro crédit avec un intérêt de 10% par mois.
Ce groupe fait le commerce d’articles divers tels les jouets  pour enfants, les galettes  les savons, le bois de chauffe, les jus de boissons, des pagnes wax  etc. 
Dans leurs recherches de ressources financières complémentaires, elles décidèrent de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leurs 4ème prêt solidaire, après avoir bien remboursé les prêts précédents. 
Ce nouveau prêt servira à acheter,  28 pièces de pagnes wax, 57 chargements de charrettes en bois de chauffe, 2 sacs de sucre, 1 carton d’essence, 25 kg de feuilles d’oseilles de Guinée et 25 kg de tamarin. Elles se ravitaillent en différents articles au grand marché de Bamako,  avec les forains de Sansanding et Thien Bamanan, à Diamarabougou et sur les berges du fleuve Niger. Les articles sont vendus en ambulant au marché et de porte en porte à Diamarabougou alors que le bois est d’abord fendu puis mis en tas à domicile pour la revente à une clientèle mixte. 
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 51000FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour payer les frais de santé des enfants.
 Elles ont pour ambition d’avoir une charrette et un âne pour le transport du bois de chauffe et des personnes pour aller dans les différentes foires.
texts.en:
The four women of the group Danaya are married, mostly in polygamous families, and average 48 years of age and 6 children each. The women all live in the Bamanan Kin district of Markala (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali), and they know one another through ties of marriage and membership in the same traditional women's association in the area. Thanks to the correct organizing of this traditional association, they've benefited through the NGO ROCAM from training in the dyeing of cloth, literacy, sanitation, and organizing micro-credit tontines banks with an interest rate of 10% a month. This group does commerce in various goods, such as toys for children, cakes and cookies, soaps, firewood, juices for beverages, Wax pagnes (colorful West African cloth), etc. In their search for supplemental financial resources, the women decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their fourth solidarity loan, after having repaid the preceding ones. This new loan will be used to buy 28 bolts of Wax pagnes, 57 cart-loads of firewood, 2 sacks of sugar, a box of flavorings, 25 kg of dried hibiscus flowers, and 25 kg of tamarind. The group members resupply themselves with different goods at the grand marketplace of Bamako, from the fair vendors of Sansanding and Thien Bamanan, in Diamarabougou, and on the banks of the Niger River. The goods are sold in an itinerant manner at the marketplace and door-to-door in Diamarabougou. The firewood is first split and then placed into basins at home for resale to a mixed customer base. The group members envision realizing an average monthly profit of 51,000 francs CFA that will be used essentially to cover the healthcare costs for the children. Their ambition is to obtain a cart and donkey for transporting firewood and people in order to go to different fairs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Jimoh

texts.en:
Jimoh is a 50-year-old, divorced woman. She is the loving mother of four children.

To make a living, Jimoh sells medicines. She is now seeking a loan in the amount of $700 (100,000 NGN) in order to purchase additional medicines for resale purposes. She thanks all Kiva lenders for their support.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional medicines for resale purposes

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 33-year-old widow. She is the loving mother of three children, all of whom are in school.

For the past ten years, she has earned a living by working as a food vendor. Specifically, she sells rice with gravy stew. From the morning until the afternoon, she sells her food at the community market. Elizabeth explains that there is always high demand for her food.

Elizabeth belongs to a village bank called "Power and Might." She is now seeking a loan to buy more bags of raw materials such as rice, meat, cooking oil, spices, and charcoal. She is convinced that the loan will help her increase her inventory in order to hedge against price hikes, thereby ensuring she has sufficient resources to cook her food. She also wants to use a portion of the loan proceeds to support her children with their education. She is extremely grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To expand and improve her business by purchasing additional raw materials

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie M. is 48 years old. She is married and happily blessed with her nine children. Her husband works in traditional gold mining. While her husband works in mining, she manages her variety store. She sells different items as requested by her customers.

Tessie M. wants to purchase additional items for her variety store because she believes that if her store had a greater inventory it would generate a much higher income. She is now applying for a loan offered by HSPFI, a KIVA partner. From this, all her plans for her business will be realized.

loans.use: To purchase additional items for her variety store

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Nzovwe '1' Group

texts.en:
Tumaini has been a clothes seller in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya.  She currently makes very little monthly profit. Every day she works at her business for 12 hours.  


She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more clothes for resale to expand her business. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  


Tumaini is married and has given birth to two children ages 9 and 3. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Sifa, who has her own small business, a small shop in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Nzovwe '1' B Group

texts.en:
Rose has owned a small hotel in the Nzovwe neighborhood of Mbeya.  She currently earns a little monthly profit. Daily she works at her business for 12 hours.  


She is requesting her first loan from BRAC Tanzania so that she can buy more food items for her business. She is hoping that through this loan her profit will increase and she will be able to grow her business.  


Rose is  married, and has five children: ages 20, 18, 15, 11 and 9. She will be sharing this loan with her fellow group member, Eva, who has her own small business selling alcohol in Mbeya.

loans.use: To buy more food items for her business.

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.ru: Хошимов Муроджон- кредитор в Микроинвест с 2006 года. Все свои кредиты он пунктуально погашает, не нарушая условий Фонда. Займы он использует на свой основной бизнес ( ремонт автомашин). Он покупает запасные  части и предложив клиентам , устанавливает и перепродаёт им вместе с оплатой за установку и ремонт авто. За хорошее обслуживание и качественный ремонт к нему обращаются многие водители автомашин . За три года кредитования он ни разу не нарушил условий Фонда и использование займов.
texts.en:
