H. Murodjon has been a borrower of MicroInvest since 2006. He pays all of his loans back on time and does not violate the terms of the Fund. He uses the loans for his main business (auto repair). He purchases spare parts and after offering them to customers, he installs them and resells them together with the payment for installation and vehicle repair. Many car drivers turn to him for his good service and quality repairs. During three years of borrowing he did not once violate the terms of the Fund and the use of the loans.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Auto repair

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella, 35 and married with five children, owns a boutique where she sells bags and clothes. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more bags to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more bags to sell.

loans.name: Salatu

texts.en: Salatu Salidish, a 42-year-old married mother of one child in school, is a food vendor who sells waakye. Sold as breakfast, waakye is a tasty and satisfying dish of cooked rice and beans enjoyed with stew, macaroni and fish.  Almost all tribes in Ghana eat waakye. Salatu also sells groundnuts, beans and yams in the community market and is requesting a loan to buy more bags of rice, beans, and yams to increase her stock of goods.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, beans, and yams to increase her stock of goods.

loans.name: Kanoumafin Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Kanoumafin est composé de femmes 2 veuves et 4 femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames. Elles ont en moyenne 52 ans et 4 enfants et habitent toutes le quartier Bamanan kin de Markala (4ème Région administrative du Mali).
Ce groupe de femmes est aussi encadré par l’ONG ROCAM dans le domaine de la teinture, alphabétisation, assainissement et la réorganisation des tontines en caisses de micro crédit  avec un intérêt de 10% par mois. 
Ce groupe fait  le commerce de produits cosmétiques, de pagnes, de céréales, de chaussures, de condiments alimentaires, du savon etc.
Afin de satisfaire le besoin de leurs clientèles, les membres du groupe ont intégré le programme crédit solidaire de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 4ème  prêt solidaire, après avoir bien remboursé les prêts précédents. 
Ce prêt sera utilisé pour acheter, 57pièces de pagnes wax, 2 sacs de maïs, 2 sacs de riz, 1sac de haricot, 1 sac d’oignon de 25 kg, 1 sac de savon local contenant 300 morceaux et 20 paires de chaussures. Elles se ravitaillent en pagnes wax et chaussures au grand marché de Bamako, en céréales à Koutiala, en oignon et savons à la foire de Diamarabougou. Les produits sont revendus à crédit ou au comptant dans les foires de Diamarabougou, Sibila, Boussin, Dougabougou et Siribala à une clientèle mixte. 
Elles comptent  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 43 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  pour augmenter leur fonds de commerce et acheter petit à petit des trousseaux de mariage pour leurs filles.
texts.en:
The group Kanoumafin is composed of women (2 widows and 4 who are married) mostly in monogamous families. The women average 52 years of age and 4 children each. They all live in the Bamanan Kin district of Markala (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). This group of women is also trained by the NGO ROCAM in the dyeing of cloth, literacy, sanitation, and organizing micro-credit tontines banks with an interest rate of 10% a month. This group does commerce in cosmetics, pagnes (colorful West African cloth), grains, shoes, condiments, soap, etc. To satisfy customer needs, the group members joined the Soro Yiriwaso loan program and are on their fourth solidarity loan, after having indeed repaid their preceding loans. This current loan will be used to buy 57 bolts of Wax pagnes, two sacks of corn, two sacks of rice, a sack of beans, a 25-kg sack of onions, a 300-count sack of local soap, and 20 pairs of shoes. The women resupply themselves with Wax pagnes and shoes at the grand marketplace of Bamako; with grains in Koutiala; and with onions and soaps at the Diamarabougou fair. The goods are resold to a mixed customer base, cash or credit accepted, at the fairs of Diamarabougou, Sibila, Boussin, Dougabougou, and Siribala. The group members intend to realize an average monthly profit of 43,000 francs CFA that will use to augment their working capital and to buy trousseaux, little by little, for their daughters.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Giyos

texts.ru: Алиев Гиез , житель города Яван. Возраст 49 лет, женат и имеет двоих детей. имеет средне техническое образование. По профессии гидротехник. Проработал 20 лет по профессии. В данный момент работает в сельском хозяйстве.Сеет овощи и злаковые культуры. Получаемый урожай реализует на рынке. Частично продукцию оставляет семье. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить удобрения для обработки  земли. Это поможет ему получить качественный урожай.Полученную прибыль планирует использовать для того, чтобы устроить сына в университет.
texts.en:
Giyos A. lives in the city of Yavan. He is 49 years old, married, and has two children. He completed a vocational education. He is a hydraulic engineer by training, an area in which he worked for 20 years. Currently he works in agriculture, growing vegetables and grains to sell at market. Part of the harvest is kept for the family. He decided to request a loan to buy fertilizer to improve the land. This will help him raise a high-quality product. The profit earned will go toward sending his son to university.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Merry Joy

texts.en: Merry Joy L. is 23 years old. She is married and and blessed with two children. Her husband is a farmer. They both work hard for the future of their children. Merry Joy owns a variety store in their village where she sells different goods. She wants it to earn more income so she applied for a loan offered by HSPFI, a KIVA partner. If her loan is granted to her, she will be using it to procure additional items for her variety store to generate a much higher income and allow her to save for her family needs. She is looking forward to more improvement in her business with the help and assistance of the organization.

loans.use: Procurement of additional goods intended for variety store

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
Adil M. is 55 years old. He is married and the father of four children. Adil owns a grocery store and provides for his family with the revenue generated by this business. In addition, he works as a head of municipality of his village.

He is requesting a loan of $1,200 in order to increase the stock of foodstuffs in his grocery store., as well as to buy construction materials.

Adil is ready to work even harder, to make sacrifices, and to push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is for his children to progress by means of pursuing their education, a goal toward which he is doing his best. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To increase inventory and buy construction materials

loans.name: Dilrabo

texts.ru:
Дилрабо Сабурова родилась в 1970 году по национальности таджичка, замужем, любящая мать 3 детей. Место жительство Дилрабо и ее семьи город Истаравшан.
Дилрабо торгует на рынке зеленью, и соленьями (солеными огурцами, помидорами, маринованным горным луком, который называется Анзур и т.д.)
Дилрабо привозит товар с города Худжанда, продает сама, а так же оптом и в розницу.
Супруг Дилрабо занимается сельским хозяйством, выращивает яблони, и получает семейный доход от реализации урожая яблок, в осенний период.
Дилрабо подала заявку на получение займа 1300 сомони на 6 месяцев, с целью товарооборота.
texts.en:
Dilrabo S., born in 1970, of Tajik nationality, is married and the loving mother of three children. She and her family live in the city of Istaravshan. Dilrabo sells leafy green vegetables and pickled vegetables (tomatoes, cucumbers, the Anzur mountain onion, etc.) She transports the goods from the city of Khudjand, and sells them herself, wholesale as well as retail. Dilrabo's husband, a farmer, raises apples and receives income from selling the apple harvest in fall. Dilrabo applied for a 1300 somoni, 6 month loan, for sales turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sales turnover

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas is 45 years old and married with 2 children. Dorcas sells provisions. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouman est composé de 2 veuves, 2 polygames et 2 monogames  vivant toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies avec un âge moyen de 44 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes le quartier Bamanan kin de Markala (4ème Région administrative du Mali).
Le groupe Sabougnouman fait le commerce de fruits, de pagnes, des jus de fruits de fabrication locale, du savon, des ustensiles de cuisine etc.
Dans le souci d’augmenter leur fonds de commerce, les femmes décidèrent de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elles sont à leur 4ème prêt solidaire, après avoir bien remboursés les prêts précédents.
Le prêt servira à acheter, 21 pièces de pagnes wax, 1sac de savon contenant 300 morceaux, un chargement de charrette de mangue, 7 colis de calebasses et des louches. Elles se ravitaillent en pagnes wax au grand marché de Bamako, en mangues et savons à la foire de Diamarabougou, en calebasses et louches à la foire de Tona. Les produits sont revendus à crédit ou au comptant en ambulant dans les quartiers de Markala et dans les foires de Diamarabougou et Sibila à une clientèle mixte. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 46 000FCFA qui va servira pour la nourriture et les frais scolaires des enfants. 
Elles ont pour ambition d’épargner et de devenir grossistes dans la vente du savon et de l’aliment bétail.
texts.en:
The group Sabougnouman is composed of two widows, two who are polygamous, and two who are monogamous. They all live in traditional extended families and average 44 years of age and 5 children each. They all live in the Bamanan Kin district of Markala (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members do commerce in fruit, pagnes (colorful West African cloth), locally-made fruit juices, soap, kitchen utensils, etc. Concerned about augmenting their working capital, the women decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their fourth solidarity loan, after having repaid the preceding ones. This loan will be used to buy 21 bolts of Wax pagnes, a 300-count sack of soap, a cart-load of mangoes, seven parcels of calabash bowls, and some ladles. The women resupply themselves with Wax pagnes at the grand marketplace of Bamako; with mangoes and soaps at the Diamarabougou fair; and with bowls and ladles at the Tona fair. The goods are resold to a mixed customer base, cash or credit accepted, in the districts of Markala going door-to-door, and at the fairs of Diamarabougou and Sibila. The women hope to realize an average monthly profit of 46,000 francs CFA that will be used for food and for covering the children's schooling costs. Their ambition is to save money and to become wholesalers selling soap and livestock feed.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods

loans.name: Yin's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by three borrowers, all of whom live in ChomKa SamRong Commune in Battambang Province. The group leader, Mrs. Yin R., is 28 years old. She sells brooms that she buys in bulk from a broom-maker who lives near her house. She sells her products at retail in the local market and earns around $US3 per day. Her husband, Horm Vet, 33, is a motorbike taxi driver as well as a wooden house builder. Yin R. has given birth to two teenage children who are school age. Yin R. wants to earn extra income by taking a loan on Kiva in order to purchase more brooms to sell. The other two borrowers are:
L., a vegetable grower, who is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer and insecticide for growing crops, and 
R., who is applying for a loan to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.use: To purchase brooms to sell

loans.name: Zulaiho

texts.ru:
Зулайхо- женщина, которая  кредитуется с 2005 года на поддержку бизнеса продажи домашней обуви. Зулайхо начинала свой бизнес с ассортимента  детской обуви, а на сегодняшний день у неё во много увеличился и изменился. За товаром она ездит сама Зулайхо в Истаравшан, на оптовый рынок. Её товар в основном Китайского производства, различные домашние тапочки и шлёпанцы.
Она клиент с хорошим моральным обликом, которую удовлетворяют все условия фонда.
texts.en:
Zulaiho has been receiving loans since 2005 to support her business selling indoor shoes. She began the business with children's shoes but since then it has expanded and changed in many ways. To buy the goods Zulaiho travels by herself to the wholesale market in Istaravshan. The slippers and slip-on shoes she sells are mostly produced in China. She is a client with a strong moral character, who fulfills all of the program's criteria.

Translated from Russian by Anna Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Indoor shoe sales

loans.name: Ets Ecomin Group

texts.fr: ETS ECOMIN est une pharmacie détenue par un groupe de personnes. Ils résidents tous à Wome, un village situé à environ 130 kilomères de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. leur ambition est de répondre aux besoins pharmaceutiques de la population et des villages environnants. Avec ce crédit ils pensent approvisionner leur magasin afin de satisfaire aux exigences de la clientèle. Ce crédit leur permettra d’augmenter leurs recettes et par conséquent améliorer leurs conditions de vie respectives.
texts.en:
ETS ECOMIN is a pharmacy run by a group of people. They all reside in Wome, a village situated 130 km from Lomé, the Togolese capital. Their ambition is to respond to the pharmaceutical needs of the population and of surrounding villages. With this loan, they intend to stock their shop so as to satisfy the demands of their clientele. This loan will permit them to increase the money they earn and thus improve their respective living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stocking their little pharmacy

loans.name: Slađana's Group

texts.en: Slađana Nešković is 31. She has two children and a husband who is employed as a seasonal worker. Most of their costs are paid from Slađana`s husband's salary. Slađana keeps goats and sheep and provides extra income for her family. She gets goatlings and lambs from her goats and sheep. Then she raises and resells them. That helps a lot in periods when her husband doesn`t work. Slađana is requesting her first loan in MFI WWI in the amount of 1500 KM to buy more goats and sheep to increase the flock. Slađana wants to provide more income for her family in case her husband loses his job.

loans.use: To purchase goats and sheep to resell

loans.name: Alimata

texts.fr:
Madame  Alimata B. est âgée de 54 ans,  mariée  et mère de 7 enfants. Elle vit dans une famille nucléaire avec son mari et ses enfants au quartier Darsalam  de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Elle débuta  le commerce depuis sa jeune enfance  auprès de ses 2 parents qui étaient  tous deux commerçants. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage auprès des siens et ayant mieux maîtrisé les rouages du commerce, elle commença à mener en solo des activités génératrices de revenus telles  la vente d’habits, de chaussures, d’ustensiles de cuisines, la fabrication des jus de boissons locales non alcoolisées et de la glace. 
Pour faire son jus elle utilise 5 kg de sucre, 1 kg de gingembres, 2 kg de tamarin, 20 sachets de sucre vanilles et 4 sachets de poudre de jus (banane,  mangue et orange). Le tout est mélangé dans 1 litre et ½  d’eau  afin d’avoir le goût recherché et mis  dans des bidons soigneusement lavés. Ce bidon de jus de boisson non alcoolisée est mis dans le réfrigérateur pour refroidissement pendant des heures entières.
C’est dans le souci de renforcer son fonds de commerce, qu’elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso  depuis maintenant  4 ans. Après  4 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels correctement bien remboursés, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter, 2 sacs de sucre, 2 cartons de poudre de jus et 20 complets de draps de lit. Elle s’approvisionne en matières premières pour le jus à Bamako (capitale du Mali) et pour les draps au Burkina Faso.
Madame Alimata B. vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Avec ce prêt elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000FCFA qui lui servira à  rembourser ses échéances et  de mettre en valeur  petit à petit sa maison à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Ms. Alimata B., age 54, is married and the mother of seven. She lives in a nuclear family with her husband and children in the Darsalam district of the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). She began in commerce in early childhood with her two parents, who were both merchants. After several years of apprenticeship among her loved ones and having an improved command of the inner workings of commerce, she started to work in business on her own, earning an income by selling clothing, shoes, and kitchen utensils and by making juices for local soft drinks and ice cream. To make her soft drinks, she uses 5 kg of sugar, 1 kg of ginger, 2 kg of tamarind, 20 bags of vanilla sugar, and 4 bags of juice powder (banana, mango, and orange). It is all mixed in 1.5 liters of water in order to obtain the taste desired, and then it's put into carefully-washed drums. These drums of non-alcoholic juice drink are put into the refrigerator to cool down for hours. Concerned about boosting her working capital, she turned toward Soro Yiriwaso four years ago. After four solidarity loans and two individual loans, correctly repaid, she is now on her third individual loan, which she intends to use to buy two sacks of sugar, two boxes of juice powder, and 20 sets of bed sheets. Supplies of raw materials for the drinks are gotten in Bamako (capital of Mali); for the bed sheets, in Burkina Faso. Ms. B. makes her sales to customers composed of women and men, cash or credit accepted. With this loan, she plans to realize a monthly profit of 30,000 francs CFA that will be used to make loan payments and to enhance little by little the house in which she lives.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic ingredients for juice drinks and some bed sheets

loans.name: Ryan

texts.en: Ryan L. is 21 years old.  He is still single and currently resides in Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. He is engaged in buying and selling bananas. For him to generate a much higher income, he needs additional capital to purchase additional stock. For him to realize such plans for his business, he applied for a loan from HSPFI, a KIVA partner. He is looking forward to a positive response to his request.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mamata

texts.fr: Mamata A. est une femme de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. elle est propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale à Wome. Elle exerce ce commerce depuis 7 ans. Avec ce crédit, Mamata souhaite accroître la capacité de son commerce en approvisionnant son magasin. Ce crédit lui permettra d’augmenter ses recttes et par conséquent mieux satisfaire les besoins de la famille
texts.en:
Mamata A., 45, is married and the mother of 3 children. She owns a little grocery store in Wome. She has been in this business for 7 years. With this loan, Mamata hopes to grow her store by adding to the inventory. This loan will permit her to increase her earnings from the store and thus be able to support her family better.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: stocking her store with merchandise

loans.name: Fatoumata

texts.fr:
Madame  Fatoumata A. est âgée de 61 ans,  mariée et mère de 8 enfants, elle vit dans une famille traditionnelle  avec son mari, ses enfants et plusieurs ménages dans le quartier Darsalam de la ville de Ségou  (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas été à l’école par refus de ses parents qui voyaient  l’école comme une porte de déperdition de la fille, elle débuta le petit commerce auprès de sa mère qui vendait des habits en cotonnade. A son mariage elle changea d’activité pour mener celle de son mari qui est la restauration. Après  des expériences dans ce secteur, elle finira par opter pour la vente de jus de boisson non alcoolisée de fabrication locale et de la glace alimentaire  depuis  maintenant 15 ans.
Pour faire son jus elle utilise 10 kg de sucre, 2kg de gingembres, 2 kg de tamarin, 30 sachets de sucre vanilles et 2 sachets de poudre de jus (banane et orange). Le tout est mélangé dans 3 litres d’eau  afin d’avoir le goût recherché. Des bidons soigneusement lavés seront remplis de ce jus et mis dans le réfrigérateur pour refroidissement. 
C’est dans  le but de renforcer et de diversifier  son activité  qu’elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 36 mois, après 4 prêts solidaires et 1 prêt individuel tous  bien remboursés, elle  est à son 2ème prêt individuel.
Elle compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 1 nouveau réfrigérateur. Elle s’approvisionne en cet équipement sur place à Ségou. Madame  Fatoumata A. vend chez elle et au grand marché de Ségou  au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA, qui lui permettra  de subvenir aux dépenses familiales telles la nourriture, et de rembourser son prêt.
texts.en:
Ms. Fatoumata A., age 61, is married and the mother of eight. She lives in a traditional family with her husband, children, and several families in the Darsalam district of the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). Not having gone to school due to the refusal of her parents, who thought schooling is wasted on girls, she began working in small-scale commerce with her mother, who used to sell cotton clothing. Upon marrying, Fatoumata switched to working in her husband's restaurant business. With some experience in this field, she finally opted 15 years ago for selling non-alcoholic juice drinks and ice cream. To make her drinks, she uses 10 kg of sugar, 2 kg of ginger, 2 kg of tamarind, 30 bags of vanilla sugar, and 2 bags of juice powder (banana and orange). It is all mixed together in three liters of water to obtain the desired taste. Carefully-washed drums will be filled with the juice and put into the refrigerator to chill. With the goal of bolstering and diversifying her business, she turned toward Soro Yiriwaso. She has been associated with this institution for 36 months. After four solidarity loans and one individual loan, all correctly repaid, she is now on her second individual loan. She intends to use this loan to buy a new refrigerator, locally in Ségou. Fatoumata makes her sales out of her home and at the grand marketplace of Ségou to customers composed of men and women, cash or credit accepted. She plans to realize a monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA that will enable her to cover family expenses, such as food, and to repay her loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr:
Madame  Kadiatou   K.  est âgée de 34 ans,  divorcée et mère d’un  enfant, elle vit  chez son père dans une famille nucléaire avec ses parents et sœurs au quartier Darsalam  de la ville de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Enseignante de formation, elle débuta  le commerce depuis  élève auprès  de sa mère qui vendait des habits et ustensiles de cuisines importés des pays limitrophes. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage auprès de cette dernière et riche de l’expérience de cette dernière, elle commença à exercer le commerce d’habits, de chaussures et de produits de beauté depuis 15 ans. Elle tient sa boutique dans un endroit bien  fréquenté de la ville de Ségou.
Pour renforcer son fonds de commerce dans l’optique de satisfaire sa clientèle  et de réaliser plus de bénéfices, elle fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso. Elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 42 mois, après 3 prêts solidaires et 2 prêts individuels tous correctement bien remboursés, elle est à son 3ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser pour acheter 1 douzaine de pièces  de  pagnes real et 1 douzaine de pièces de pagnes wax. 
Elle s’approvisionne  à Bamako (capitale du Mali) auprès des grossistes et effectue sa vente au comptant en détail et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 75 000 FCFA qui servira à payer la scolarité de son enfant et de prendre en charge l’entretien de la famille. Son ambition est d’ouvrir une grande boutique de prêt-à-porter à Ségou.
texts.en:
Ms. Kadiatou K., age 34, is divorced and the mother of a child. She lives at her father's place in a nuclear family with her parents and sister in the Darsalam district of the city of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). A teacher by training, she began working in commerce when a pupil along side her mother, who used to sell clothing and kitchen utensils imported from bordering countries. After several years of apprenticeship and a wealth of experience with her mother, she started doing commerce in clothing, shoes, and beauty products 15 years ago. She has a shop in a very busy location in Ségou City. To boost her working capital with the aim of satisfying her customers and realizing more profits, she turned toward Soro Yiriwaso. She has been associated with this micro-finance institution for 42 months. After three solidarity loans and two individual loans, all correctly repaid, she is now on her third individual loan, which she intends to use for buying a dozen bolts of REAL pagnes (colorful West African cloth) and a dozen bolts of WAX pagnes. Supplies are gotten in Bamako (capital of Mali) from wholesalers. Sales are made to customers composed of women and men, cash or credit accepted. She plans to realize a monthly profit of 75,000 francs CFA that will be used to cover the schooling costs for her child and to care for her family. Her ambition is to open a large ready-to-wear clothing shop in Ségou.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing

loans.name: Koffi

texts.fr: Koffi S. est un homme de 35 ans, marié et père de 2 enfants. il est propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale à Kpalimé, une ville située à 120 kilomètres de Lomé. Il exerce ce commerce depuis 5 ans. Pour être plus compétitif sur le marché, koffi souhaite avec ce crédit approvisionner son magasin.
texts.en:
Koffi S., 35, is married and the father of 2 children. He owns a general store in Kpalimé, a town situated 120 km from Lomé. He has been working at this business for 5 years. To be more competitive in the marketplace, Koffi hopes to stock his store using this loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing merchandise for resale

loans.name: Kehinde

texts.en: Kehinde is 45 years old and married with four children. She lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells medicines. Kehinde hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Sadifa

texts.en: Sadifa Oštraković was born in 1963. She is married and has two children. She comes from an entrepreneurial village. Her husband works outside of Bosnia and comes home from time to time. Sadifa has worked in farming for a long time and she has been our client for years. She took three loans from MCF WWI and repaid them successfully. All loans were invested in the poultry business and Sadifa has developed a network for the sale of chicken meat. So, she requested her fourth loan in the amount of 800 KM to purchase poultry. Sadifa`s wish is to build her own poulterer and keep this business running.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Akif

texts.en: Akif K. has dedicated himself to raising sheep since 2000. He is a married father who supports his one daughter. His wife also helps him with the business. Akif is faced with the need to purchase more sheep. The animals Akif raises are sold to farmers. To acquire the animals, Akif has come to AqroInvest to obtain the necessary credit so he can continue to maintain his dear home.

loans.use: To purchase 12 sheep.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en: Rosie E. is 34 years old. She is married and blessed with seven children. Her husband does traditional gold mining, locally known as "pamiling". Rosie thinks of a way that she could help her husband in raising their family and in providing for the needs of their children. She decided to put up a variety store from the amount she received from HSPFI, a KIVA partner, when she took her first cycle loan. As of now, she is applying for her third loan. If granted, the amount will be used to purchase additional items for her variety store. She will gain more income and be able to provide for the needs of her children.

loans.use: To procure additional items for her variety store

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Khun's Group

texts.en:
This is a small loan for three women who are living in Battambang Province, Cambodia. Khun V., 53, has been selected to be group leader by the other members. Khun V. is a widowed mother who has given birth to six children: three are married and have ready started their own family, whilst the others are still single. Three of her children are employed at different jobs.

Khun V. and her husband currently earn their daily income by sewing clothes. Most of their clients are neighbors who live near their house. Khun V. is applying for a loan in order to purchase more tailoring tools to support their investment.

The other two borrowers are:

S., 46, is a grocery seller who is looking for a loan to expand her business selling groceries.

R., 59, is a fish seller who is requesting a loan in order to increase her quantity of dried-fish to sell.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring tools to support her business
